analyzed: sa āṅgaṇam cittam sa āṅgaṇam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows a mind with conflict as it really is as a mind with conflict.

original: anaṅgaṇaṃ cittam anaṅgaṇaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /🔽sottaraṃ /
analyzed: anaṅgaṇam cittam anaṅgaṇam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti  sa uttaram
translated: He knows a mind without conflict as it really is as a mind without conflict.

original: cittaṃ sottaraṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: cittam sa uttaram cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows a superior mind as it really is as a superior mind.🔽He knows an unexcelled mind as it really is as an unexcelled mind.

original: anuttaraṃ cittam anuttaraṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: anuttaram cittam anuttaram cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it really is that the unsurpassed mind is the unsurpassed mind.

original: tena ca na manyate /
analyzed: tena ca na manyate
translated: He does not think of it as such.

original: tathā hi tac cittam acittam acintyatām upādāya /
analyzed: tathā hi tat cittam acittam a cintya tām upādāya
translated: Because that mind is a non-mind, in terms of inconceivability.

original: so 'haṃ prajānāmīti na manyate /
analyzed: saḥ ham prajānāmi iti na manyate
translated: He does not think, I know that.

original: tad eva cittaṃ nopalabhate svabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: tat eva cittam na upalabhate svabhāva śūnyatām upādāya
translated: He does not apprehend that very mind, in terms of the emptiness of its own nature.

original: svabhāvaviviktatām upādāya svabhāvānupalabdhitām upādāya /
analyzed: svabhāva vivikta tām upādāya svabhāva anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: In terms of the isolation of its own nature, in terms of the non-apprehension of its own nature.

original: na sa paracittacetanām apy utpādayati /
analyzed: na sa para citta cetanām api utpādayati
translated: He does not even arouse a thought of another's mind.

original: na paracittābhinirhāracetanāṃ vānyatrasarvākārajñatāmanasikārāt / evaṃ hi śāriputra
analyzed: na para citta abhinirhāra cetanām vā anyatra sarva ākāra jña tā manasikārāt evam hi śāriputra
translated: He does not arouse a thought of accomplishing another's mind, except for the attention on complete knowing. In this way, Śāriputra,

original: bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran sarvasattvacittacaritābhijñāsākṣātkriyājñānam abhinirharati /
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran sarva sattva citta carita abhijñā sākṣātkriyā jñānam abhinirharati
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom manifests the knowledge of directly realizing the activities of the minds of all beings.

original: pūrvanivāsānusmṛtijñānena sa ekām api jātim anusmarati /
analyzed: pūrva nivāsa anusmṛti jñānena saḥ ekām api jātim anusmarati
translated: With the knowledge of recollecting past lives, he recollects one birth.

original: dve tisro yāvaj jātiśatasahasrāṇy apy anusmarati /🔽sa ekam api cittam anusmarati yāvac cittaśatam api /
analyzed: dve tisraḥ yāvat jāti śata sahasrāṇi api anusmarati  saḥ ekam api cittam anusmarati yāvat citta śatam api
translated: He recollects two, three, up to a hundred thousand births.🔽He recollects one mind, up to a hundred minds.

original: ekam api divasaṃ divasaśatam api /
analyzed: ekam api divasam divasa śatam api
translated: He recollects one day, up to a hundred days.

original: ekam api māsaṃ māsaśatam api /🔽ekam api varṣaṃ varṣaśatam api /
analyzed: ekam api māsam māsa śatam api  ekam api varṣam varṣa śatam api
translated: One month, up to a hundred months.🔽One year, up to a hundred years.

original: ekam api kalpaṃ kalpaśatam api /
analyzed: ekam api kalpam kalpa śatam api
translated: One eon, up to a hundred eons.

original: anekāni api kalpaśatāny anekāny api kalpasahasrāṇy anekāny api kalpaśatasahasrāṇy anekāny api kalpakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrāṇi anusmarati yāvat
analyzed: anekāni api kalpa śatāni anekāni api kalpa sahasrāṇi anekāni api kalpa śata sahasrāṇi anekāni api kalpa koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi anusmarati yāvat
translated: Many hundreds of eons, many thousands of eons, many hundreds of thousands of eons, many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of eons, many hundreds of thousands of koṭis of eons, many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of eons, up to

original: pūrvāntakoṭīm apy anusmarati /🔽amutrāham āsam evaṃnāmā evaṃgotra evaṃjātir evamāhāra evaṃcirasthitikaḥ /
analyzed: pūrva anta koṭīm api anusmarati  amutra aham āsam evaṃnāmā evaṃgotraḥ evaṃjātiḥ evam āhāraḥ evaṃcirasthitikaḥ
translated: he remembers the former end.

original: evamāyuṣparyantaḥ /🔽sa tataś cyuto 'mutropapannaḥ /
analyzed: evam āyuṣparyantaḥ  sa tatas cyutaḥ mutrā upapannaḥ
translated: I was there, of such-and-such a name, of such-and-such a family, of such-and-such a caste, of such-and-such a food, enduring such-and-such experiences, having such-and-such a life span, such-and-such a long life, such-and-such an end of life.🔽Having passed away from there, I was reborn there.

original: tataś cyuta ihāsmy upapanna iti /
analyzed: tatas cyutaḥ iha asmi upapannaḥ iti
translated: Having passed away from there, I was reborn here.

original: sa evaṃ sākāraṃ sādṛśaṃ sanirdeśam anekavidhaṃ pūrvanivāsam anusmarati /
analyzed: saḥ evam sa ākāram sādṛśam sa nirdeśam anekavidham pūrva nivāsam anusmarati
translated: Thus he remembers his various former abodes with their aspects, details, and particulars.

original: tena ca pūrvanivāsānusmṛtyabhijñānena na manyate /
analyzed: tena ca pūrva nivāsa anusmṛti abhijñānena na manyate
translated: And by that knowledge of recollecting past abodes, he does not become conceited,

original: tathā hi tajjñānam ajñānam acintyatām upādāya /
analyzed: tathā hi tat jñānam ajñānam a cintya tām upādāya
translated: because that knowledge is unknowing, considering the inconceivable.

original: so 'haṃ prajānāmīti na manyate /
analyzed: saḥ ham prajānāmi iti na manyate
translated: He does not become conceited, thinking I know.

original: sa tad eva jñānaṃ nopalabhate svabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya svabhāvaviviktatām upādāya svabhāvānupalabdhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sa tat eva jñānam na upalabhate svabhāva śūnya tām upādāya svabhāva vivikta tām upādāya svabhāva anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: He does not apprehend that very knowledge, on account of the emptiness of own-being, on account of the isolation of own-being, on account of the non-apprehension of own-being.

original: na sa pūrvanivāsānusmṛticetanām apy utpādayati /
analyzed: na sa pūrva nivāsa anusmṛti cetanām api utpādayati
translated: He does not even produce the volition for the recollection of past lives.

original: na pūrvanivāsānusmṛtyabhinirhāracetanāṃ vā anyatra sarvākārajñatāmanasikārāt / evaṃ
analyzed: na pūrva nivāsa anusmṛti abhinirhāra cetanām vā anyatra sarva ākāra jña tā manasikārāt evam
translated: Or the volition for the realization of the recollection of past lives, except for the attention on universal knowledge.

original: hi śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran pūrvanivāsānusmṛtisākṣātkriyājñānam abhinirharati /
analyzed: hi śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran pūrva nivāsa anusmṛti sākṣātkriyā jñānam abhinirharati
translated: In this way, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom realizes the knowledge of the realization of the recollection of past lives.

original: sa divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhenātikrāntamānuṣyakeṇa sattvān paśyati cyavamānān utpadyamānān suvarṇān durvarṇān hīnān praṇītān sugatau durgatau
analyzed: sa divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhena atikrānta mānuṣyakeṇa sattvān paśyati cyavamānān utpadyamānān suvarṇān durvarṇān hīnān praṇītān sugatau durgatau
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings passing away and being reborn, beautiful and ugly, of good and bad destinies, according to their actions.

original: yathākarmopagān sattvān prajānāti /
analyzed: yathā karma upagān sattvān prajānāti
translated: He understands beings according to their actions.

original: amī bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ /
analyzed: amī bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ
translated: These beings, friends,

original: kāyasucaritena samanvāgatāḥ vāksucaritena samanvāgatāḥ manaḥsucaritena samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: kāya su caritena samanvāgatāḥ vāc su caritena samanvāgatāḥ manaḥ su caritena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: are endowed with bodily good conduct, endowed with verbal good conduct, endowed with mental good conduct,

original: āryāṇām anapavādakāḥ samyagdṛṣṭayaḥ tena kāyavāṅmanaḥsucaritena hetunā sugatau svargaloka upapadyante /
analyzed: āryāṇām anapavādakāḥ samyak dṛṣṭayaḥ tena kāya vāc manaḥ su caritena hetunā sugatau svarga loke upapadyante
translated: They are not denigrators of the noble ones, and have right views. By that cause, that reason, that source, that basis, that origin, that condition—namely, good bodily, verbal, and mental conduct—they are reborn in a good realm of existence, in the heavenly world.

original: ime punar bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāyaduścaritena samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: ime punar bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāya duścaritena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: “These beings, endowed with bad bodily actions,

original: vāgduścaritena samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: vāc duścaritena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: endowed with bad verbal actions,

original: manoduścaritena samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ duścaritena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: and endowed with bad mental actions,

original: āryāṇām apavādakāḥ mithyādṛṣṭayas te mithyādṛṣṭikarmasamādānahetoḥ kāyasya bhedāt paraṃ maraṇād apāyadurgativinipātaṃ narakeṣūpapadyante /
analyzed: āryāṇām apavādakāḥ mithyādṛṣṭayaḥ te mithyādṛṣṭi karma samādāna hetoḥ kāyasya bhedāt param maraṇāt apāya durgati vinipātam narakeṣu upapadyante
translated: denigrate the noble ones, have wrong views, and acquire actions based on wrong views. Because of that cause, that reason, that source, that basis, that origin, that condition—namely, acquiring actions based on wrong views—when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a bad realm of existence, in an unfortunate state, in hell.

original: iti hi divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhenātikrāntamānuṣyakeṇa daśadiśi loke sarvalokadhātuṣu
analyzed: iti hi divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhena atikrānta mānuṣyakeṇa daśa diśi loke sarva lokadhātuṣu
translated: Thus, with his divine eye, which is purified and surpasses that of (normal) men, he sees, in the world systems in all ten directions, as many as they are,

original: dharmadhātuparame ākāśadhātuparyavasāne ṣaḍgatikānāṃ sattvānāṃ cyutopapādaṃ yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: dharmadhātu parame ākāśa dhātu paryavasāne ṣaṣ gatikānām sattvānām cyuta upapādam yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: the passing away and rebirth of beings in the six destinies, as they really are.

original: tena ca na manyate tathā hi tac cakṣur acakṣur acintyatām upādāya /
analyzed: tena ca na manyate tathā hi tat cakṣuḥ a cakṣuḥ a cintya tām upādāya
translated: And he does not think about that, because that eye is not an eye, due to inconceivability.

original: so 'haṃ paśyāmīti na manyate /
analyzed: saḥ ham paśyāmi iti na manyate
translated: He does not think, “I see.”

original: tad eva cakṣur nopalabhate svabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: tat eva cakṣuḥ na upalabhate svabhāva śūnyatām upādāya
translated: And he does not perceive that eye itself, due to the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: svabhāvaviviktatām upādāya /
analyzed: svabhāva vivikta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the natural isolation.

original: svabhāvānupalabdhitām upādāya /
analyzed: svabhāva anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of the nature.

original: na sa divyacakṣuścetanām apy utpādayati /
analyzed: na sa divya cakṣuḥ cetanām api utpādayati
translated: He does not even arouse the intention for the divine eye.

original: na divyacakṣurabhinirhāracetanāṃ vā anyatra sarvākārajñatāmanasikārāt /
analyzed: na divya cakṣuḥ abhinirhāra cetanām vā anyatra sarva ākāra jña tā manasikārāt
translated: Or the intention to accomplish the divine eye, except for the attention on complete knowing.

original: evaṃ hi śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran divyacakṣurabhijñāsākṣātkriyājñānam abhinirharati /
analyzed: evam hi śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran divya cakṣuḥ abhijñā sākṣātkriyā jñānam abhinirharati
translated: In this way, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom accomplishes the knowledge of the realization of the supernormal knowledge of the divine eye.

original: so 'nutpādasākṣātkriyābhijñājñānam abhinirharati /
analyzed: saḥ nu tpāda sākṣātkriyā abhijñā jñānam abhinirharati
translated: He accomplishes the knowledge of the realization of the supernormal knowledge of non-arising.

original: na ca śrāvakabhūmau vā pratyekabuddhabhūmau vā patati /
analyzed: na ca śrāvaka bhūmau vā pratyekabuddha bhūmau vā patati
translated: But he does not fall into the stage of the śrāvakas or the stage of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: nāpy anyaṃ kañcid dharmam āśaṃsati anyatrānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyamīti /
analyzed: na api anyam kañcid dharmam āśaṃsati anyatra anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyami iti
translated: And he does not hope for any other dharma, except for perfect enlightenment: 'I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.'

original: sa tayā āsravakṣaya sākṣātkriyābhijñājñānābhinirhārakuśalatayā na manyate tathā hi taj jñānam ajñānam acintyatām upādāya /
analyzed: sa tayā āsrava kṣaya sākṣātkriyā abhijñā jñāna abhinirhāra kuśala tayā na manyate tathā hi tat jñānam ajñānam a cintya tām upādāya
translated: By that skill in accomplishing the knowledge of the realization of the destruction of the defilements, he does not conceive. Because that knowledge is inconceivable.

original: so 'haṃ prajānāmīti na manyate /
analyzed: saḥ ham prajānāmi iti na manyate
translated: He does not conceive, 'I understand.'

original: tad eva ca jñānaṃ nopalabhate svabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya svabhāvaviviktatām upādāya svabhāvānupalabdhitām upādāya /
analyzed: tat eva ca jñānam na upalabhate svabhāva śūnya tām upādāya svabhāva vivikta tām upādāya svabhāva anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: And that very knowledge he does not apprehend, on account of the emptiness of intrinsic nature, on account of the isolation of intrinsic nature, on account of the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature.

original: na sa āsravakṣayacetanām apy utpādayati nāsravakṣayābhijñābhinirhāracetanāṃ vānyatra
analyzed: na saḥ āsrava kṣaya cetanām api utpādayati na āsrava kṣaya abhijñā abhinirhāra cetanām vā anyatra
translated: He does not even arouse the thought of the destruction of the outflows, or the thought of manifesting the superknowledges of the destruction of the outflows, except

original: sarvākārajñatāmanasikārāt / evaṃ hi śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā manasikārāt evam hi śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: with the attention on complete knowing. In this way, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: carann āsravakṣayābhijñāsākṣātkriyājñānam abhinirharati /
analyzed: caran āsrava kṣaya abhijñā sākṣātkriyā jñānam abhinirharati
translated: manifests the knowledge of realizing the superknowledges of the destruction of the outflows.

original: evaṃ punaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carataḥ ṣaḍabhijñāḥ paripūryante pariśudhyante ca /
analyzed: evam punar śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ ṣaṣ abhijñāḥ paripūryante pariśudhyante ca
translated: In this way, Śāriputra, the six superknowledges of a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom are fulfilled and purified.

original: abhijñāḥ /
analyzed: abhijñāḥ
translated: superknowledges.

original: śāriputra pariśuddhāḥ sarvākārajñatām arpayanti /
analyzed: śāriputra pariśuddhāḥ sarva ākāra jña tām arpayanti
translated: Śāriputra, being pure, dedicate them to complete knowing.

original: santi śāriputra bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranto dānapāramitāyāṃ sthitvā sarvākārajñatāpanthānaṃ śodhayanti /
analyzed: santi śāriputra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ dāna pāramitāyām sthitvā sarva ākārajña tā panthānam śodhayanti
translated: There are, Śāriputra, bodhisattva mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom who, having stood in the perfection of giving, purify the path to complete knowing,

original: atyantaśūnyatayā na ca gṛhītatām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta śūnya tayā na ca gṛhīta tām upādāya
translated: on account of the emptiness of ultimate reality, on account of the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, on account of the emptiness of what is not to be abandoned, on account of the emptiness of intrinsic nature, on account of the emptiness of the extrinsic nature of non-things, on account of the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-things, on account of the emptiness of the non-apprehension of things, on account of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-apprehension, on account of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, on account of the emptiness of essential nature, on account of the emptiness of the extrinsic nature of essential nature, on account of the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of essential nature, on account of the emptiness of the non-apprehension of essential nature, on account of the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-apprehension, on account of the emptiness of the non-apprehension of non-entities, on account of the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-apprehension, on account of the emptiness of the non-apprehension of the intrinsic nature of non-entities, on account of the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of the non-apprehension of the intrinsic nature of non-entities, on account of the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of the non-apprehension of the intrinsic nature of non-entities, on account of the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of the non-apprehension of the intrinsic nature of

original: santi śāriputra bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carantaḥ śīlapāramitāyāṃ sthitvā sarvākārajñatāpanthānaṃ śodhayanti /
analyzed: santi śāriputra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ śīla pāramitāyām sthitvā sarva ākārajña tā panthānam śodhayanti
translated: There are, Śāriputra, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who, practicing the perfection of wisdom, having stood in the perfection of morality, purify the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: atyantaśūnyatayā āpattyanadhyāpattitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta śūnya tayā āpatti anadhyāpatti tām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the ultimate, they do not fall into offenses.

original: santi śāriputra bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carantaḥ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ sthitvā sarvākārajñatāpanthānaṃ śodhayanti /
analyzed: santi śāriputra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ kṣānti pāramitāyām sthitvā sarva ākārajña tā panthānam śodhayanti
translated: There are, Śāriputra, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who, practicing the perfection of wisdom, having stood in the perfection of patience, purify the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: atyantaśūnyatayā akṣobhaṇatām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta śūnyatayā akṣobhaṇa tām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the ultimate, they are unshakable.

original: santi śāriputra bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranto vīryapāramitāyāṃ sthitvā sarvākārajñatāpanthānaṃ śodhayanti /
analyzed: santi śāriputra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ vīrya pāramitāyām sthitvā sarva ākārajña tā panthānam śodhayanti
translated: There are, Śāriputra, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who, practicing the perfection of wisdom, having stood in the perfection of vigor, purify the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: atyantaśūnyatayā kāyikacaitasikavīryāsraṃsanatām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta śūnya tayā kāyika caitasika vīrya āsraṃsana tām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the ultimate, they do not slacken in physical and mental vigor.

original: santi śāriputra bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranto dhyānapāramitāyāṃ sthitvā sarvākārajñatāpanthānaṃ śodhayanti /
analyzed: santi śāriputra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ dhyāna pāramitāyām sthitvā sarva ākārajña tā panthānam śodhayanti
translated: There are, Śāriputra, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who, practicing the perfection of wisdom, having stood in the perfection of concentration, purify the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: atyantaśūnyatayā avikṣiptacittatām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta śūnya tayā avikṣipta citta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the absolute, they do not have a distracted mind.

original: santi śāriputra bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carantaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthitvā sarvākārajñatāpanthānaṃ śodhayanti /
analyzed: santi śāriputra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām sthitvā sarva ākārajña tā panthānam śodhayanti
translated: There are, Śāriputra, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who, practicing the perfection of wisdom, standing in the perfection of wisdom, purify the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: atyantaśūnyatayā dauṣprajñacittaparivarjanatām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta śūnya tayā dauṣprajña citta parivarjana tām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the absolute, they avoid a mind of stupidity.

original: evaṃ khalu śāriputra bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carantaḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu sthitvā sarvākārajñatāpanthānaṃ śodhayanti /
analyzed: evam khalu śāriputra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu sthitvā sarva ākārajña tā panthānam śodhayanti
translated: Thus, Śāriputra, bodhisattva mahāsattvas, practicing the perfection of wisdom, standing in the six perfections, purify the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: atyantaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the absolute.

original: dānaṃ parigrahatām upādāya prajñapyate /
analyzed: dānam parigraha tām upādāya prajñapyate
translated: Giving is designated because of appropriation.

original: śīlaṃ dauḥśīlyam upādāya prajñapyate /🔽kṣāntir akṣāntitām upādāya prajñapyate /
analyzed: śīlam dauḥśīlyam upādāya prajñapyate  kṣāntiḥ a kṣānti tām upādāya prajñapyate
translated: Morality is designated because of immorality.🔽Patience is designated because of impatience.

original: vīryaṃ kauśīdyam upādāya prajñapyate /
analyzed: vīryam kauśīdyam upādāya prajñapyate
translated: Effort is designated because of laziness.

original: samādhir asamāhitatām upādāya prajñapyate /
analyzed: samādhiḥ a samāhita tām upādāya prajñapyate
translated: Concentration is designated because of distraction.

original: prajñā dauṣprajñam upādāya prajñapyate /🔽sa tīrṇa iti na manyate /
analyzed: prajñā dauṣprajñam upādāya prajñapyate  sa tīrṇaḥ iti na manyate
translated: Wisdom is designated because of stupidity.🔽He does not think 'I have crossed'.

original: na tīrṇa iti na manyate /
analyzed: na tīrṇaḥ iti na manyate
translated: He does not think 'I have not crossed'.

original: dānaṃ parigraha iti na manyate /
analyzed: dānam parigrahaḥ iti na manyate
translated: He does not think 'giving' and 'possessions' [are different].

original: śīlaṃ dauḥśīlyam iti na manyate /🔽kṣāntiḥ kṣobha iti na manyate /
analyzed: śīlam dauḥśīlyam iti na manyate  kṣāntiḥ kṣobhaḥ iti na manyate
translated: He does not think 'morality' and 'immorality' [are different].🔽He does not think 'patience' and 'anger' [are different].

original: vīryaṃ kauśīdyam iti na manyate /
analyzed: vīryam kauśīdyam iti na manyate
translated: He does not think 'diligence' and 'sloth' [are different].

original: samādhir asamāhiteti na manyate /
analyzed: samādhiḥ asamāhitā iti na manyate
translated: He does not think 'concentration' and 'discursiveness' [are different].

original: prajñādauṣprajñam iti na manyate /
analyzed: prajñā dauṣprajñam iti na manyate
translated: He does not think 'wisdom' and 'foolishness' [are different].

original: ākruṣṭo 'ham iti na manyate /🔽vandito 'ham iti na manyate /
analyzed: ākruṣṭaḥ ham iti na manyate  vanditaḥ ham iti na manyate
translated: He does not think 'I am reviled'.🔽He does not think 'I am worshipped'.

original: satkṛto 'ham iti na manyate /
analyzed: satkṛtaḥ ham iti na manyate
translated: He does not think 'I am honored'.

original: asatkṛto 'ham iti na manyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: asatkṛtaḥ ham iti na manyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: He does not think 'I am not honored'. Why is that?

original: na hi śāriputra anutpāda ākruṣṭo 'ham iti manyate / / 🔽vandito 'ham iti manyate /
analyzed: na hi śāriputra anutpādaḥ ākruṣṭaḥ ham iti manyate  vanditaḥ ham iti manyate
translated: Because, Śāriputra, the unborn does not think 'I am reviled'.🔽He does not think 'I am worshipped'.

original: satkṛto 'ham iti manyate /
analyzed: satkṛtaḥ ham iti manyate
translated: He does not think 'I am honored'.

original: asatkṛto 'ham iti manyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: asatkṛtaḥ ham iti manyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: He does not think 'I am not honored'. Why is that?

original: tathā hi prajñāpāramitā sarvamananāḥ samucchinatti /
analyzed: tathā hi prajñāpāramitā sarva mananāḥ samucchinatti
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom cuts off all thoughts.

original: iha śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato ye guṇā bhavanti na te sarve śrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ saṃvidyante /
analyzed: iha śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ ye guṇāḥ bhavanti na te sarve śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām saṃvidyante
translated: Here, Śāriputra, the qualities that a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom has, they are not all found in the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sa imān guṇān paripūrayan sattvāṃś ca paripācayati buddhakṣetraṃ ca pariśodhayati sarvākārajñatāṃ cānuprāpnoti /
analyzed: saḥ imān guṇān paripūrayan sattvān ca paripācayati buddhakṣetram ca pariśodhayati sarva ākāra jña tām ca anuprāpnoti
translated: He, fulfilling these qualities, matures beings, purifies the Buddha-field, and attains omniscience.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran sarvasattvānām antike samacittatām utpādayati /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran sarva sattvānām antike sama citta tām utpādayati
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom produces an attitude of equality towards all beings.

original: sarvasattvānām antike samacittatām utpādya sarvadharmasamatāṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām antike sama citta tām utpādya sarva dharma sama tām pratilabhate
translated: Having produced an attitude of equality towards all beings, he attains the equality of all dharmas.

original: sarvadharmasamatāṃ pratilabhya sarvasattvān sarvadharmasamatāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayati /
analyzed: sarva dharma samatām pratilabhya sarva sattvān sarva dharma samatāyām pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: Having attained the equality of all dharmas, he establishes all beings in the equality of all dharmas.

original: sa dṛṣṭa eva dharme buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ priyo bhavati manaāpaś ca /
analyzed: sa dṛṣṭe eva dharme buddhānām bhagavatām priyaḥ bhavati manaāpaḥ ca
translated: He, in this very life, becomes dear and pleasing to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: sarvabodhisattvānāṃ ca sarvaśrāvakānāṃ ca pratyekabuddhānāṃ ca priyo bhavati manaāpaś ca /
analyzed: sarva bodhisattvānām ca sarva śrāvakānām ca pratyekabuddhānām ca priyaḥ bhavati manaāpaḥ ca
translated: He becomes dear and pleasing to all bodhisattvas, all śrāvakas, and all pratyekabuddhas.

original: sa yatra yatropapadyate tatra tatra na jātu cakṣuṣā amanaāpāni rūpāṇi paśyati /🔽na śrotreṇāmanaāpān śabdān śṛṇoti /
analyzed: sa yatra yatra upapadyate tatra tatra na jātu cakṣuṣā amanaāpāni rūpāṇi paśyati  na śrotreṇa amanaāpān śabdān śṛṇoti
translated: Wherever he is reborn, there he never sees unpleasant forms with his eyes.🔽He never hears unpleasant sounds with his ears.

original: na ghrāṇenāmanaāpān gandhāñ jighrati /
analyzed: na ghrāṇena amanaḥ apān gandhān jighrati
translated: He never smells unpleasant smells with his nose.

original: na jihvayāmanaāpān rasān āsvādayati /
analyzed: na jihvayā āmanaāpān rasān āsvādayati
translated: He does not taste unpleasant tastes with his tongue.

original: na kāyenāmanaāpān sparśān spṛśati /
analyzed: na kāyena āmanaāpān sparśān spṛśati
translated: He does not touch unpleasant touches with his body.

original: na manasāmanaāpān dharmān vijānāti /
analyzed: na manasā amanaāpān dharmān vijānāti
translated: He does not cognize unpleasant mental phenomena with his mind.

original: na ca parihīyate 'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: na ca parihīyate nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: And he does not fall away from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: asmin khalu punaḥ prajñāpāramitānirdeśe nirdiśyamāne trīṇi bhikṣuṇīśatāni bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: asmin khalu punar prajñāpāramitā nirdeśe nirdiśyamāne trīṇi bhikṣuṇī śatāni bhagavantam
translated: When this explanation of the perfection of wisdom was being given, three hundred nuns

original: yathāvṛtaiś cīvarair abhicchādayāmāsur anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpādayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: yathā āvṛtaiḥ cīvaraiḥ abhicchādayāmāsuḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayāmāsuḥ
translated: covered the Blessed One with the robes they were wearing, and they gave rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃs tasyāṃ velāyāṃ smitam akarot /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām smitam akarot
translated: Then at that time the Blessed One smiled.🔽Then the Venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, put his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground,

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān ānandaḥ samutthāyāsanād ekāṃsam uttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇañ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃs tenāñjaliṃ
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ samutthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim
translated: bowed to the Blessed One with joined palms,

original: praṇamya bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: and said to the Blessed One:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prādurbhāvāya /
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prādurbhāvāya
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the reason for the smile?

original: nāhetukaṃ nāpratyayaṃ buddhā bhagavantaḥ smitaṃ prāduṣkurvanti /
analyzed: na ahetukam na apratyayam buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ smitam prāduṣkurvanti
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, do not smile without a cause, without a reason.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Ānanda,

original: etāny ānanda trīṇi bhikṣuṇīśatāni ekaṣaṣṭitame kalpe mahāketunāmānas tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā loke utpatsyante /
analyzed: etāni ānanda trīṇi bhikṣuṇī śatāni ekaṣaṣṭitame kalpe mahāketu nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ loke utpatsyante
translated: Ānanda, these three hundred bhikṣuṇīs, in the sixty-first eon, will appear in the world as tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened ones named Mahāketu.

original: tārakopame kalpe itaś cyutāni santi akṣobhyasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre upapatsyate /
analyzed: tāraka upame kalpe itas cyutāni santi akṣobhyasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya buddhakṣetre upapatsyate
translated: After passing away from here, they will be reborn in the buddha-field of the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One Akṣobhya in the eon called Tāraka.

original: ṣaṣṭiś ca devaputrasahasrāṇi /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭiḥ ca devaputra sahasrāṇi
translated: And sixty thousand gods,

original: yāni yāny anayā dharmadeśanayā paripācitāni tāni tāni maitreyasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāntike parinirvāsyanti /
analyzed: yāni yāni anayā dharma deśanayā paripācitāni tāni tāni maitreyasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya antike parinirvāsyanti
translated: who have been ripened by this teaching of the Dharma, will attain final nirvāṇa in the presence of the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One Maitreya.

original: atha khalu bhagavato 'nubhāvena tasyāṃ velāyāṃ pūrvasyāṃ diśi buddhasahasraṃ paśyanti sma /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavataḥ nubhāvena tasyām velāyām pūrvasyām diśi buddha sahasram paśyanti sma
translated: Then, by the power of the Blessed One, at that time they saw a thousand buddhas in the eastern direction,

original: catasraḥ pariṣado bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ parṣanmaṇḍalād /🔽evaṃ dakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi buddhasahasraṃ paśyanti /🔽paścimāyāṃ diśi buddhasahasraṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: catasraḥ pariṣadaḥ bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ parṣad maṇḍalāt  evam dakṣiṇasyām diśi buddha sahasram paśyanti  paścimāyām diśi buddha sahasram paśyanti
translated: from the circle of the assembly of the Blessed One Śākyamuni, the four assemblies,🔽in the same way they saw a thousand buddhas in the southern direction,🔽they saw a thousand buddhas in the western direction,

original: uttarasyāṃ diśi buddhasahasraṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: uttarasyām diśi buddha sahasram paśyanti
translated: they saw a thousand buddhas in the northern direction,

original: uttarapūrvasyāṃ diśi buddhasahasraṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: uttara pūrvasyām diśi buddha sahasram paśyanti
translated: In the northeast they see a thousand buddhas.

original: pūrvadakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi buddhasahasraṃ paśyanti /🔽dakṣiṇapaścimāyāṃ diśi buddhasahasraṃ paśyanti /🔽paścimottarasyāṃ diśi buddhasahasraṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: pūrva dakṣiṇasyām diśi buddha sahasram paśyanti  dakṣiṇa paścimāyām diśi buddha sahasram paśyanti  paścima uttarasyām diśi buddha sahasram paśyanti
translated: In the southeast they see a thousand buddhas.🔽In the southwest they see a thousand buddhas.🔽In the northwest they see a thousand buddhas.

original: adha ūrdhvam ekaikasyāṃ diśi buddhasahasraṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: adhas ūrdhvam ekaikasyām diśi buddha sahasram paśyanti
translated: Below and above they see a thousand buddhas in each direction.

original: mahato buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhāṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: mahataḥ buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhām paśyanti
translated: They see the great array of qualities of the buddha-field.

original: na ceha sahāyāṃ lokadhātau tān buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān paśyanti yān daśasu dikṣu teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān paśyanti
analyzed: na ca iha sahāyām lokadhātau tān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān paśyanti yān daśasu dikṣu teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān paśyanti
translated: But they do not see those arrays of qualities of the buddha-field here in the Sahā world-system, which they see in the buddha-fields of those blessed buddhas in the ten directions.

original: atha khalu bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ parṣanmaṇḍalād daśabhiḥ prāṇisahasraiḥ praṇidhānāni kṛtāni vayaṃ tāni puṇyāni kariṣyāmo yaiḥ puṇyair eteṣu
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ parṣad maṇḍalāt daśabhiḥ prāṇi sahasraiḥ praṇidhānāni kṛtāni vayam tāni puṇyāni kariṣyāmaḥ yaiḥ puṇyaiḥ eteṣu
translated: Then, in the assembly of the Blessed One Śākyamuni, ten thousand beings made aspirations, saying, We will perform those meritorious deeds by which we will be reborn in those

original: buddhakṣetreṣūpapatsyāmaha iti /
analyzed: buddhakṣetreṣu upapatsyāmahe iti
translated: buddha-fields.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃs teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇām āśayaṃ viditvā tasyāṃ velāyāṃ smitam akarot /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān teṣām kula putrāṇām āśayam viditvā tasyām velāyām smitam akarot
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts of those noble sons, smiled at that moment.

original: ānanda āha / ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prādurbhāvāya /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prādurbhāvāya
translated: Ānanda said, What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the condition for the manifestation of a smile?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: paśyasi tvam ānandemāni daśaprāṇisahasrāṇi /
analyzed: paśyasi tvam ānanda imāni daśa prāṇi sahasrāṇi
translated: Do you see, Ānanda, these ten thousand beings?

original: ānanda āha / paśyāmi bhagavan /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha paśyāmi bhagavan
translated: Ānanda said, I see them, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: etāny ānanda daśaprāṇisahasrāṇi itaś cyutāni teṣu daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetrasahasreṣūpapatsyante /
analyzed: etāni ānanda daśa prāṇi sahasrāṇi itas cyutāni teṣu daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra sahasreṣu upapatsyante
translated: Ānanda, these ten thousand beings, having passed away from here, will be reborn in the buddha-fields in the ten directions.

original: na ca kadācit tathāgatavirahitāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: na ca kadācid tathāgata virahitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will never be separated from the Tathāgata.

original: tataḥ paścād vyūharājanāmānas tathāgatā loke utpatsyante /
analyzed: tatas paścāt vyūha rāja nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ loke utpatsyante
translated: After that, they will appear in the world as Tathāgatas named Vyuharāja.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmāṃś ca mahāmaudgalyāyana āyuṣmāṃś ca subhūtir āyuṣmāṃś ca mahākāśyapaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmān ca mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ āyuṣmān ca subhūtiḥ āyuṣmān ca mahākāśyapaḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra, the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, the Venerable Subhūti, the Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: ete cānye ca saṃbahulā abhijñātā abhijñātā bhikṣavo bodhisattvāś ca bhikṣubhikṣuṇy upāsakopāsikāś ca bhagavantam etad avocan /
analyzed: ete ca anye ca saṃbahulāḥ abhijñātāḥ abhijñātāḥ bhikṣavaḥ bodhisattvāḥ ca bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ ca bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: and many other well-known monks, bodhisattvas, monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen said this to the Blessed One:

original: mahāpāramiteyaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ yad uta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: mahā pāramitā iyam bhagavan bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is a great perfection.

original: agrapāramiteyaṃ /
analyzed: agra pāramitā iyam
translated: This is the foremost perfection.

original: viśiṣṭapāramiteyaṃ pravarapāramiteyam anuttarapāramiteyaṃ niruttarapāramiteyaṃ asamapāramiteyaṃ ākāśapāramiteyaṃ svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāpāramiteyaṃ
analyzed: viśiṣṭa pāramitā iyam pravara pāramitā iyam anuttara pāramitā iyam niruttara pāramitā iyam asama pāramitā iyam ākāśa pāramitā iyam sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā pāramitā iyam
translated: This is the special perfection, the excellent perfection, the unsurpassed perfection, the unexcelled perfection, the unequaled perfection, the sky-like perfection, the perfection of emptiness of its own mark,

original: anavamardanīyapāramiteyaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ yad uta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: an avamardanīya pāramitā iyam bhagavan bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: The Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas is indeed invincible.

original: atra hi bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caradbhir bodhisattvair mahāsattvair asamasamaṃ dānaṃ dattaṃ tair asamasamā dānapāramitā paripūritā /
analyzed: atra hi bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyām caradbhiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ asamasamam dānam dattam taiḥ asamasamā dāna pāramitā paripūritā
translated: For, Blessed One, those bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who practice in this perfection of wisdom have given unequalled gifts, by them the unequalled perfection of generosity has been fulfilled.

original: tair asamasama ātmabhāvaḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamaḥ ātma bhāvaḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: By them an unequalled body has been attained.

original: te 'samasamasya dharmasya lābhino bhaviṣyanti yad utānuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: te samasamasya dharmasya lābhinaḥ bhaviṣyanti yat uta anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: They will become recipients of the unequalled Dharma, namely unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tair asamasamaṃ śīlaṃ rakṣitaṃ /
analyzed: taiḥ asama samam śīlam rakṣitam
translated: By them unequalled morality has been guarded.

original: tair asamasamā śīlapāramitā paripūritā /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamā śīla pāramitā paripūritā
translated: By them the unequalled perfection of morality has been fulfilled.

original: tair asamasama ātmabhāvaḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamaḥ ātma bhāvaḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: By them an unequalled body has been attained.

original: te 'samasamasya dharmasya lābhino bhaviṣyanti yad utānuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: te samasamasya dharmasya lābhinaḥ bhaviṣyanti yat uta anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: They will become recipients of the unequalled Dharma, namely unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tair asamasamā kṣāntir bhāvitā /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamā kṣāntiḥ bhāvitā
translated: They have cultivated the acceptance that is unequaled and equal.

original: tair asamasamā kṣāntipāramitā paripūritā /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamā kṣānti pāramitā paripūritā
translated: They have fulfilled the perfection of acceptance that is unequaled and equal.

original: tair asamasama ātmabhāvaḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamaḥ ātma bhāvaḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: They have attained a body that is unequaled and equal.

original: te 'samasamasya dharmasya lābhino bhaviṣyanti yad utānuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: te samasamasya dharmasya lābhinaḥ bhaviṣyanti yat uta anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: They will attain the Dharma that is unequaled and equal, namely, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tair asamasamaṃ vīryam ārabdhaṃ /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamam vīryam ārabdham
translated: They have undertaken unequaled and equal effort.

original: tair asamasamā vīryapāramitā paripūritā /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamā vīrya pāramitā paripūritā
translated: They have fulfilled the perfection of effort that is unequaled and equal.

original: tair asamasama ātmabhāvaḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamaḥ ātma bhāvaḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: They have attained a body that is unequaled and equal.

original: te 'samasamasya dharmasya lābhino bhaviṣyanti yad utānuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /🔽tair asamasamaṃ dhyānam utpāditaṃ /
analyzed: te samasamasya dharmasya lābhinaḥ bhaviṣyanti yat uta anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ  taiḥ asamasamam dhyānam utpāditam
translated: They will attain the Dharma that is unequaled and equal, namely, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.🔽They have produced unequaled and equal concentration.

original: tair asamasamā dhyānapāramitā paripūritā /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamā dhyāna pāramitā paripūritā
translated: They have fulfilled the perfection of concentration that is unequaled and equal.

original: tair asamasama ātmabhāvaḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamaḥ ātma bhāvaḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: They have attained a body that is unequaled and equal.

original: te 'samasamasya dharmasya lābhino bhaviṣyanti yad utānuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /🔽tair asamasamā prajñā bhāvitā /
analyzed: te samasamasya dharmasya lābhinaḥ bhaviṣyanti yat uta anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ  taiḥ asamasamā prajñā bhāvitā
translated: They will attain the Dharma that is unequaled and equal, namely, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.🔽They have cultivated unequaled and equal wisdom.

original: tair asamasamā prajñāpāramitā paripūritā /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamā prajñāpāramitā paripūritā
translated: They have fulfilled the perfection of wisdom that is unequaled and equal.

original: tair asamasama ātmabhāvaḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ asamasamaḥ ātma bhāvaḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: They have attained a body that is unequaled and equal to the unequaled.

original: te 'samasamasya dharmasya lābhino bhaviṣyanti yad utānuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: te samasamasya dharmasya lābhinaḥ bhaviṣyanti yat uta anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: They will become recipients of the unequaled and equal Dharma, namely, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: atraiva ca tvaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann asamasamasya rūpasya lābhī jāto
analyzed: atrā eva ca tvam bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyām caran asamasamasya rūpasya lābhī jātaḥ
translated: And right here, Blessed One, while practicing this perfection of wisdom, you became a recipient of the unequaled and equal form,

original: 'samasamāyā vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām asamasamasya vijñānasya lābhī jāto 'samasamāṃ
analyzed: samasamāyāḥ vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām asamasamasya vijñānasya lābhī jātaḥ samasamām
translated: and a recipient of the unequaled and equal feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness. You attained

original: bodhim abhisaṃbuddho 'samasamaṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartitam /
analyzed: bodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ samasamam dharmacakram pravartitam
translated: enlightenment that is unequaled and equal, turned the unequaled and equal wheel of Dharma.

original: evam atītānāgatapratyutpannā buddhā bhagavanto 'traiva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranto 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ samyaksaṃbuddhā abhisaṃbhotsyante
analyzed: evam atīta anāgata pratyutpannāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ trā eva prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ abhisaṃbhotsyante  /
translated: In the same way, the Buddhas of the past, future, and present, while practicing this very perfection of wisdom, fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: ca abhisaṃbudhyante ca /
analyzed: ca abhisaṃbudhyante ca
translated: will fully awaken, and are fully awakening to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhagavan sarvadharmāṇāṃ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhagavan sarva dharmāṇām
translated: Therefore, Blessed One,

original: pāraṃ gantukāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: pāram gantu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to go beyond all dharmas should practice yoga in the perfection of wisdom.

original: namaskaraṇīyās te bhagavan bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ye 'syāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranti sadevamānuṣāsureṇa lokena /
analyzed: namaskaraṇīyāḥ te bhagavan bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye syām prajñāpāramitāyām caranti sa deva mānuṣa asureṇa lokena
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, Blessed One, who practice this perfection of wisdom, should be revered by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: evam ukte bhagavāṃs tān saṃbahulān śrāvakāṃs tāṃś ca bodhisattvān etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān tān saṃbahulān śrāvakān tān ca bodhisattvān etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to those many śrāvakas and bodhisattvas:

original: evam etat kulaputra evam etat /
analyzed: evam etat kula putra evam etat
translated: It is so, sons of noble family, it is so.

original: namaskaraṇīyās te bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sadevamānuṣāsureṇa lokena ye 'syāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: namaskaraṇīyāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sa deva mānuṣa asureṇa lokena ye syām prajñāpāramitāyām caranti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice this perfection of wisdom should be revered by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras. Why is that?

original: bodhisattvaṃ hi śāriputrāgamya lokasya loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: bodhisattvam hi śāriputra āgamya lokasya loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: Because, Śāriputra, it is due to the bodhisattva that the appearance of the world in the world occurs.

original: manuṣyalokasya devalokasya kṣatriyamahāśālakulānāṃ brāhmaṇamahāśālakulānāṃ gṛhapatimahāśālakulānāṃ
analyzed: manuṣya lokasya deva lokasya kṣatriya mahāśāla kulānām brāhmaṇa mahāśāla kulānām gṛhapati mahāśāla kulānām
translated: The world of humans, the world of gods, the great and wealthy kṣatriya families, the great and wealthy brahmin families, the great and wealthy householder families,

original: rājñāṃ cakravartināṃ cāturmahārājakāyikānāṃ devānāṃ trayastriṃśānāṃ devānāṃ yāmānāṃ
analyzed: rājñām cakravartinām cāturmahārājakāyikānām devānām trayastriṃśānām devānām yāmānām
translated: the kings, the wheel-turning kings, the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings, the gods of the Thirty-Three,🔽the Yāma gods,

original: devānāṃ tuṣitānāṃ devānāṃ nirmāṇaratīnāṃ devānāṃ paranirmitavaśavartināṃ devānāṃ
analyzed: devānām tuṣitānām devānām nirmāṇaratīnām devānām paranirmitavaśavartinām devānām
translated: the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods,

original: brahmapārṣadyānāṃ devānāṃ brahmapurohitānāṃ devānāṃ mahābrahmāṇāṃ devānāṃ parīttābhānāṃ
analyzed: brahmapārṣadyānām devānām brahmapurohitānām devānām mahābrahmāṇām devānām parīttābhānām
translated: the Brahmapurohita gods, the Brahmakāyika gods, the Parīttābha gods,

original: devānām apramāṇābhānāṃ devānām ābhāsvarāṇāṃ devānāṃ parīttaśubhānāṃ devānām apramāṇaśubhānāṃ
analyzed: devānām apramāṇa ābhānām devānām ābhāsvarāṇām devānām parītta śubhānām devānām apramāṇa śubhānām
translated: the Apramāṇābha gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Parīttaśubha gods, the Apramāṇaśubha gods,

original: devānāṃ śubhakṛtsnānāṃ devānām anabhrakānāṃ devānāṃ puṇyaprasavānāṃ devānāṃ bṛhatphalānāṃ
analyzed: devānām śubhakṛtsnānām devānām anabhrakānām devānām puṇyaprasavānām devānām bṛhatphalānām
translated: the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Anabhraka gods, the Puṇyaprasava gods, the Bṛhatphala gods,

original: devānām asaṃjñisattvānāṃ devānāṃ śuddhābhāsānāṃ devānām aspṛhāṇāṃ devānām atapānāṃ
analyzed: devānām a saṃjñi sattvānām devānām śuddha ābhāsānām devānām a spṛhāṇām devānām a tapānām
translated: the Asaṃjñisattva gods, the Śuddhāvāsa gods, the Avṛha gods, the Atapa gods,

original: devānāṃ sudṛśānāṃ devānāṃ sudarśanānāṃ devānām akaniṣṭhānāṃ devānām ākāśānantyāyatanopagānāṃ
analyzed: devānām sudṛśānām devānām sudarśanānām devānām akaniṣṭhānām devānām ākāśa ānantya āyatana upagānām
translated: the Sudarśana gods, the Akaniṣṭha gods, the Ākāśānantyāyatana gods,

original: devānāṃ vijñānānantyāyatanopagānāṃ devānām ākiñcānyāyatanopagānāṃ devānāṃ naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatanopagānāṃ
analyzed: devānām vijñāna anantya āyatana upagānām devānām ākiñcānya āyatana upagānām devānām na eva saṃjñā na asaṃjñā āyatana upagānām
translated: the Vijñānānantyāyatana gods, the Ākiñcanyāyatana gods, the Naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatana gods,

original: devānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: devānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: appear in the world.

original: srotaāpannānāṃ sakṛdāgāminām anāgāminām arhatāṃ pratyekabuddhānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ tathāgatānām arhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ loke 🔽prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: srotaāpannānām sakṛdāgāminām anāgāminām arhatām pratyekabuddhānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām loke  prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the appearance in the world of the stream-enterers, the once-returners, the non-returners, the arhats, the pratyekabuddhas, the bodhisattvas, the great beings, the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: bodhisattvaṃ hi śāriputrāgamya trayāṇāṃ ratnānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: bodhisattvam hi śāriputra āgamya trayāṇām ratnānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the three jewels is due to the bodhisattva, Śāriputra.

original: laukikānāṃ ca sarvajīvitopakaraṇānām annapānavastraśayyāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariskārāṇāṃ maṇimuktāvaiḍūryaśaṃkhaśilāpravālajātarūparajatānāṃ 🔽loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: laukikānām ca sarva jīvita upakaraṇānām anna pāna vastra śayyā āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariskārāṇām maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya śaṃkha śilā pravāla jātarūpa rajatānām  loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: And the appearance in the world of all the necessities of life for humans, such as food, drink, clothing, bedding, seats, medicines for sickness, and personal belongings, and of jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, corals, gold, and silver,

original: yāvac chāriputra sarvasukhopadhānāṃ divyānāṃ mānuṣyakāṇāṃ ca bhavasukhānāṃ ca nirvāṇasukhānāṃ ca / 🔽loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: yāvat śāriputra sarva sukhopadhānām divyānām mānuṣyakāṇām ca bhava sukhānām ca nirvāṇa sukhānām ca  loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: up to Śāriputra, of all the enjoyments of gods and humans, and of the happiness of existence and the happiness of nirvāṇa.

original: sarvaśaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvam āgamya / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarvaśas śāriputra bodhisattvam āgamya tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The appearance in the world is due entirely to the bodhisattva, Śāriputra. Why is that?

original: bodhisattvo hi śāriputra caryāñ caran ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu sattvān niyojayati /
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ hi śāriputra caryām caran ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu sattvān niyojayati
translated: Because, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva, practicing the conduct, engages beings in the six perfections.

original: dānaṃ dāpayati śīlaṃ samādāpayati kṣāntyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayati vīryaṃ niyojayati dhyāne pratiṣṭhāpayati prajñāyāṃ niyojayati /
analyzed: dānam dāpayati śīlam samādāpayati kṣāntyām pratiṣṭhāpayati vīryam niyojayati dhyāne pratiṣṭhāpayati prajñāyām niyojayati
translated: He causes them to give gifts, he causes them to take up morality, he establishes them in patience, he causes them to undertake perseverance, he establishes them in meditative stabilization, he causes them to undertake wisdom.

original: sarve ca sattvā bodhisattvam āgamya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranti /
analyzed: sarve ca sattvāḥ bodhisattvam āgamya prajñāpāramitāyām caranti
translated: And all sentient beings, having come to the Bodhisattva, practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: tasmāc chāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo sarvasattvānāṃ hitasukhāya pratipanno bhavati /
analyzed: tasmāt śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva sattvānām hita sukhāya pratipannaḥ bhavati
translated: Therefore, Śāriputra, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, is engaged in the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃs tasyāṃ velāyāṃ jihvendriyaṃ nirnāmayitvā imaṃ trisāhasraṃ mahāsāhasraṃ lokadhātuṃ jihvendriyeṇācchādayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām jihvā indriyam nirnāmayitvā imam tri sāhasram mahā sāhasram lokadhātum jihvā indriyeṇa ācchādayāmāsa
translated: Then the Blessed One, at that time, extended his tongue-organ and covered this great trichiliocosm with his tongue-organ.

original: atha khalu tato jihvendriyād anekavarṇā nānāvarṇā arciṣo niśceruḥ /🔽niḥsṛtya pūrvasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadībālukopamān lokadhātūn ābhayāvabhāsayāmāsuḥ / evaṃ dakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadībālukopamān lokadhātūn ābhayāvabhāsayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu tatas jihvā indriyāt aneka varṇāḥ nānā varṇāḥ arciṣaḥ niśceruḥ  niḥsṛtya pūrvasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamān lokadhātūn ābhayā avabhāsayāmāsuḥ evam dakṣiṇasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamān lokadhātūn ābhayā avabhāsayāmāsuḥ
translated: Then from that tongue-organ, light rays of many colors and various colors issued forth.🔽Having issued forth, they illuminated the world systems in the east equal to the sands of the Ganges river in radiance. Likewise, they illuminated the world systems in the south equal to the sands of the Ganges river in radiance.

original: paścimāyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadībālukopamān lokadhātūn ābhayāvabhāsayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: paścimāyām diśi gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamān lokadhātūn ābhayā avabhāsayāmāsuḥ
translated: They illuminated the world systems in the west equal to the sands of the Ganges river in radiance.

original: uttarasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadībālukopamān lokadhātūn ābhayāvabhāsayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: uttarasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamān lokadhātūn ābhayā avabhāsayāmāsuḥ
translated: in the northern direction, they illuminated world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges River with their radiance;

original: uttarapūrvasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadībālukopamān lokadhātūn ābhayāvabhāsayāmāsuḥ /🔽pūrvadakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadībālukopamān lokadhātūn ābhayāvabhāsayāmāsuḥ /🔽dakṣiṇapaścimāyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadībālukopamān lokadhātūn ābhayāvabhāsayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: uttara pūrvasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamān lokadhātūn ābhayā avabhāsayāmāsuḥ  pūrva dakṣiṇasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamān lokadhātūn ābhayā avabhāsayāmāsuḥ  dakṣiṇa paścimāyām diśi gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamān lokadhātūn ābhayā avabhāsayāmāsuḥ
translated: in the northeastern direction, they illuminated world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges River with their radiance;🔽in the southeastern direction, they illuminated world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges River with their radiance;🔽in the southwestern direction, they illuminated world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges River with their radiance;

original: paścimottarasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadībālukopamān lokadhātūn ābhayāvabhāsayāmāsuḥ /🔽adhastād diśi gaṅgānadībālukopamān lokadhātūn ābhayāvabhāsayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: paścima uttarasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamān lokadhātūn ābhayā avabhāsayāmāsuḥ  adhastāt diśi gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamān lokadhātūn ābhayā avabhāsayāmāsuḥ
translated: in the northwestern direction, they illuminated world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges River with their radiance;🔽in the lower direction, they illuminated world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges River with their radiance;

original: ūrdhvaṃ diśi gaṅgānadībālukopamān lokadhātūn ābhayāvabhāsayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: ūrdhvam diśi gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamān lokadhātūn ābhayā avabhāsayāmāsuḥ
translated: in the upper direction, they illuminated world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges River with their radiance.

original: atha khalu pūrvasyāṃ yāvad ūrdhvaṃ diśi gaṅgānadībālukopamebhyo buddhakṣetrebhyo
analyzed: atha khalu pūrvasyām yāvat ūrdhvam diśi gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ
translated: Then, in the eastern direction up to the upper direction, from Buddha-fields numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: 'prameyāsaṃkhyeyā bodhisattvās tān prabhāvyūhān dṛṣṭvā svakasvakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu
analyzed: prameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ tān prabhā vyūhān dṛṣṭvā svaka svakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu
translated: inconceivable, innumerable Bodhisattvas, having seen those displays, in their own Buddha-fields,

original: buddhān bhagavataḥ paripṛcchanti sma /
analyzed: buddhān bhagavataḥ paripṛcchanti sma
translated: They asked the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: kasyāyaṃ bhagavann anubhāvo yenāyam eva prabhāvabhāsaḥ saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: kasya ayam bhagavan anubhāvaḥ yena ayam eva prabhā avabhāsaḥ saṃdṛśyate
translated: Blessed One, whose power is this, by which this light is seen?

original: te buddhā bhagavantas tān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān evam āhuḥ
translated: Those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, said to those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas,

original: eṣa kulaputrāḥ paścime yāvad adho digbhāge sahāyāṃ lokadhātau śākyamunir nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddḥs tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati /🔽tena jihvendriyaṃ nirṇamayya pūrvasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadībālukopamā iokadhātavo /
analyzed: eṣa kula putrāḥ paścime yāvat adhas digbhāge sahāyām lokadhātau śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddṛḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati  tena jihvā indriyam nirṇamayya pūrvasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamāḥ
translated: Sons of noble family, in the western direction, up to the lower part, in the Saha world system, there is a Tathagata named Shakyamuni, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, who abides, supports, and endures.🔽He extended his tongue and filled with light the world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges River in the eastern direction,

original: 'vabhāsena sphuṭīkṛtā yāvad ūrdhvaṃ diśi /
analyzed: vabhāsena sphuṭīkṛtāḥ yāvat ūrdhvam diśi
translated: up to the zenith.

original: evaṃ daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadībālukopamā lokadhātavo 'vabhāsena sphuṭīkṛtā yad uta bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ deśanāya saṃprakāśanāya /
analyzed: evam daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī bālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ vabhāsena sphuṭīkṛtāḥ yat uta bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām deśanāya saṃprakāśanāya
translated: In the same way, the world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges River in the ten directions were filled with light, in order to teach and illuminate the perfection of wisdom of the Bodhisattva Mahasattvas.

original: te bodhisattvās tāṃs tathāgatān evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: te bodhisattvāḥ tān tathāgatān evam āhuḥ
translated: Those Bodhisattvas said to those Tathagatas,🔽Blessed One, whose power is this?

original: gamiṣyāmo vayaṃ bhagavaṃs tāṃ sahālokadhātuṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya /
analyzed: gamiṣyāmaḥ vayam bhagavan tām sahā lokadhātum tam bhagavantam śākyamunim tathāgatam darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: We wish to go, Blessed One, to that Sahā world system to see, venerate, and serve the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni,

original: tāṃś ca daśadiksaṃnipatitān bodhisattvān mahāsattvāṃs tāṃ ca prajñāpāramitāṃ śravaṇāya /
analyzed: tān ca daśa diś saṃnipatitān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān tām ca prajñāpāramitām śravaṇāya
translated: and to see those Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas assembled from the ten directions and to hear the perfection of wisdom.

original: te buddhā bhagavanta āhuḥ /
analyzed: te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ āhuḥ
translated: Those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, said:

original: gacchata kulaputrā yasyedānīṃ kālaṃ manyadhvam /
analyzed: gacchata kula putrāḥ yasya idānīm kālam manyadhvam
translated: Go, sons of noble family, now is the time if you think it is so.

original: atha khalu te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā daśabhyo digbhyaḥ puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvaijayantīr
analyzed: atha khalu te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vaijayantīḥ
translated: Then those Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas from the ten directions, taking flowers, incense, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, banners of victory,

original: gṛhītvā nānāratnasuvarṇarūpyapuṣpapuṭāni ca gṛhītvā mahatyā tūryatāḍāvacarasaṃgītyā
analyzed: gṛhītvā nānā ratna suvarṇa rūpya puṣpa puṭāni ca gṛhītvā mahatyā tūrya tāḍāva cara saṃgītyā
translated: and baskets of jewels, gold, and silver flowers, with a great sound of musical instruments and singing,

original: bhagavantaṃ śākyamunim upasaṃkrāntā abhūvan /
analyzed: bhagavantam śākyamunim upasaṃkrāntāḥ abhūvan
translated: approached the Blessed One, Śākyamuni.

original: atha khalu cāturmahārājakāyikā devās trayastriṃśā devā yāmā devās tuṣitā devā nirmāṇaratayo
analyzed: atha khalu cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ devāḥ trayastriṃśāḥ devāḥ yāmāḥ devāḥ tuṣitāḥ devāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ
translated: Then the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings, the gods of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods,

original: devāḥ paranirmitavaśavartino devā brahmapurohitā devā mahābrahmāṇo devāḥ parīttābhā
analyzed: devāḥ paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ devāḥ brahmapurohitāḥ devāḥ mahābrahmāṇaḥ devāḥ parīttābhā
translated: the gods who control the enjoyments created by others, the gods who delight in creation, the gods who delight in the creations of others, the gods of Brahma's group, the gods of Brahma's retinue, the great Brahma gods, the gods of limited radiance,

original: devā apramāṇābhā devā ābhāsvarā devāḥ parīttaśubhā devā apramāṇaśubhā devāḥ śubhakṛtsnā
analyzed: devāḥ apramāṇa ābhāḥ devāḥ ābhāsvarāḥ devāḥ parītta śubhāḥ devāḥ apramāṇa śubhāḥ devāḥ śubhakṛtsnā
translated: the gods of immeasurable radiance, the radiant gods, the gods of limited beauty, the gods of immeasurable beauty, the all-beautiful gods, the gods without distress, the gods with abundant merit, the gods with abundant fruit, the non-percipient gods, the pure-abode gods,🔽the gods who delight in creation, the gods who delight in the creations of others, the gods of Brahma's group, the great Brahma gods, the gods of limited radiance,

original: devā anabhrakā devāḥ puṇyaprasavā devā bṛhatphalā devā asaṃjñisattvā devāḥ śuddhābhāsā
analyzed: devāḥ anabhrakāḥ devāḥ puṇyaprasavāḥ devāḥ bṛhatphalāḥ devāḥ asaṃjñisattvāḥ devāḥ śuddha ābhāsā
translated: the gods of immeasurable radiance, the radiant gods, the gods of limited beauty, the gods of immeasurable beauty, the all-beautiful gods, the gods without distress, the gods with abundant merit, the gods with abundant fruit, the non-percipient gods, the pure-abode gods,🔽the gods who delight in creation, the gods who delight in the creations of others, the gods of Brahma's group, the great Brahma gods, the gods of limited radiance,🔽the gods of immeasurable radiance, the radiant gods, the gods of limited beauty, the gods of immeasurable beauty, the all-beautiful gods, the gods without distress, the gods with abundant merit, the gods with abundant fruit, the non-percipient gods, the pure-abode gods,🔽the gods who delight in creation, the gods who delight in the creations of others, the gods of Brahma's group, the great Brahma gods, the gods of limited radiance,

original: devā aspṛhā devā atapā devāḥ sudṛśā devāḥ sudarśanā devā akaniṣṭhāś ca devā divyapuṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākā🔽utpalakumudapuṇḍarīkamāndāravakesaratamālapatrāṇi gṛhītvā yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāman /
analyzed: devāḥ aspṛhāḥ devāḥ atapāḥ devāḥ sudṛśāḥ devāḥ sudarśanāḥ devāḥ akaniṣṭhāḥ ca devāḥ divya puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā  utpala kumuda puṇḍarīka māndārava kesara tamāla patrāṇi gṛhītvā yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāman
translated: the gods of immeasurable radiance, the radiant gods, the gods of limited beauty, the gods of immeasurable beauty, the all-beautiful gods, the gods without distress, the gods with abundant merit, the gods with abundant fruit, the non-percipient gods, the pure-abode gods,🔽the gods who delight in creation, the gods who delight in the creations of others, the gods of Brahma's group, the great Brahma gods, the gods of limited radiance,🔽the gods of immeasurable radiance, the radiant gods, the gods of limited beauty, the gods of immeasurable beauty, the all-beautiful gods, the gods without distress, the gods with abundant merit, the gods with abundant fruit, the non-percipient gods, the pure-abode gods,

original: atha khalu te bodhisattvās te ca devās taiḥ puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanais tathāgatam arhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddham avakiranti sma /
analyzed: atha khalu te bodhisattvāḥ te ca devāḥ taiḥ puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepanaiḥ tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham avakiranti sma
translated: the gods who delight in creation,

original: atha khalu tāni puṣpāṇi vaihāyasam abhyudgamyāsya trisāhasramahāsāhasrasya lokadhātor
analyzed: atha khalu tāni puṣpāṇi vaihāyasam abhyudgamya asya tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrasya lokadhātoḥ
translated: Then those flowers rose up into the air above this great trichiliocosm,

original: upariṣṭāt puṣpakūṭāgāraḥ saṃsthito 'bhūt catusthūṇaś caturasro bhāgataḥ suvibhakto ramaṇīyo manoramaḥ /
analyzed: upariṣṭāt puṣpa kūṭāgāraḥ saṃsthitaḥ bhūt catur sthūṇaḥ catur asraḥ bhāgataḥ suvibhaktaḥ ramaṇīyaḥ manoramaḥ
translated: and formed an aerial pavilion of flowers, with four corners, four sides, and four doors, well-divided into compartments, delightful and pleasing.

original: atha khalu tataḥ parṣadaḥ prāṇikoṭīniyutaśatasahasram utthāyāsanād ekāṃsam uttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ /
analyzed: atha khalu tatas parṣadaḥ prāṇi koṭī niyuta śata sahasram utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām
translated: Then from that assembly, many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of living beings rose from their seats, arranged their upper robes over one shoulder, placed their right knees on the ground,

original: pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃs tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: joined the palms of their hands, and said this to the Lord:

original: vayaṃ bhagavann anāgate 'dhvani evaṃrūpāṇāṃ dharmāṇāṃ lābhino bhavema yathā tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: vayam bhagavan anāgate dhvani evaṃrūpāṇām dharmāṇām lābhinaḥ bhavema yathā tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: We, Lord, in a future period, may we also become possessors of such dharmas as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One is;

original: evaṃ ca śrāvakagaṇaṃ parikarṣema evaṃ ca parṣadi dharmaṃ deśayema yac caitarhi tathāgato bhagavān dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: evam ca śrāvaka gaṇam parikarṣema evam ca parṣadi dharmam deśayema yat ca etarhi tathāgataḥ bhagavān dharmam deśayati
translated: and may we also lead a community of disciples in this way, and may we also teach the Dharma in an assembly in just the same way as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One does at present.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃs teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇām āsayaṃ viditvā sarvadharmāṇāṃ cānutpādāyānirodhāyānabhisaṃskārāyāprādurbhāvāya
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān teṣām kula putrāṇām āsayam viditvā sarva dharmāṇām ca an utpādāya a nirodhāya an abhisaṃskārāya a prādurbhāvāya
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts of those sons of good family, and knowing their acceptance of the non-arising of all dharmas, their non-cessation, their non-production, their non-manifestation,

original: kṣāntiṃ viditvā smitam akarot / atha tato 'nekavarṇā raśmayo bhagavato mukhadvārān
analyzed: kṣāntim viditvā smitam akarot atha tatas neka varṇāḥ raśmayaḥ bhagavataḥ mukha dvārān
translated: he smiled. Then from his mouth many-colored rays issued forth,

original: niścaritās te sarvāvantaṃ lokaṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar evāgatā bhagavato mūrdhany antardhīyante sma /
analyzed: niścaritāḥ te sarvāvantam lokam pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar eva āgatāḥ bhagavataḥ mūrdhani antardhīyante sma
translated: they circumambulated the entire world and returned, disappearing into the Blessed One's head.🔽Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground,

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān ānanda utthāyāsanād ekāṃsam uttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ janumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃs tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya 🔽bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam janu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya  bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: and with palms joined he bowed to the Blessed One and said this:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya pradurbhāvāya /
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya pradurbhāvāya
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the reason for the smile?

original: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One said this to the venerable Ānanda:

original: etad ānanda prāṇikoṭīniyutaśatasahasram aṣṭaṣaṣṭyā kalpakoṭībhir bodhyaṅgapuṣpanāmānas tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā loka utpatsyante
analyzed: etat ānanda prāṇi koṭī niyuta śata sahasram aṣṭaṣaṣṭyā kalpa koṭībhiḥ bodhyaṅgapuṣpa nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ loke utpatsyante
translated: Ananda, this many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of beings, after eighty-four thousand kotis of kalpas, will appear in the world as Tathagatas, Arhats, Fully Enlightened Ones named Bodhyangapuspa.

original: iti ṣaḍabhijñāvavādaḥ
analyzed: iti ṣaḍabhijñāvavādaḥ
translated: Thus is the instruction on the six higher knowledges.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃs tasyāṃ velāyām āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim āmantrayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām āyuṣmantam subhūtim āmantrayāmāsa
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the Venerable Subhuti at that time:

original: pratibhātu te subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitām ārabhya yathā bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ niryāyur iti /
analyzed: pratibhātu te subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām ārabhya yathā bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām niryāyuḥ iti
translated: Subhuti, it occurs to me to instruct the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas in the perfection of wisdom, so that the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas may emerge in the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalu teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ teṣāṃ ca mahāśrāvakāṇāṃ teṣāṃ ca devaputrāṇām etad abhavat /
analyzed: atha khalu teṣām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām teṣām ca mahāśrāvakāṇām teṣām ca deva putrāṇām etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, those great Sravakas, and those sons of gods:

original: kiṃ nu khalv āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ svakena prajñāpratibhānabalādhānena bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitām upadekṣyaty utāho buddhānubhāvena /
analyzed: kim nu khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ svakena prajñā pratibhāna bala ādhānena bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām upadekṣyati uta aho buddha anubhāvena
translated: Will the Venerable Subhuti instruct the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas in the perfection of wisdom through his own power of wisdom and eloquence, or through the power of the Buddha?

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir buddhānubhāvena teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ teṣāñ
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ buddha anubhāvena teṣām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām teṣām
translated: Then indeed the Venerable Subhūti, through the Buddha's power, knowing the thoughts, the mental reflections of those Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas,

original: ca mahāśrāvakāṇāṃ teṣāñ ca devaputrāṇāṃ cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkam ājñāya āyuṣmantaṃ
analyzed: ca mahāśrāvakāṇām teṣām ca deva putrāṇām cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya āyuṣmantam
translated: of those great Śrāvakas, and of those gods, said this to the Venerable

original: śāriputram etad avocat /🔽yat kiñcid /
analyzed: śāriputram etat avocat  yat kiñcid
translated: Śāriputra:

original: āyuṣman śāriputra bhagavataḥ śrāvakā bhāṣante deśayanty upadiśanti sarvaḥ sa tathāgatasya puruṣakāro veditavyaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: āyuṣman śāriputra bhagavataḥ śrāvakāḥ bhāṣante deśayanti upadiśanti sarvaḥ sa tathāgatasya puruṣakāraḥ veditavyaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Whatever, Venerable Śāriputra, the Blessed One's disciples speak, teach, explain, all that should be known as the Tathāgata's work. Why is that?

original: yo hi tathāgatena dharmo deśitas tasyāṃ dharmadeśanāyāṃ śikṣamāṇās tāṃ dharmatāṃ
analyzed: yaḥ hi tathāgatena dharmaḥ deśitaḥ tasyām dharma deśanāyām śikṣamāṇāḥ tām dharmatām
translated: Because whatever Dharma is taught by the Tathāgata, those who train in that Dharma teaching

original: sākṣātkurvanti tāṃ dharmatāṃ sākṣātkṛtvā yad yad eva bhāṣante deśayanty upadiśanti
analyzed: sākṣātkurvanti tām dharmatām sākṣātkṛtvā yat yat eva bhāṣante deśayanti upadiśanti
translated: realize that reality, having realized that reality, whatever they speak, teach, explain,

original: sarvaṃ tad dharmatayā na virudhyate /
analyzed: sarvam tat dharmatayā na virudhyate
translated: all that is not in conflict with reality.

original: tathāgata evaiṣa śāriputra upāyayogena bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitām upadekṣyati /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ eva eṣa śāriputra upāya yogena bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām upadekṣyati
translated: This, Śāriputra, is the Tathāgata himself, by the union of skillful means, who will teach the perfection of wisdom to the Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas.

original: aviṣayo 'tra śāriputra sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitām upadeṣṭum /
analyzed: aviṣayaḥ tra śāriputra sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām upadeṣṭum
translated: Here, Śāriputra, it is not within the domain of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas to teach the perfection of wisdom to bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: iti darśanamārgāvavādopakṣepaḥ
analyzed: iti darśana mārga avavāda upakṣepaḥ
translated: Thus ends the introduction to the instruction on the path of seeing.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: bodhisattva iti bhagavann ucyate /
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ iti bhagavan ucyate
translated: Blessed One, it is said 'bodhisattva'.

original: katamasyaitad bhagavan dharmasyādhivacanaṃ yad uta bodhisattva iti /
analyzed: katamasya etat bhagavan dharmasya adhivacanam yat uta bodhisattvaḥ iti
translated: Blessed One, what is the designation of this dharma called 'bodhisattva'?

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan dharmaṃ samanupaśyāmi yad uta bodhisattva iti /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan dharmam samanupaśyāmi yat uta bodhisattvaḥ iti
translated: Blessed One, I do not see any dharma called 'bodhisattva'.

original: so 'haṃ bhagavan bodhisattvam asamanupaśyan prajñāpāramitām apy anupalabhamānaḥ katamaṃ bodhisattvaṃ katamasyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ vadiṣyāmi /
analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavan bodhisattvam a samanupaśyan prajñāpāramitām api an upalabhamānaḥ katamam bodhisattvam katamasyām prajñāpāramitāyām vadiṣyāmi
translated: Blessed One, not seeing any bodhisattva, and not apprehending any perfection of wisdom, which bodhisattva should I instruct in which perfection of wisdom?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: nāmamātram idaṃ subhūte yad uta prajñāpāramitā iti bodhisattva iti ca /
analyzed: nāma mātram idam subhūte yat uta prajñāpāramitā iti bodhisattvaḥ iti ca
translated: Subhūti, this is merely a name, namely 'perfection of wisdom' and 'bodhisattva'.

original: tad api ca bodhisattvanāma nādhyātmaṃ na bahirdhā nobhayam antareṇopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat api ca bodhisattva nāma na adhyātmam na bahirdhā na ubhayam antareṇa upalabhyate
translated: And that name 'bodhisattva' is not apprehended either internally, externally, or in between.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte sattvaḥ sattva iti cocyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte sattvaḥ sattvaḥ iti ca ucyate
translated: For example, Subhūti, a being is said to be a being,

original: na ca kācit sattvopalabdhiḥ /
analyzed: na ca kācid sattva upalabdhiḥ
translated: but no being is apprehended.

original: yac ca tannāma tat prajñaptimātraṃ prajñaptidharmaḥ prajñaptisat /
analyzed: yat ca tat nāma tat prajñapti mātram prajñapti dharmaḥ prajñapti sat
translated: And that name is merely a designation, a dharma of designation, a designation-existence.

original: iti duḥkhe dharmajñānakṣāntiḥ
analyzed: iti duḥkhe dharma jñāna kṣāntiḥ
translated: Thus is the receptivity to the knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering.

original: tasyāś ca dharmaprajñapter notpādo na nirodho 'nyatra nāmasaṃketamātreṇa vyavahriyate /
analyzed: tasyāḥ ca dharma prajñapteḥ na utpādaḥ na nirodhaḥ nyatra nāma saṃketa mātreṇa vyavahriyate
translated: And that designation of dharmas has no arising, no cessation, except for being conventionally expressed by a mere name and symbol.

original: evam ātmasattvajīvapoṣapuruṣapudgalamanujamānavakārakavedakajānakapaśyakāḥ sarva ete prajñaptidharmāḥ sarva ete anutpādā anirodhā yāvad eva
analyzed: evam ātma sattva jīva poṣa puruṣa pudgala manuja mānava kāraka vedaka jānaka paśyakāḥ sarve ete prajñapti dharmāḥ sarve ete anutpādāḥ anirodhāḥ yāvat eva
translated: In the same way, self, being, soul, nourishment, person, individual, human, doer, feeler, knower, seer - all of these are designated dharmas, all of these are non-arising, non-cessation, up to
