analyzed: prajñāpāramitā āyuṣman śāriputra na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom does not exist and is not apprehended.

original: dhyānapāramitā āyuṣmān śāriputra na vidyate nopalabhyate /🔽vīryapāramitā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā āyuṣmān śāriputra na vidyate na upalabhyate  vīrya pāramitā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The perfection of concentration, Venerable Śāriputra, does not exist and is not apprehended.🔽The perfection of perseverance does not exist and is not apprehended.

original: kṣāntipāramitā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The perfection of patience does not exist and is not apprehended.

original: śīlapāramitā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The perfection of morality does not exist and is not apprehended.

original: dānapāramitā āyuṣmān śāriputra na vidyate nopalabhyate /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā āyuṣmān śāriputra na vidyate na upalabhyate  adhyātma śūnyatām upādāya
translated: The perfection of giving, Venerable Śāriputra, does not exist and is not apprehended.🔽On the basis of the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: On the basis of the emptiness of external phenomena.🔽On the basis of the emptiness of external and internal phenomena.

original: śūnyatāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽mahāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatām upādāya  mahāśūnyatām upādāya
translated: On the basis of the emptiness of emptiness.🔽On the basis of great emptiness.

original: paramārthaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatām upādāya
translated: On the basis of the emptiness of ultimate reality.

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatām upādāya
translated: On account of the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: asaṃskṛtaśūnyatām upādāya /🔽atyantaśūnyatām upādāya /🔽anavarāgraśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: asaṃskṛta śūnyatām upādāya  atyanta śūnyatām upādāya  an avara agra śūnyatām upādāya
translated: On account of the emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽On account of the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽On account of the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.

original: anavakāraśūnyatām upādāya /🔽prakṛtiśūnyatām upādāya /🔽sarvadharmaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatām upādāya  prakṛti śūnyatām upādāya  sarva dharma śūnyatām upādāya
translated: On account of the emptiness of non-rejection.🔽On account of the emptiness of inherent nature.🔽On account of the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām upādāya
translated: On account of the emptiness of specific characteristics.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatām upādāya /🔽abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatām upādāya  abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām upādāya
translated: On account of the emptiness of non-apprehension.🔽On account of the emptiness of the own-being of non-existence.

original: bhāvaśūnyatām upādāya /🔽abhāvaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: bhāva śūnyatām upādāya  abhāva śūnyatām upādāya
translated: On account of the emptiness of existence.🔽On account of the emptiness of non-existence.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatām upādāya
translated: On account of the emptiness of own-being.

original: parabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: para bhāva śūnyatām upādāya
translated: On account of the emptiness of other-being.

original: rūpam āyuṣman śāriputra na vidyate nopalabhyate /🔽vedanā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: rūpam āyuṣman śāriputra na vidyate na upalabhyate  vedanā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Form, Venerable Śāriputra, is not found and is not apprehended.🔽Feeling is not found and is not apprehended.

original: saṃjñā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: saṃjñā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Perception is not found and is not apprehended.

original: saṃskārā na vidyante nopalabhyante /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ na vidyante na upalabhyante
translated: Formations are not found and are not apprehended.

original: vijñānam āyuṣman śāriputra na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: vijñānam āyuṣman śāriputra na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Consciousness, Venerable Śāriputra, is not found and is not apprehended.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatā āyuṣman śāriputra na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatā āyuṣman śāriputra na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, internal emptiness is not found and is not apprehended.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: External emptiness is not found and is not apprehended.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā na vidyate /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā na vidyate
translated: The emptiness of internal and external is not found.

original: nopalabhyate /
analyzed: na upalabhyate
translated: It is not perceived.

original: śūnyatāśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is not found and is not perceived.

original: mahāśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /🔽paramārthaśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: mahāśūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate  paramārtha śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Great emptiness is not found and is not perceived.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is not found and is not perceived.

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /🔽asaṃskṛtaśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /🔽atyantaśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate  asaṃskṛta śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate  atyanta śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The emptiness of the conditioned is not found and is not perceived.🔽The emptiness of the unconditioned is not found and is not perceived.🔽Absolute emptiness is not found and is not perceived.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /🔽anavakāraśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate  anavakāra śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The emptiness of what is endless and beginningless is not found and is not perceived.🔽The emptiness of non-rejection is not found and is not perceived.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The emptiness of nature is not found and is not perceived.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is not found and is not perceived.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The emptiness of specific characteristics is not found and is not perceived.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /🔽abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate  abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension is not found and is not perceived.🔽The emptiness of the nature of non-existence is not found and is not perceived.

original: bhāvaśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: bhāva śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The emptiness of existence is not found and is not perceived.

original: abhāvaśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The emptiness of non-existence is not found and is not perceived.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The emptiness of inherent nature is not found and is not apprehended.

original: parabhāvaśūnyatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: para bhāva śūnyatā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The emptiness of other entities is not found and is not apprehended.

original: yāvat saptatriṃśad bodhipakṣyā dharmā na vidyante nopalabhyante /
analyzed: yāvat saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ na vidyante na upalabhyante
translated: Up to the thirty-seven factors of awakening are not found and are not apprehended.

original: abhijñā na vidyante nopalabhyante /
analyzed: abhijñāḥ na vidyante na upalabhyante
translated: The superknowledges are not found and are not apprehended.

original: daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidaṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmā na vidyante nopalabhyante /
analyzed: daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid aṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ na vidyante na upalabhyante
translated: The ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not found and are not apprehended.

original: tathatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /🔽dharmatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /🔽dharme sthititā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathatā na vidyate na upalabhyate  dharmatā na vidyate na upalabhyate  dharme sthiti tā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Suchness is not found and is not apprehended.🔽The true nature is not found and is not apprehended.🔽The dharma-constituent is not found and is not apprehended.🔽The establishment of dharmas is not found and is not apprehended.

original: dharmaniyāmatā na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: dharma niyāma tā na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The certification of dharmas is not found and is not apprehended.

original: bhūtakoṭir na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: bhūtakoṭiḥ na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: The very limit of reality is not found and is not apprehended.

original: buddhāpy āyuṣman śāriputra na vidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: buddhā api āyuṣman śāriputra na vidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, even a buddha is not found and is not apprehended.

original: sarvākārajñatāpy āyuṣman śāriputra na vidyate nopalabhyate /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā api āyuṣman śāriputra na vidyate na upalabhyate  adhyātma śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, even an omniscient one is not found and is not apprehended.🔽On account of the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: yāvat parabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: yāvat para bhāva śūnyatām upādāya
translated: up to on account of the emptiness of other entities.

original: sacet punaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann evam upaparīkṣate
analyzed: saced punar śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran evam upaparīkṣate
translated: If, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom examines in this way,

original: evam upanidhyāyati tasyaivam upaparīkṣamāṇasyaivam upanidhyāyataś cittaṃ nāvalīyate
analyzed: evam upanidhyāyati tasya evam upaparīkṣamāṇasya evam upanidhyāyataḥ cittam na avalīyate
translated: and reflects in this way, then while examining in this way and reflecting in this way, his mind does not become cowed,

original: na saṃlīyate notrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate /
analyzed: na saṃlīyate na utrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate
translated: does not become timid, does not tremble, does not freeze, does not become frightened, does not become terrified.

original: avirahito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: avirahitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā veditavyaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva should be known as not separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: ity adhimātramūrdhagatālambanākāraviśeṣaḥ
analyzed: iti adhimātra mūrdha gata ālambana ākāra viśeṣaḥ
translated: This is the special object and aspect of the highest peak.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: kena kāraṇenāyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā avirahito veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā avirahitaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Venerable Subhūti, for what reason should a bodhisattva mahāsattva be known as not separated from the perfection of wisdom?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: rūpam āyuṣman śāriputra virahitaṃ rūpasvabhāvena /
analyzed: rūpam āyuṣman śāriputra virahitam rūpa svabhāvena
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, form is separated from the nature of form,

original: evaṃ vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā vijñānam āyuṣman śāriputra virahitaṃ vijñānasvabhāvena / dānapāramitāpy āyuṣman śāriputra virahitā dānapāramitāsvabhāvena /
analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ vijñānam āyuṣman śāriputra virahitam vijñāna svabhāvena dāna pāramitā api āyuṣman śāriputra virahitā dāna pāramitā svabhāvena
translated: The perfection of giving, venerable Śāriputra, is devoid of the nature of the perfection of giving.

original: evaṃ śīlapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: evam śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā
translated: In the same way, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,🔽and the perfection of concentration, venerable Śāriputra, are devoid of the nature of the perfection of concentration.

original: dhyānapāramitā prajñāpāramitāpy āyuṣman śāriputra virahitā prajñāpāramitāsvabhāvena /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā prajñāpāramitā api āyuṣman śāriputra virahitā prajñāpāramitā svabhāvena
translated: The perfection of wisdom, venerable Śāriputra, is devoid of the nature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: evam apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayaḥ smṛtyupasthānasamyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgapāramitābhijñākṣaradaśabalavaiśāradyāṣṭādaśāveṇikā
analyzed: evam apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ smṛti upasthāna samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārga pāramitā abhijñā akṣara daśa bala vaiśāradya aṣṭādaśa āveṇikā
translated: In the same way, the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless attainments, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the aspects of awakening, the path, the perfections, the superknowledges, the letters, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: buddhadharmā virahitā buddhadharmasvabhāvena /
analyzed: buddha dharmāḥ virahitāḥ buddha dharma svabhāvena
translated: and the buddhadharmas are devoid of the nature of the buddhadharmas.

original: bhūtakoṭir apy āyuṣman śāriputra virahitā bhūtakoṭisvabhāvena /
analyzed: bhūtakoṭiḥ api āyuṣman śāriputra virahitā bhūtakoṭi svabhāvena
translated: The very limit of reality, venerable Śāriputra, is devoid of the nature of the very limit of reality.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: kathaṃ punar āyuṣman subhūte rūpasya svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: katham punar āyuṣman subhūte rūpasya svabhāvaḥ
translated: “But, venerable Subhūti, what is the nature of form?🔽What is the nature of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness?🔽What is the nature of the perfections?

original: kathaṃ vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇāṃ /
analyzed: katham vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām
translated: What is the nature of the applications of mindfulness?🔽What is the nature of the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the aspects of awakening, and the path?🔽What is the nature of the emptiness of internal phenomena?🔽What is the nature of the emptiness of external phenomena?🔽What is the nature of the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena?🔽What is the nature of the emptiness of emptiness?🔽What is the nature of the emptiness of great extent?🔽What is the nature of the emptiness of ultimate reality?🔽What is the nature of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena?🔽What is the nature of the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena?🔽What is the nature of the emptiness of the unlimited?🔽What is the nature of the emptiness of the ultimate?🔽What is the nature of the emptiness of the primordially unborn?🔽What is the nature of the emptiness of non-dispersal?

original: kathaṃ vijñānasya svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: katham vijñānasya svabhāvaḥ
translated: What is the nature of the emptiness of inherent existence?

original: kathaṃ vyastasamastānāṃ skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādāṅgānāṃ svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: katham vyasta samastānām skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpāda aṅgānām svabhāvaḥ
translated: How is the nature of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and links of dependent origination, individually and collectively?

original: evaṃ vistareṇa yāvat kathaṃ bhūtakoṭyāḥ svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: evam vistareṇa yāvat katham bhūtakoṭyāḥ svabhāvaḥ
translated: In the same way, up to how is the nature of the peak of existence?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: abhāva āyuṣman śāriputra rūpasya svabhāvaḥ /🔽abhāvo vedanāyāḥ /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ āyuṣman śāriputra rūpasya svabhāvaḥ  abhāvaḥ vedanāyāḥ
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the nature of form is non-existence.🔽The nature of feeling is non-existence.

original: abhāvaḥ saṃjñāyāḥ /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ saṃjñāyāḥ
translated: The nature of perception is non-existence.

original: abhāvaḥ saṃskārāṇām /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ saṃskārāṇām
translated: The nature of volitional factors is non-existence.

original: abhāvo vijñānasya svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ vijñānasya svabhāvaḥ
translated: The nature of consciousness is non-existence.

original: abhāvo vyastasamastānāṃ skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādānāṃ svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ vyasta samastānām skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādānām svabhāvaḥ
translated: The nature of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and links of dependent origination, individually and collectively, is non-existence.

original: abhāvaḥ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitānabhisaṃskārāṇāṃ jātaḥ svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita an abhisaṃskārāṇām jātaḥ svabhāvaḥ
translated: The nature of emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and non-production is non-existence.

original: abhāvaḥ tathatādharmadhātudharmasthititādharmaniyāmatānāṃ svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ tathatā dharma dhātu dharma sthiti tā dharma niyāma tānām svabhāvaḥ
translated: The nature of suchness, the dharma realm, the stability of dharmas, and the regulation of dharmas is non-existence.

original: evaṃ vistareṇa yāvad abhāvo bhūtakoṭyāḥ svabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: evam vistareṇa yāvat abhāvaḥ bhūtakoṭyāḥ svabhāvaḥ
translated: In the same way, up to the nature of the peak of existence is non-existence.

original: tad anena tvayāyuṣman śāriputra paryāyeṇaivaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: tat anena tvayā āyuṣman śāriputra paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāriputra, you should know that

original: yathā rūpaṃ virahitaṃ rūpasvabhāvena /🔽vedanā virahitā vedanāsvabhāvena /
analyzed: yathā rūpam virahitam rūpa svabhāvena  vedanā virahitā vedanā svabhāvena
translated: form is devoid of the nature of form.🔽Feeling is devoid of the nature of feeling.

original: saṃjñā virahitā saṃjñāsvabhāvena /
analyzed: saṃjñā virahitā saṃjñā svabhāvena
translated: Perception is devoid of the nature of perception.

original: saṃskārā virahitāḥ saṃskārasvabhāvena /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ virahitāḥ saṃskāra svabhāvena
translated: Formations are devoid of the nature of formations.

original: vijñānaṃ virahitaṃ vijñānasvabhāvena /
analyzed: vijñānam virahitam vijñāna svabhāvena
translated: Consciousness is devoid of the nature of consciousness.

original: evaṃ vistareṇa vyastasamasteṣu skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādeṣu kartavyaṃ /
analyzed: evam vistareṇa vyasta samasteṣu skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādeṣu kartavyam
translated: In the same way, it should be done in detail for the individual and combined aggregates, elements, sense bases, and dependent origination.

original: yāvad bhūtakoṭir virahitā bhūtakoṭisvabhāvena /
analyzed: yāvat bhūtakoṭiḥ virahitā bhūtakoṭi svabhāvena
translated: Up to the reality limit is devoid of the nature of the reality limit.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra rūpaṃ virahitaṃ rūpalakṣaṇena /🔽vedanā virahitā vedanālakṣaṇena /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra rūpam virahitam rūpa lakṣaṇena  vedanā virahitā vedanā lakṣaṇena
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, form is devoid of the characteristic of form.🔽Feeling is devoid of the characteristic of feeling.

original: saṃjñā virahitā saṃjñālakṣaṇena /
analyzed: saṃjñā virahitā saṃjñā lakṣaṇena
translated: Perception is devoid of the characteristic of perception.

original: saṃskārā virahitāḥ saṃskāralakṣaṇena /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ virahitāḥ saṃskāra lakṣaṇena
translated: Formations are devoid of the characteristic of formations.

original: vijñānaṃ virahitaṃ vijñānalakṣaṇena / evaṃ vistareṇa vyastasamasteṣu skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādeṣu kartavyaṃ /
analyzed: vijñānam virahitam vijñāna lakṣaṇena evam vistareṇa vyasta samasteṣu skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādeṣu kartavyam
translated: Consciousness is devoid of the characteristic of consciousness. In the same way, it should be done in detail for the individual and combined aggregates, elements, sense bases, and dependent origination.

original: yāvad bhūtakoṭir virahitā bhūtakoṭilakṣaṇena /🔽lakṣaṇasvabhāvenāpi lakṣaṇaṃ virahitaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat bhūtakoṭiḥ virahitā bhūtakoṭi lakṣaṇena  lakṣaṇa svabhāvena api lakṣaṇam virahitam
translated: Up to the reality limit is devoid of the characteristic of the reality limit.🔽Even the characteristic is devoid of the characteristic of its own nature.

original: svabhāvalakṣaṇenāpi svabhāvo virahitaḥ /
analyzed: svabhāva lakṣaṇena api svabhāvaḥ virahitaḥ
translated: Even the own nature is devoid of the own nature of its own characteristic.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: ya āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'tra śikṣiṣyate sa niryāsyati sarvākārajñatāyām /
analyzed: yaḥ āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śikṣiṣyate sa niryāsyati sarva ākārajña tāyām
translated: Venerable Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in this will attain complete knowing.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: evam etad āyuṣman śāriputra yo hy evam atra śikṣiṣyate sa niryāsyati sarvākārajñatāyām /
analyzed: evam etat āyuṣman śāriputra yaḥ hi evam atra śikṣiṣyate sa niryāsyati sarva ākārajña tāyām
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is just so. Whoever trains in this will attain complete knowing.

original: iti mṛdukṣānter ālambanākāraviśeṣaḥ
analyzed: iti mṛdu kṣānteḥ ālambana ākāra viśeṣaḥ
translated: This is the special object and aspect of the weak acceptance.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hy āyuṣman śāriputra ajātā aniryātāḥ sarvadharmāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi āyuṣman śāriputra a jātāḥ a niryātāḥ sarva dharmāḥ
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, all dharmas are unborn and do not depart.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kena kāraṇenāyuṣman subhūte ajātā aniryātāḥ sarvadharmāḥ /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena āyuṣman subhūte a jātāḥ a niryātāḥ sarva dharmāḥ
translated: Venerable Subhūti, for what reason are all dharmas unborn and do not depart?

original: subhūtir āha /🔽rūpam āyuṣman śāriputra śūnyaṃ rūpasvabhāvena tasya nāpi jātir nāpi niryāṇam upalabhyate /🔽vedanā śāriputra śūnyā vedanāsvabhāvena tasyā nāpi jātir nāpi niryāṇam upalabhyate /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha  rūpam āyuṣman śāriputra śūnyam rūpa svabhāvena tasya nā api jātiḥ nā api niryāṇam upalabhyate  vedanā śāriputra śūnyā vedanā svabhāvena tasyāḥ nā api jātiḥ nā api niryāṇam upalabhyate
translated: Subhūti said:🔽Venerable Śāriputra, form is empty of the intrinsic nature of form. Its birth and departure are not apprehended.🔽Feeling, Śāriputra, is empty of the intrinsic nature of feeling. Its birth and departure are not apprehended.

original: saṃjñā śāriputra śūnyā saṃjñāsvabhāvena tasyā nāpi jātir nāpi niryāṇam upalabhyate /
analyzed: saṃjñā śāriputra śūnyā saṃjñā svabhāvena tasyāḥ nā api jātiḥ nā api niryāṇam upalabhyate
translated: Perception, Śāriputra, is empty of the intrinsic nature of perception. Its birth and departure are not apprehended.

original: saṃskārāḥ śāriputra śūnyāḥ saṃskārasvabhāvena teṣāṃ nāpi jātir nāpi niryāṇam upalabhyate /
analyzed: saṃskārāḥ śāriputra śūnyāḥ saṃskāra svabhāvena teṣām na api jātiḥ na api niryāṇam upalabhyate
translated: “Form, Śāriputra, is empty of the intrinsic nature of form. Its production is not perceived, its cessation is not perceived, its defilement is not perceived, its purification is not perceived.🔽“Consciousness, Śāriputra, is empty of the intrinsic nature of consciousness. Its production is not perceived, its cessation is not perceived, its defilement is not perceived, its purification is not perceived.

original: vijñānam āyuṣman śāriputra śūnyaṃ vijñānasvabhāvena tasya nāpi jātir nāpi niryāṇam upalabhyate / evaṃ vistareṇa vyastasamasteṣu skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādeṣu
analyzed: vijñānam āyuṣman śāriputra śūnyam vijñāna svabhāvena tasya nā api jātiḥ nā api niryāṇam upalabhyate evam vistareṇa vyasta samasteṣu skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādeṣu
translated: In the same way, Śāriputra, the aggregates, the elements, the sense-fields, dependent origination,

original: yāvad bhūtakoṭiḥ śūnyā bhūtakoṭisvabhāvena tasyā nāpi jātir nāpi niryāṇam upalabhyate /
analyzed: yāvat bhūtakoṭiḥ śūnyā bhūtakoṭi svabhāvena tasyāḥ na api jātiḥ na api niryāṇam upalabhyate
translated: up to the very limit of existence is empty of the intrinsic nature of the very limit of existence. Its production is not perceived, its cessation is not perceived, its defilement is not perceived, its purification is not perceived.

original: evaṃ hi śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāñ caran sarvākārajñatāyā
analyzed: evam hi śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran sarva ākāra jña tāyāḥ
translated: In this way, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: āsannībhavati yathā yathā ca sarvākārajñatāyā āsannībhavati tathā tathā kāyapariśuddhiñ
analyzed: āsannībhavati yathā yathā ca sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ āsannībhavati tathā tathā kāya pariśuddhiḥ
translated: approaches omniscience. As he approaches omniscience, to that extent he attains the purification of body,

original: ca cittapariśuddhiñ ca lakṣaṇapariśuddhiṃ cādhigacchati /
analyzed: ca citta pariśuddhim ca lakṣaṇa pariśuddhim ca adhigacchati
translated: the purification of mind, and the purification of the marks.

original: yathā yathā ca kāyapariśuddhiṃ ca cittapariśuddhiṃ ca lakṣaṇapariśuddhiṃ cādhigacchati
analyzed: yathā yathā ca kāya pariśuddhim ca citta pariśuddhim ca lakṣaṇa pariśuddhim ca adhigacchati
translated: As he attains the purification of body, the purification of mind, and the purification of the marks,

original: tathā tathā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya rāgasahagataṃ cittaṃ notpadyate doṣasahagataṃ
analyzed: tathā tathā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya rāga sahagatam cittam na utpadyate doṣa sahagatam
translated: In that way, the mind of the bodhisattva mahāsattva is not produced with passion,🔽the mind is not produced with aversion,

original: cittaṃ notpadyate mohasahagataṃ cittaṃ notpadyate mānasahagataṃ cittaṃ notpadyate
analyzed: cittam na utpadyate moha sahagatam cittam na utpadyate māna sahagatam cittam na utpadyate
translated: the mind is not produced with delusion, the mind is not produced with pride,

original: lobhasahagataṃ cittaṃ notpadyate kudṛṣṭisahagataṃ cittaṃ notpadyate sa rāgacittānutpādād
analyzed: lobha sahagatam cittam na utpadyate kudṛṣṭi sahagatam cittam na utpadyate sa rāga citta anutpādāt
translated: the mind is not produced with greed, the mind is not produced with wrong views. He, due to the non-production of a mind with passion,

original: doṣacittānutpādān mohacittānutpādān mānacittānutpādāl lobhacittānutpādāt kudṛṣṭicittānutpādād
analyzed: doṣa citta anutpādāt moha citta anutpādāt māna citta anutpādāt lobha citta anutpādāt kudṛṣṭi citta anutpādāt
translated: due to the non-production of a mind with aversion, due to the non-production of a mind with delusion, due to the non-production of a mind with pride, due to the non-production of a mind with greed, due to the non-production of a mind with wrong views,

original: na jātu mātuḥ kukṣāv upapadyate /
analyzed: na jātu mātuḥ kukṣau upapadyate
translated: never takes birth in a mother's womb.

original: satatasamitam aupapāduko bhavati /
analyzed: satata samitam aupapādukaḥ bhavati
translated: He is always spontaneously born.

original: buddhakṣetreṇa buddhakṣetraṃ saṃkrāmati /
analyzed: buddhakṣetreṇa buddhakṣetram saṃkrāmati
translated: He goes from buddha-field to buddha-field.

original: buddhāṃś ca bhagavataḥ paryupāste / /
analyzed: buddhān ca bhagavataḥ paryupāste
translated: And he attends on the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: sattvāṃś ca paripācayati /
analyzed: sattvān ca paripācayati
translated: He brings beings to maturity.

original: buddhakṣetraṃ ca pariśodhayati /
analyzed: buddhakṣetram ca pariśodhayati
translated: He purifies the buddha-field.

original: na tair buddhair bhagavadbhir virahito bhavati /
analyzed: na taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ virahitaḥ bhavati
translated: He is never separated from those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: yāvad anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ / evaṃ hi śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattva āsannībhavaty anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: yāvat anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ evam hi śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āsannībhavati anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: up to the time when he has fully known the supreme enlightenment. In this way, Śāriputra, the Bodhisattva, the great being, comes near to the supreme enlightenment.

original: iti madhyakṣānter ālambanākāraviśeṣaḥ
analyzed: iti madhyakṣa anteḥ ālambana ākāra viśeṣaḥ
translated: Thus is the special object and aspect of the middle acceptance.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: saced bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nupāyakuśalaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran rūpe carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na upāya kuśalaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran rūpe carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Blessed One, if a Bodhisattva, a great being, lacking skillful means, practicing the perfection of wisdom, practices in form, he practices in a causal sign, he does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced vedanāyāṃ carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced vedanāyām carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If he practices in feeling, he practices in a causal sign, he does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: sacet saṃjñāyāṃ carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced saṃjñāyām carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If he practices in perception, he practices in a causal sign, he does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: sacet saṃskāreṣu carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced saṃskāreṣu carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If he practices in volitional formations, he practices in a causal sign, he does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced vijñāne carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: saced vijñāne carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If he practices in consciousness, he practices in a causal sign, he does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced rūpaṃ nityam anityaṃ veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /🔽saced vedanā nityā anityā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /🔽saced saṃjñā nityā anityā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced rūpam nityam anityam vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām  saced vedanā nityā anityā vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām  saced saṃjñā nityā anityā vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices thinking 'form is permanent' or 'impermanent,' one practices with signs, not with the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one practices thinking 'feeling is permanent' or 'impermanent,' one practices with signs, not with the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one practices thinking 'perception is permanent' or 'impermanent,' one practices with signs, not with the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced saṃskārā nityam anityaṃ veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced saṃskārāḥ nityam anityam vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices thinking 'volitional formations are permanent' or 'impermanent,' one practices with signs, not with the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced vijñānaṃ nityam anityaṃ veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām /🔽saced rūpaṃ sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /🔽saced vedanā sukhā duḥkhā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced vijñānam nityam anityam vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām  saced rūpam sukham duḥkham vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām  saced vedanā sukhā duḥkhā vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices thinking 'consciousness is permanent' or 'impermanent,' one practices with signs, not with the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one practices thinking 'form is happiness' or 'suffering,' one practices with signs, not with the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one practices thinking 'feeling is happiness' or 'suffering,' one practices with signs, not with the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced saṃjñā sukhā duḥkhā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced saṃjñā sukhā duḥkhā vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices thinking 'perception is happiness' or 'suffering,' one practices with signs, not with the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced saṃskārāḥ sukhā duḥkhā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced saṃskārāḥ sukhāḥ duḥkhāḥ vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices that the formative forces are pleasant or unpleasant, one practices with a sign, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced vijñānaṃ sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: saced vijñānam sukham duḥkham vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices that consciousness is pleasant or unpleasant, one practices with a sign, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced rūpam ātmā anātmā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /🔽saced vedanā ātmā anātmā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /🔽saced saṃjñā ātmā anātmā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced rūpam ātmā anātmā vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām  saced vedanā ātmā anātmā vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām  saced saṃjñā ātmā anātmā vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices that form is a self or not a self, one practices with a sign, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one practices that feeling is a self or not a self, one practices with a sign, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one practices that perception is a self or not a self, one practices with a sign, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced saṃskārā ātmāno 'nātmāno veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced saṃskārāḥ ātmānaḥ na ātmānaḥ vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices that the formative forces are a self or not a self, one practices with a sign, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced vijñānam ātmā anātmā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: saced vijñānam ātmā anātmā vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices that consciousness is a self or not a self, one practices with a sign, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced rūpaṃ śāntam aśāntaṃ veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced rūpam śāntam a śāntam vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices that form is calm or not calm, one practices with a sign, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced vedanā śāntā aśāntā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced vedanā śāntā a śāntā vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices thinking 'feeling is peaceful or not peaceful', one practices with signs, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced saṃjñā śāntā aśāntā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /🔽saced saṃskārāḥ śāntā aśāntā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced saṃjñā śāntā a śāntā vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām  saced saṃskārāḥ śāntāḥ a śāntāḥ vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices thinking 'perception is peaceful or not peaceful', one practices with signs, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one practices thinking 'volitional formations are peaceful or not peaceful', one practices with signs, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced vijñānaṃ śāntam aśāntaṃ veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: saced vijñānam śāntam a śāntam vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices thinking 'consciousness is peaceful or not peaceful', one practices with signs, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced rūpaṃ viviktam aviviktaṃ veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /🔽saced vedanā viviktā aviviktā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /🔽saced saṃjñā viviktā aviviktā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced rūpam viviktam a viviktam vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām  saced vedanā viviktā a viviktā vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām  saced saṃjñā viviktā a viviktā vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices thinking 'form is secluded or not secluded', one practices with signs, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one practices thinking 'feeling is secluded or not secluded', one practices with signs, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽If one practices thinking 'perception is secluded or not secluded', one practices with signs, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced saṃskārā viviktā aviviktā veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: saced saṃskārāḥ viviktāḥ a viviktāḥ vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices thinking 'volitional formations are secluded or not secluded', one practices with signs, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced vijñānaṃ viviktam aviviktaṃ veti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: saced vijñānam viviktam a viviktam vā iti carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If one practices with the idea that consciousness is either isolated or not isolated, one practices with signs, and does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann anupāyakuśalaḥ saptatriṃśatsu bodhipakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu carati nimitte carati
analyzed: saced bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran an upāya kuśalaḥ saptatriṃśatsu bodhi pakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu carati nimitte carati
translated: If, Blessed One, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom, lacking skillful means, practices the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, one practices with signs,

original: na carati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: and does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ yāvad abhijñāsu pāramitāsv apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiṣu pañcasu cakṣuḥṣu daśasu
analyzed: evam yāvat abhijñāsu pāramitāsu apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiṣu pañcasu cakṣuḥṣu daśasu
translated: Similarly, up to practicing the superknowledges, perfections, immeasurables, concentrations, formless attainments, five eyes,

original: tathāgatabaleṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu yāvad aṣṭādaśasv āveṇikeṣu
analyzed: tathāgata baleṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu yāvat aṣṭādaśasu āveṇikeṣu
translated: ten powers of the Tathāgata, four fearlessnesses, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a Buddha,

original: buddhadharmeṣu carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: buddha dharmeṣu carati nimitte carati na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: one practices with signs, and does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: saced bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyānupāyakauśalena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carata evaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: saced bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya an upāya kauśalena prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ evam bhavati
translated: If, Blessed One, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, lacking skillful means, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, thinks like this:

original: ahaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carāmīty upalambhe carati /
analyzed: aham prajñāpāramitāyām carāmi iti upalambhe carati
translated: I am practicing the perfection of wisdom, one practices with an object.

original: ahaṃ carāmīti carati nimitte carati /
analyzed: aham carāmi iti carati nimitte carati
translated: I am practicing, one practices with signs.

original: saced bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyaivaṃ bhavati /🔽ya evaṃ carati sa prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carati /
analyzed: saced bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya evam bhavati  yaḥ evam carati sa prajñāpāramitāyām carati
translated: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva thinks like this:🔽One who practices like this practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: sa prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāvayatīti nimitta eva sa carati /
analyzed: sa prajñāpāramitāyām bhāvayati iti nimitte eva sa carati
translated: One who cultivates the perfection of wisdom in this way practices with signs.

original: idaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyānupāyakauśalaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: idam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya an upāya kauśalam veditavyam
translated: This should be known as a bodhisattva-mahāsattva's lack of skillful means.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: kena kāraṇenāyuṣman subhūte idaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyānupāyakauśalaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena āyuṣman subhūte idam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya an upāya kauśalam veditavyam
translated: Venerable Subhūti, for what reason should this be known as a bodhisattva-mahāsattva's lack of skillful means?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: tathā hy āyuṣman śāriputra yo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran rūpam adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /🔽vedanām adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: tathā hi āyuṣman śāriputra yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran rūpam adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate  vedanām adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is because a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom, while practicing, regards form, conceives of it, and becomes attached to it.🔽He regards feeling, conceives of it, and becomes attached to it.

original: saṃjñām adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: saṃjñām adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: He regards perception, conceives of it, and becomes attached to it.

original: saṃskārān adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: saṃskārān adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: He regards volitional factors, conceives of them, and becomes attached to them.

original: vijñānam /
analyzed: vijñānam
translated: He regards consciousness,

original: adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: regards it, conceives of it, and becomes attached to it.

original: sa rūpam adhitiṣṭhan saṃjānāno 'dhimucyamānaḥ /🔽vedanām adhitiṣṭhan saṃjānāno 'dhimucyamānaḥ /
analyzed: sa rūpam adhitiṣṭhan saṃjānānaḥ dhimucyamānaḥ  vedanām adhitiṣṭhan saṃjānānaḥ dhimucyamānaḥ
translated: Abiding in form, cognizing, and being attached,🔽abiding in feeling, cognizing, and being attached,

original: saṃjñām adhitiṣṭhan saṃjānāno 'dhimucyamānaḥ /
analyzed: saṃjñām adhitiṣṭhan saṃjānānaḥ dhimucyamānaḥ
translated: abiding in perception, cognizing, and being attached,

original: saṃskārān adhitiṣṭhan saṃjānāno 'dhimucyamānaḥ /
analyzed: saṃskārān adhitiṣṭhan saṃjānānaḥ dhimucyamānaḥ
translated: abiding in volitional formations, cognizing, and being attached,

original: vijñānam adhitiṣṭhan saṃjānāno 'dhimucyamānaḥ /
analyzed: vijñānam adhitiṣṭhan saṃjānānaḥ dhimucyamānaḥ
translated: abiding in consciousness, cognizing, and being attached,

original: rūpasyābhisaṃskāre carati vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇāṃ vijñānasyābhisaṃskāre carati tat tasya jātijarāmaraṇaśokaparidevaduḥkhadaurmanasyopāyāsakaram
analyzed: rūpasya abhisaṃskāre carati vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām vijñānasya abhisaṃskāre carati tat tasya jāti jarā maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsa karam
translated: he practices the fabrication of form, he practices the fabrication of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness. That leads to his birth, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish.

original: iti vadāmi /
analyzed: iti vadāmi
translated: I say this.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra saced bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann anupāyakuśalaḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra saced bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran an upāya kuśalaḥ
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, is unskilled in means,

original: cakṣur adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: he abides in the eye, cognizes, and is attached,

original: śrotraṃ ghrāṇaṃ jihvāṃ kāyañ mano 'dhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: śrotram ghrāṇam jihvām kāyam manaḥ dhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: he abides in the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, cognizes, and is attached.

original: rūpam adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: rūpam adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: He abides in form, cognizes, and is attached,

original: śabdān gandhān rasān spraṣṭavyān dharmān adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: śabdān gandhān rasān spraṣṭavyān dharmān adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: He endures, cognizes, and is convinced of sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and mental phenomena.

original: cakṣurvijñānaṃ śrotravijñānaṃ ghrāṇavijñānaṃ jihvāvijñānaṃ kāyavijñānaṃ manovijñānam adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānam śrotra vijñānam ghrāṇa vijñānam jihvā vijñānam kāya vijñānam manaḥ vijñānam adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: He endures, cognizes, and is convinced of eye-consciousness, ear-consciousness, nose-consciousness, tongue-consciousness, body-consciousness, and mind-consciousness.

original: sacec cakṣuḥsaṃsparśam adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: saced cakṣuḥ saṃsparśam adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: If he endures, cognizes, and is convinced of eye-contact,

original: sacec chrotraghrāṇajihvākāyamanaḥsaṃsparśam adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: saced śrotra ghrāṇa jihvā kāya manaḥ saṃsparśam adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: if he endures, cognizes, and is convinced of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind-contact,

original: sacec cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā duḥkhaṃ vā aduḥkhāsukhaṃ vādhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: saced cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedayitam sukham vā duḥkham vā aduḥkha asukham vā adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: if he endures, cognizes, and is convinced of the feeling that arises from eye-contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant,

original: sacec chrotraghrāṇajihvākāyamanaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā duḥkhaṃ vā aduḥkhāsukhaṃ vādhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: saced śrotra ghrāṇa jihvā kāya manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedayitam sukham vā duḥkham vā aduḥkha asukham vā adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: if he endures, cognizes, and is convinced of the feeling that arises from ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind-contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant,

original: sacet saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣān dharmān adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: saced saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣān dharmān adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: if he endures, cognizes, and is convinced of the thirty-seven factors of awakening,

original: evaṃ pañca cakṣūṃṣi ṣaḍ abhijñāḥ ṣaṭ pāramitāś catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaś
analyzed: evam pañca cakṣūṃṣi ṣaḍ abhijñāḥ ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ
translated: In the same way, he masters the five eyes, the six superknowledges, the six perfections, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: catvāry apramāṇāni catvāri dhyānāni catasra ārūpyasamāpattīr daśatathāgatabalāny
analyzed: catvāri apramāṇāni catvāri dhyānāni catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattīḥ daśa tathāgata balāni
translated: the four immeasurables, the four concentrations, the four formless absorptions, the ten tathāgata powers,

original: aṣṭādaśaveṇikān buddhadharmān arhattvaṃ pratyekabuddhatvaṃ bodhisattvatvaṃ buddhadharmān🔽adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte 'dhimucyate /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa veṇikān buddha dharmān arhat tvam pratyekabuddha tvam bodhisattva tvam buddha dharmān  adhitiṣṭhati saṃjānīte dhimucyate
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the state of an arhat, the state of a pratyekabuddha, the state of a bodhisattva, and the qualities of a buddha.

original: sarvān buddhadharmān adhitiṣṭhan saṃjānāno 'dhimucyamānaḥ /🔽buddhadharmāṇām abhisaṃskāre carati /
analyzed: sarvān buddha dharmān adhitiṣṭhan saṃjānānaḥ dhimucyamānaḥ  buddha dharmāṇām abhisaṃskāre carati
translated: He masters, knows, and believes in all the qualities of a buddha.🔽When he masters, knows, and believes in all the qualities of a buddha,🔽he practices the formation of all the qualities of a buddha.

original: abhisaṃskāre carann aparimucyate /
analyzed: abhisaṃskāre caran a parimucyate
translated: When he practices the formation of all the qualities of a buddha, he is not liberated.

original: jātyā jarayā maraṇena ca śokaparidevaduḥkhadaurmanasyopāyāsair na parimucyate duḥkheneti vadāmi /
analyzed: jātyā jarayā maraṇena ca śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsaiḥ na parimucyate duḥkhena iti vadāmi
translated: He is not liberated from birth, old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish. He is not liberated from suffering, I say.

original: sa khalu punaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'bhavyaḥ śrāvakabhūmiṃ pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ vā patituṃ kutaḥ so 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim /
analyzed: sa khalu punar śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhavyaḥ śrāvaka bhūmim pratyekabuddha bhūmim vā patitum kutas saḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, that bodhisattva mahāsattva is not able to fall to the level of the śrāvakas or the level of the pratyekabuddhas, let alone to the unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: abhisaṃbhotsyate nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate / evaṃ hi śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann anupāyakuśalo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: abhisaṃbhotsyate na idam sthānam vidyate evam hi śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran an upāya kuśalaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: He will not attain complete enlightenment. There is no such possibility. Thus, Shariputra, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom should be known as unskilled in means.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: katham āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran upāyakuśalo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: katham āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran upāya kuśalaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Venerable Subhūti, how should a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom be known as skilled in means?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: ya āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran na rūpam adhitiṣṭhati na saṃjānīte nādhimucyate /
analyzed: yaḥ āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran na rūpam adhitiṣṭhati na saṃjānīte na adhimucyate
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom does not grasp at form, does not perceive it, and does not become attached to it.

original: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārān vijñānaṃ nādhitiṣṭhati na saṃjānīte nādhimucyate /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārān vijñānam na adhitiṣṭhati na saṃjānīte na adhimucyate
translated: He does not grasp at feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness, does not perceive them, and does not become attached to them.

original: evaṃ yāvad buddhadharmān nādhitiṣṭhati na saṃjānīte nādhimucyate /🔽sa na rūpe carati na vedanāyāṃ na saṃjñāyāṃ na saṃskāreṣu na vijñāne carati /
analyzed: evam yāvat buddha dharmān na adhitiṣṭhati na saṃjānīte na adhimucyate  sa na rūpe carati na vedanāyām na saṃjñāyām na saṃskāreṣu na vijñāne carati
translated: In the same way, up to the Buddha-dharmas, he does not grasp at them, does not perceive them, and does not become attached to them.🔽He does not practice in form, does not practice in feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness.

original: na rūpasya nimitte carati na vedanāyā na saṃjñāyā na saṃskārāṇāṃ na vijñanasya nimitte carati /
analyzed: na rūpasya nimitte carati na vedanāyāḥ na saṃjñāyāḥ na saṃskārāṇām na vijñanasya nimitte carati
translated: He does not practice in the sign of form, does not practice in the sign of feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness.

original: na rūpaṃ nityam iti nānityam iti carati /
analyzed: na rūpam nityam iti na anityam iti carati
translated: He does not practice thinking 'form is permanent' or 'impermanent'.

original: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā na vijñānaṃ nityam iti nānityam iti carati /
analyzed: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ na vijñānam nityam iti na anityam iti carati
translated: He does not practice thinking 'feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness is permanent' or 'impermanent'.

original: na rūpaṃ sukham iti na duḥkham iti nātmeti nānātmeti na śāntam iti nāśāntam iti carati /
analyzed: na rūpam sukham iti na duḥkham iti na ātmā iti na anātmā iti na śāntam iti na aśāntam iti carati
translated: He does not practice thinking 'form is happiness' or 'suffering', 'self' or 'non-self', 'peaceful' or 'not peaceful'.

original: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā na vijñānaṃ sukham iti na duḥkham iti nātmeti nānātmeti /
analyzed: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ na vijñānam sukham iti na duḥkham iti na ātmā iti na anātmā iti
translated: He does not practice thinking 'feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness is happiness' or 'suffering', 'self' or 'non-self',

original: na śāntam iti nāśāntam iti carati /
analyzed: na śāntam iti na a śāntam iti carati
translated: 'peaceful' or 'not peaceful'.

original: na rūpaṃ śūnyam iti nāśūnyam iti carati na nimittam iti nānimittam iti carati /
analyzed: na rūpam śūnyam iti na a śūnyam iti carati na nimittam iti na a nimittam iti carati
translated: He does not practice thinking 'form is empty' or 'not empty', 'with sign' or 'signless',

original: na praṇihitam iti nāpraṇihitam iti carati na viviktam iti nāviviktam iti carati /
analyzed: na praṇihitam iti na apraṇihitam iti carati na viviktam iti na aviviktam iti carati
translated: 'with a basis' or 'without a basis'.

original: evaṃ na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā na vijñānaṃ na śūnyam iti nāśūnyam iti carati /
analyzed: evam na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ na vijñānam na śūnyam iti na a śūnyam iti carati
translated: Similarly, he does not practice thinking 'feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness is empty' or 'not empty',

original: na nimittam iti nānimittam iti carati na praṇihitam iti nāpraṇihitam iti carati /🔽na viviktam iti nāviviktam iti carati /
analyzed: na nimittam iti na animittam iti carati na praṇihitam iti na apraṇihitam iti carati 🔽na viviktam iti na a viviktam iti carati
translated: 'with sign' or 'signless', 'with a basis' or 'without a basis'.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi āyuṣman śāriputra yā rūpasya śūnyatā na tad rūpaṃ /
analyzed: tathā hi āyuṣman śāriputra yā rūpasya śūnyatā na tat rūpam
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is because the emptiness of form is not form.

original: na cānyatra śūnyatāyāḥ rūpaṃ /
analyzed: na ca anyatra śūnyatāyāḥ rūpam
translated: And form is not other than emptiness.

original: nānyatra rūpāc chūnyatā /
analyzed: na anyatra rūpāt śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness is not other than form.

original: rūpam eva śūnyatā śūnyataivaṃ rūpam /🔽yā vedanāyāḥ śūnyatā saṃjñāyāḥ śūnyatā saṃskārāṇāṃ śūnyatā /
analyzed: rūpam eva śūnyatā śūnyatā evam rūpam  yā vedanāyāḥ śūnyatā saṃjñāyāḥ śūnyatā saṃskārāṇām śūnyatā
translated: Form itself is emptiness, and emptiness itself is form.

original: yā vijñānasya śūnyatā na tad vijñānaṃ /
analyzed: yā vijñānasya śūnya tā na tat vijñānam
translated: The emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness is not feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: na cānyatra śūnyatāyā vijñānaṃ /
analyzed: na ca anyatra śūnyatāyāḥ vijñānam
translated: And consciousness is not other than emptiness.

original: nānyatra vijñānāc chūnyatā /
analyzed: na anyatra vijñānāt śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness is not other than consciousness.

original: śūnyataiva vijñānaṃ vijñānam eva śūnyatā /
analyzed: śūnyatā eva vijñānam vijñānam eva śūnyatā
translated: Consciousness itself is emptiness, and emptiness itself is consciousness.🔽In the same way, in the individual and combined aggregates, elements, sense fields, dependent origination,

original: evaṃ vyastasamasteṣu skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādeṣu saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣeṣu
analyzed: evam vyasta samasteṣu skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādeṣu saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣeṣu
translated: thirty-seven factors of awakening,

original: dharmeṣu pāramitāsv abhijñāsu apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiṣu balavaiśāradyeṣu pratisaṃvitsu
analyzed: dharmeṣu pāramitāsu abhijñāsu apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiṣu bala vaiśāradyeṣu pratisaṃvitsu
translated: perfections, superknowledges, immeasurable concentrations, formless attainments, powers, fearlessnesses, specific knowledges,

original: āveṇikeṣubuddhadharmeṣu /🔽yāvad yā buddhadharmāṇāṃ śūnyatā na te buddhadharmā / /
analyzed: āveṇika iṣu buddha dharmeṣu  yāvat yā buddha dharmāṇām śūnyatā na te
translated: and eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha.🔽The emptiness of the qualities of a buddha is not the qualities of a buddha.

original: na cānyatra śūnyatāyā buddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: na ca anyatra śūnyatāyāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: And the qualities of a buddha are not other than emptiness.

original: nānyatra buddhadharmebhyaḥ śūnyatā /
analyzed: na anyatra buddha dharmebhyaḥ śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness is nothing other than the Buddha-qualities.

original: śūnyataiva buddhadharmā buddhadharmā eva śūnyatā /
analyzed: śūnyatā eva buddha dharmāḥ buddha dharmāḥ eva śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness itself is the Buddha-qualities, the Buddha-qualities themselves are emptiness.

original: evam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann upāyakuśalo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: evam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran upāya kuśalaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Thus, Venerable Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom should be known as skilled in means.

original: evaṃ hy āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran bhavyo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhuṃ /
analyzed: evam hi āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran bhavyaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum
translated: For it is thus, Venerable Śāriputra, that a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom is fit to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: sa punaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran sacet kaṃcid dharmam upaiti na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: sa punar prajñāpāramitāyām caran saced kaṃcid dharmam upaiti na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Moreover, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, if he approaches any dharma, he does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: nopaiti na carati /
analyzed: na upaiti na carati
translated: If he does not approach, he does not practice.

original: upaiti nopaiti ca na carati /
analyzed: upaiti na upaiti ca na carati
translated: If he both approaches and does not approach, he does not practice.

original: naivopaiti na nopaiti ca na carati prajñāpāramitāyām /
analyzed: na eva upaiti na na upaiti ca na carati prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: If he neither approaches nor does not approach, he does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kena kāraṇenāyuṣman subhūte nopaiti bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena āyuṣman subhūte nā upaiti bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran
translated: Venerable Subhūti, why does a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom not approach?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: tathā hy āyuṣman śāriputra prajñāpāramitāyāḥ svabhāvo nopalabhyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi āyuṣman śāriputra prajñāpāramitāyāḥ svabhāvaḥ na upalabhyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is because the intrinsic nature of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended. Why is that?

original: tathā hy abhāvasvabhāvā prajñāpāramitā /🔽anenāyuṣman śāriputra paryāyeṇa bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carāmīti nopaiti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhāva svabhāvā prajñāpāramitā  anena āyuṣman śāriputra paryāyeṇa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carāmi iti nā upaiti
translated: For thus, the perfection of wisdom has the nature of non-existence.

original: na carāmīti nopaiti /
analyzed: na carāmi iti na upaiti
translated: By this method, O Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who courses in the perfection of wisdom does not approach 'I course', does not approach 'I do not course',

original: carāmi ca na carāmi ceti nopaiti /
analyzed: carāmi ca na carāmi ca iti na upaiti
translated: does not approach 'I both course and do not course',

original: naiva carāmi na na carāmīti nopaiti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na eva carāmi na na carāmi iti na upaiti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: does not approach 'I neither course nor do not course'. Why is that?

original: tathā hi tena sarvadharmā abhāvasvabhāvā ity anugatā anupāttāḥ / saced evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: tathā hi tena sarva dharmāḥ abhāva svabhāvāḥ iti anugatāḥ an upāttāḥ saced evam prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: For thus, by him all dharmas have been followed as having the nature of non-existence, not grasped. If, while coursing thus in the perfection of wisdom,

original: carato bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya cittaṃ nāvalīyate na saṃlīyate nottrasyati na
analyzed: carataḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya cittam na avalīyate na saṃlīyate na uttrasyati na
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva's mind does not become cowed, does not become stolid, does not become frightened,

original: saṃtrāsam āpadyate veditavyam /
analyzed: saṃtrāsam āpadyate veditavyam
translated: does not become terrified, it should be known that

original: āyuṣman śāriputrāsannībhavaty ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvākārajñatāyāḥ /
analyzed: āyuṣman śāriputra āsannībhavati ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ
translated: this bodhisattva mahāsattva, O Venerable Śāriputra, is approaching the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ity adhimātrakṣānter ālambanākāraviśeṣaḥ
analyzed: iti adhimātra kṣānteḥ ālambana ākāra viśeṣaḥ
translated: This is the difference in object and aspect of the great acceptance.

original: so 'pi khalv āyuṣman śāriputra sarvākārajñatāyā advayā advaidhīkārā sarvadharmābhāvasvabhāvatām
analyzed: sā u pi khalu āyuṣman śāriputra sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ advayā a dvaidhīkārā sarva dharma abhāva svabhāva tām
translated: And that, O Venerable Śāriputra, the knowledge of all aspects, is non-dual, not divided into two, the nature of the non-existence of all dharmas,

original: upādāya / ayaṃ sarvadharmasvabhāvānutpattir nāma samādhir bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ
analyzed: upādāya ayam sarva dharma svabhāva anutpattiḥ nāma samādhiḥ bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: Taking that as a basis, this samādhi called 'non-arising of the nature of all dharmas' of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: vipulaḥ puraskṛto 'pramāṇo niyato 'saṃhāryaḥ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhair anenāyuṣman
analyzed: vipulaḥ puraskṛtaḥ pramāṇaḥ niyataḥ saṃhāryaḥ sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ anena āyuṣman
translated: is vast, preeminent, immeasurable, certain, and cannot be taken away by all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas. Venerable

original: śāriputra samādhinā viharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhyate /
analyzed: śāriputra samādhinā viharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhyate
translated: Śāriputra, dwelling in this samādhi, the bodhisattva mahāsattva quickly awakens to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: katamair āyuṣman subhūte samādhibhir viharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate /
analyzed: katamaiḥ āyuṣman subhūte samādhibhiḥ viharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: Venerable Subhūti, in which samādhis does the bodhisattva mahāsattva dwell so as to quickly awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment?

original: subhūtir āha /🔽asty āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha  asti āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: Subhūti said:

original: śūraṅgamo nāma samādhir yena samādhinā viharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate /🔽asti ratnamudro nāma samādhiḥ /🔽asti sucandro nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: śūraṅgamaḥ nāma samādhiḥ yena samādhinā viharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate  asti ratnamudraḥ nāma samādhiḥ  asti sucandraḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, there is the samādhi called 'heroic stride' of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, dwelling in which samādhi the bodhisattva mahāsattva quickly awakens to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.🔽There is the samādhi called 'jewel seal.'🔽There is the samādhi called 'good moon.'

original: asti candradhvajaketur nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti candradhvajaketuḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the samādhi called 'banner-victory of the moon.'

analyzed: asti sarvadharmamudraḥ nāma samādhiḥ
