analyzed: asti akṣayākāraḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative absorption named inexhaustible aspect.

original: asti dhāraṇīpatir nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti dhāraṇīpatiḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative absorption named lord of retention.

original: asti samyaktvamithyātvasaṃgraho nāma samādhiḥ /🔽asti roṣaviroṣapratiroṣo nāma samādhiḥ /🔽asti vimalaprabho nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti samyaktva mithyātva saṃgrahaḥ nāma samādhiḥ  asti roṣa viroṣa pratiroṣaḥ nāma samādhiḥ  asti vimalaprabhaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative absorption named collecting rightness and wrongness.🔽There is the meditative absorption named anger, non-anger, and counter-anger.🔽There is the meditative absorption named stainless radiance.

original: asti śāravatī nāma samādhiḥ /🔽asti paripūrṇavimalacandraprabho nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti śāravatī nāma samādhiḥ  asti paripūrṇavimalacandraprabhaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative absorption named endowed with sound.🔽There is the meditative absorption named completely full stainless moon radiance.

original: asti vidyutprabho nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti vidyutprabhaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative absorption named lightning radiance.

original: asti mahāvyūho nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti mahāvyūhaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative absorption named great array.

original: asti sarvalokaprabhākaro nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti sarva loka prabhākaraḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative absorption named illuminating all worlds.

original: asti samādhisamā nāma samādhiḥ /🔽asty anayavinayanayavimukto nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti samādhisamā nāma samādhiḥ  asti anaya vinaya naya vimuktaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative stabilization named “mind-only.”🔽There is the meditative stabilization named “liberation through the method of guiding those to be trained.”

original: asty anusaraṇasarvasamavasaraṇo nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti anusaraṇasarvasamavasaraṇaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative stabilization named “going to all destinations.”

original: asty anilaniyato nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti anilaniyataḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative stabilization named “unmoving.”

original: asti tathatāsthitaniścito nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti tathatāsthitaniścitaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative stabilization named “fixed on suchness.”

original: asti kāyakalisaṃpramathano nāma / 🔽samādhiḥ / asti vākkalividhvaṃsano nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti kāyakalisaṃpramathanaḥ nāma  samādhiḥ asti vākkalividhvaṃsanaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative stabilization named “destroying the defilements of the body.”🔽There is the meditative stabilization named “destroying the defilements of speech.”

original: asti gaganakalpo nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti gagana kalpaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative stabilization named “like space.”

original: asty ākāśāsaṅgavimuktinirupalepo nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: asti ākāśāsaṅgavimuktinirupalepaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: There is the meditative stabilization named “unattached liberation without a basis.”

original: ime āyuṣman śāriputra samādhayo yaiḥ samādhibhir viharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate /
analyzed: ime āyuṣman śāriputra samādhayaḥ yaiḥ samādhibhiḥ viharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: These are the meditative stabilizations, Venerable Śāriputra, by means of these meditative stabilizations the bodhisattva mahāsattva moves around, quickly awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: anyāni cāsaṃkhyeyāprameyāṇi samādhimukhāni yeṣu śikṣyamāṇā bodhisattva mahāsattvāḥ kṣipram anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyante /
analyzed: anyāni ca asaṃkhyeya aprameyāṇi samādhi mukhāni yeṣu śikṣyamāṇāḥ bodhisattva mahāsattvāḥ kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyante
translated: and there are other innumerable, countless gateways to the meditative stabilizations in which the bodhisattva mahāsattvas train and quickly awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: tatra katamaḥ śūraṅgamo nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: tatra katamaḥ śūraṅgamaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: Therein, what is the meditative stabilization named “heroic march”?

original: yena samādhinā sarvasamādhīnāṃ gocaram anubhavaty ayam ucyate śūraṅgamo nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: yena samādhinā sarva samādhīnām gocaram anubhavati ayam ucyate śūraṅgamaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: That samādhi through which one experiences the domain of all samādhis is called the heroic stride samādhi.

original: tatra katamo ratnamudro nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: tatra katamaḥ ratnamudraḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: Among them, what is the jewel seal samādhi?

original: yena samādhinā sarvasamādhayo mudritā bhavaty ayam ucyate ratnamudro nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: yena samādhinā sarva samādhayaḥ mudritāḥ bhavati ayam ucyate ratnamudraḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: That samādhi through which all samādhis are sealed is called the jewel seal samādhi.

original: evaṃ yāvat tatra katama ākāśasaṅgavimuktinirupalepo nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: evam yāvat tatra katamaḥ ākāśa saṅga vimukti nirupalepaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: And so on, up to: Among them, what is the space-like samādhi?

original: yatra samādhau sthitvā sarvadharmāṇām ākāśāsaṅgavimuktinirupalepatām anuprāpnoty ayam ucyate ākāśāsaṅgavimuktinirupalepo nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: yatra samādhau sthitvā sarva dharmāṇām ākāśa āsaṅga vimukti nirupalepa tām anuprāpnoti ayam ucyate ākāśa āsaṅga vimukti nirupalepaḥ nāma samādhiḥ
translated: That samādhi through which one attains the space-like non-attachment, liberation, and non-adhesion of all dharmas is called the space-like non-attachment, liberation, and non-adhesion samādhi.

original: iti mṛdvagradharmasyālambanākāraviśeṣah /
analyzed: iti mṛdu agra dharmasya ālambana ākāra viśeṣa
translated: Thus, the special objects and aspects of the weak stage of the supreme dharma.

original: atha khalv āyuṣman subhūtir buddhānubhāvena āyuṣmantaṃ sariputram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣman subhūtiḥ buddha anubhāvena āyuṣmantam sari putram etat avocat
translated: Then, indeed, the Venerable Subhūti, through the Buddha's power, said this to the Venerable Śāriputra:

original: vyakṛto 'yam ayuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ pūrvakais tathāgatair arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ /
analyzed: vyakṛtaḥ yam ayuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ pūrvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, this bodhisattva mahāsattva has been predicted by the past Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones,

original: ye 'py etarhi daśadiśi loke tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: ye pi etarhi daśa diśi loke tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: and by those who are now present, living, and remaining in the world in the ten directions.

original: te 'pi tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhās taṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ vyākurvanti / ya etaiḥ samādhibhir viharati sa samādhim api na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: te pi tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ tam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam vyākurvanti yaḥ etaiḥ samādhibhiḥ viharati sa samādhim api na samanupaśyati
translated: He does not even perceive that samādhi.

original: sa na ca tena samādhinā manyate /
analyzed: sa na ca tena samādhinā manyate
translated: He does not think with that samādhi:

original: ahaṃ samāhita iti /
analyzed: aham samāhitaḥ iti
translated: 'I am concentrated,'

original: ahaṃ samādhiṃ samāpatsye /🔽ahaṃ samādhiṃ samāpannaḥ /
analyzed: aham samādhim samāpatsye  aham samādhim samāpannaḥ
translated: 'I shall enter into the samādhi,'🔽'I have entered into the samādhi,'

original: ahaṃ samādhiṃ samāpadye /
analyzed: aham samādhim samāpadye
translated: 'I am emerging from the samādhi.'

original: sarva ete vikalpā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na vidyante nopalabhyante /
analyzed: sarve ete vikalpāḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na vidyante na upalabhyante
translated: All these discriminations do not exist for the Bodhisattva, the Mahāsattva.

original: iti madhyāgradharmasyālaṃbanākāraviśeṣaḥ
analyzed: iti madhya agra dharmasya ālaṃbana ākāra viśeṣaḥ
translated: This is the special object and aspect of the middle and highest dharmas.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kiṃ punar āyuṣman subhūte eṣu samādhiṣu sthito bodhisattvo mahāsattvo vyākriyate tathāgatair arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ /
analyzed: kim punar āyuṣman subhūte eṣu samādhiṣu sthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vyākriyate tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ
translated: But, Venerable Subhūti, is the Bodhisattva, the Mahāsattva, who dwells in these samādhis, predicted to the highest, complete enlightenment by the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: no hīdam āyuṣman śāriputra / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: no hi idam āyuṣman śāriputra tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: No, Venerable Śāriputra. And why is that?

original: tathā hy āyuṣman śāriputra nānyā prajñāpāramitā anyaḥ samādhiḥ anyo bodhisattvo bodhisattva eva samādhiḥ samādhir eva bodhisattvaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi āyuṣman śāriputra na anyā prajñāpāramitā anyaḥ samādhiḥ anyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bodhisattvaḥ eva samādhiḥ samādhiḥ eva bodhisattvaḥ
translated: For, Venerable Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom is not one thing, the concentration is another, and the bodhisattva is another. The concentration itself is the bodhisattva, and the bodhisattva is the concentration.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: yady āyuṣman subhūte nānyaḥ samādhiḥ /
analyzed: yadi āyuṣman subhūte na anyaḥ samādhiḥ
translated: If, Venerable Subhūti, the concentration is not one thing,

original: nānyo bodhisattvaḥ /
analyzed: na anyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ
translated: and the bodhisattva is not another,

original: samādhir eva bodhisattvo bodhisattva eva samādhiḥ sarvadharmasamatām upādāya / tat kiṃ śakyaḥ sa samādhir darśayitum /
analyzed: samādhiḥ eva bodhisattvaḥ bodhisattvaḥ eva samādhiḥ sarva dharma samatām upādāya tat kim śakyaḥ sa samādhiḥ darśayitum
translated: and the concentration itself is the bodhisattva, and the bodhisattva is the concentration, on the basis of the equality of all dharmas, then is that concentration able to be shown?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: na hy etad āyuṣman śāriputra /
analyzed: na hi etat āyuṣman śāriputra
translated: No, Venerable Śāriputra.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kiṃ punar āyuṣman subhūte sa kulaputras taṃ samādhiṃ saṃjānīte /
analyzed: kim punar āyuṣman subhūte sa kula putraḥ tam samādhim saṃjānīte
translated: Then, Venerable Subhūti, does that son of a good family know that concentration?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: nāyuṣman śāriputra sa kulaputras taṃ samādhiṃ saṃjānīte /
analyzed: na āyuṣman śāriputra sa kula putraḥ tam samādhim saṃjānīte
translated: No, Venerable Śāriputra, that son of a good family does not know that concentration.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kathaṃ na saṃjānīte /
analyzed: katham na saṃjānīte
translated: How does he not know?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: yathā na vikalpayati /
analyzed: yathā na vikalpayati
translated: As he does not conceptualize.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kathaṃ na vikalpayati /
analyzed: katham na vikalpayati
translated: How does he not conceptualize?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: avidyamānatvena sarvadharmāṇām evaṃ taṃ samādhiṃ na vikalpayati /
analyzed: a vidyamāna tvena sarva dharmāṇām evam tam samādhim na vikalpayati
translated: Because all dharmas do not exist, he does not conceptualize that samādhi in that way.

original: anenāyuṣman śāriputra paryāyeṇa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na saṃjānīte /
analyzed: anena āyuṣman śāriputra paryāyeṇa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na saṃjānīte
translated: By this method, Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not cognize.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: kathaṃ na saṃjānīte /
analyzed: katham na saṃjānīte
translated: How does he not cognize?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said,

original: avikalpatvena tasya samādher bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na saṃjānīte /
analyzed: a vikalpa tvena tasya samādheḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na saṃjānīte
translated: Because that samādhi is non-conceptual, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not cognize.

original: ity adhimātrāgradharmasyālambanākāraviśeṣaḥ
analyzed: iti adhimātra agra dharmasya ālambana ākāra viśeṣaḥ
translated: This is the special object and aspect of the supreme dharma of great capacity.

original: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmate subhūtaye sādhukāram adāt /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmate subhūtaye sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then the Blessed One gave his approval to the Venerable Subhūti, saying,

original: sādhu sādhu subhūte yathāpi nāma te mayā araṇāvihāriṇām agratāyāṃ nirdiṣṭasya nirdeśaḥ /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu subhūte yathā api nāma te mayā araṇā vihāriṇām agra tāyām nirdiṣṭasya nirdeśaḥ
translated: Excellent, excellent, Subhūti! Just as you have been taught by me as the foremost of those who dwell in the absence of conflict, so is your teaching.

original: evaṃ subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śiksitavyam / evaṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: evam subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām śiksitavyam evam dhyāna pāramitāyām vīrya pāramitāyām kṣānti pāramitāyām śīla pāramitāyām
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should train in the perfection of wisdom, and in the same way in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality,

original: dānapāramiatāyāṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: dāna pāramiatāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: and in the perfection of generosity.

original: evaṃ saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣeṣu dharmeṣu yāvad aṣṭādaśāveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: evam saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣeṣu dharmeṣu yāvat aṣṭādaśa āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, one should train in the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One:

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇo bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣate
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains thus trains in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣate
translated: Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains thus trains in the perfection of wisdom.

original: anupalambhayogena / evaṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena evam dhyāna pāramitāyām vīrya pāramitāyām kṣānti pāramitāyām śīla pāramitāyām dāna pāramitāyām
translated: By way of non-apprehension. Thus, he trains in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity.

original: śikṣate / anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: śikṣate anupalambha yogena
translated: He trains by way of non-apprehension.

original: yāvad vistareṇa saptatriṃśadbodhisapakṣeṣu dharmeṣu śikṣate /
analyzed: yāvat vistareṇa saptatriṃśat bodhisapakṣeṣu dharmeṣu śikṣate
translated: In detail, up to he trains in the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment that are on the side of awakening.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: yāvad apramāṇadhyanārūpyasamāpattiṣu sikṣate /
analyzed: yāvat a pramāṇa dhī an ārūpya samāpattiṣu sikṣate
translated: Up to he trains in the four immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless attainments.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: daśabalacaturvaiśāradyāṣṭādaśāveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu śikṣate /
analyzed: daśa bala catur vaiśāradya aṣṭādaśa āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu śikṣate
translated: He trains in the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One:

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇo bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣate
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains thus in the perfection of wisdom trains in the perfection of wisdom.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣate /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣate
translated: Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains thus in the perfection of wisdom trains in the perfection of wisdom.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kim iti bhagavan nopalabhate /
analyzed: kim iti bhagavat na upalabhate
translated: Blessed One, what is it that is not apprehended?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: ātmānaṃ śāriputra nopalabhate /
analyzed: ātmānam śāriputra na upalabhate
translated: Śāriputra, one does not apprehend a self.

original: yāvat sattvajīvapoṣapuruṣapudgalamanujamānavakārakavedakajānakapaśyakān nopalabhate /
analyzed: yāvat sattva jīva poṣa puruṣa pudgala manuja mānava kāraka vedaka jānaka paśyakān na upalabhate
translated: Up to one does not apprehend a being, a living being, a nourishing being, a man, a person, a human, one who acts, one who feels, one who knows, or one who sees.

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Because of absolute purity.

original: yāvad vyastasamastān skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādān nopalabhate /
analyzed: yāvat vyasta samastān skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādān na upalabhate
translated: Up to one does not apprehend the aggregates, elements, sense fields, or dependent origination, either separately or collectively.

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Because of absolute purity.

original: duḥkhaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: duḥkham na upalabhate
translated: One does not apprehend suffering.

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Because of absolute purity.

original: samudayaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: samudayam na upalabhate
translated: One does not apprehend the origination [of suffering].

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Because of absolute purity.

original: nirodhaṃ nopalabhate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: nirodham na upalabhate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He does not apprehend cessation, because of utter purity.

original: mārgaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: mārgam na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend the path,

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: because of utter purity.

original: kāmadhātuṃ nopalabhate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: kāmadhātum na upalabhate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He does not apprehend the desire realm, because of utter purity.

original: rūpadhātuṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: rūpadhātum na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend the form realm,

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: because of utter purity.

original: ārūpyadhātuṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: ārūpya dhātum na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend the formless realm,

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: because of utter purity.

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīr nopalabhate /
analyzed: apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīḥ na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend the immeasurables, dhyānas, and formless concentrations,

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: because of utter purity.

original: smṛtyupasthānasamyakprahānarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgān nopalabhyante /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna samyakprahāna ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgāt na upalabhyante
translated: The applications of mindfulness, right efforts, legs of supernatural power, faculties, powers, factors of awakening, and path are not apprehended,

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: because of utter purity.

original: pāramitā nopalabhate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: pāramitā na upalabhate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: The perfections are not apprehended, because of utter purity.

original: daśabalacaturvaiśāradyāṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān nopalabhate /
analyzed: daśa bala catur vaiśāradya aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān na upalabhate
translated: The ten powers, four fearlessnesses, and eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are not apprehended,

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: because of utter purity.

original: srotaāpannaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: srotaāpannam na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend a stream-enterer,

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: because of utter purity.

original: sakṛdāgāminaṃ nopalabhate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāminam na upalabhate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: He does not apprehend a once-returner, because of utter purity.

original: anāgāminaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: anāgāminam na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend a non-returner.

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Because of complete purity.

original: arhantaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: arhantam na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend an arhat.

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Because of complete purity.

original: pratyekabuddhaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: pratyekabuddham na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend a pratyekabuddha.

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Because of complete purity.

original: bodhisattvaṃ nopalabhate /🔽atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya / buddhaṃ /
analyzed: bodhisattvam na upalabhate  atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya buddham
translated: He does not apprehend a bodhisattva.

original: nopalabhate /
analyzed: na upalabhate
translated: Because of complete purity. He does not apprehend a buddha.

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Because of complete purity.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kā punar bhagavan viśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: kā punar bhagavan viśuddhiḥ
translated: But what, Blessed One, is purity?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: anutpādaḥ śāriputra aprādurbhāvo 'nupalambho 'nabhisaṃskāro viśuddhir ity ucyate /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ śāriputra aprādurbhāvaḥ n upalambhaḥ n abhisaṃskāraḥ viśuddhiḥ iti ucyate
translated: Non-arising, Śāriputra, non-appearance, non-apprehension, non-production, that is said to be purity.

original: iti sāmānyena vikalpasaṃprayogādhikārah /
analyzed: iti sāmānyena vikalpa saṃprayoga adhikāraḥ
translated: Thus ends the section on the association with conceptualization in general.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇo bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ katameṣu dharmeṣu śikṣate /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ katameṣu dharmeṣu śikṣate
translated: Blessed One, when a bodhisattva-mahāsattva trains in this way, in which dharmas does he train?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evaṃ śikṣāmāṇaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na kasmiṃścid dharme śikṣate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: evam śikṣāmāṇaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na kasmiṃścid dharme śikṣate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Śāriputra, when a bodhisattva-mahāsattva trains in this way, he does not train in any dharma at all. Why is that?

original: naite śāriputra dharmās tathā saṃvidyante yathā bālapṛthagjanānām abhiniveśaḥ /
analyzed: na ete śāriputra dharmāḥ tathā saṃvidyante yathā bāla pṛthagjanānām abhiniveśaḥ
translated: These dharmas, Śāriputra, do not exist as they are conceived by foolish ordinary beings.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kathaṃ bhagavann ete dharmāḥ saṃvidyante /
analyzed: katham bhagavan ete dharmāḥ saṃvidyante
translated: How do these dharmas exist, Blessed One?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yathā na saṃvidyante tathā saṃvidyante /
analyzed: yathā na saṃvidyante tathā saṃvidyante
translated: They exist as they do not exist.

original: evam asaṃvidyamānās tenocyante 'vidyeti /
analyzed: evam a saṃvidyamānāḥ tena ucyante vidyā iti
translated: Thus, being non-existent, they are called 'ignorance'.

original: ity uṣmagatavikalpasaṃprayoge prathamo 'vidyāvikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti uṣma gata vikalpa saṃprayoge prathamaḥ vidyā vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, the first conceptualization of ignorance in the combination with the conceptualization of heat.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kena kāraṇenocyate asaṃvidyamānā avidyeti /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena ucyate asaṃvidyamānā avidyā iti
translated: For what reason is it said that non-existent ignorance exists?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rūpaṃ śāriputra na saṃvidyate /🔽adhyātyaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: rūpam śāriputra na saṃvidyate  adhyātya śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Śāriputra, form does not exist,🔽on account of the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: bahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: on account of the emptiness of external phenomena,🔽on account of the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena,

original: yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām upādāya
translated: up to on account of the emptiness of own-marks.

original: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā vijñānaṃ śāriputra na saṃvidyate /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ vijñānam śāriputra na saṃvidyate
translated: Śāriputra, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness do not exist,

original: adhyātmaśūnyatām upādāya /🔽bahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatām upādāya  bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: on account of the emptiness of internal phenomena,🔽on account of the emptiness of external phenomena,🔽on account of the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena,

original: yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām upādāya
translated: up to on account of the emptiness of own-marks.

original: yāvat saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣā dharmā na saṃvidyante yāvad aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmā na saṃvidyante /
analyzed: yāvat saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣāḥ dharmāḥ na saṃvidyante yāvat aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ na saṃvidyante
translated: up to the thirty-seven factors of awakening do not exist, up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha do not exist.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatām upādāya /🔽bahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatām upādāya  bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: On the basis of the emptiness of internal phenomena.🔽On the basis of the emptiness of external phenomena.🔽On the basis of the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena.

original: yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Up to on the basis of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: iti tatraiva dvitīyo rūpādiskandhavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva dvitīyaḥ rūpa ādi skandha vikalpaḥ
translated: This is the second conceptualization of the aggregates beginning with form, right there in the same text.

original: tatra bālā avidyāyāṃ tṛṣṇāyāṃ cābhiniviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: tatra bālāḥ avidyāyām tṛṣṇāyām ca abhiniviṣṭāḥ
translated: There, the foolish ones are attached to ignorance and craving.

original: tair avidyāṃ tṛṣṇāṃ ca kalpitāṃ kalpayitvā avidyātṛṣṇābhyām abhiniviśya ubhābhyām antābhyāṃ saktās te ubhāv antau na jānanti na paśyanti /
analyzed: taiḥ avidyām tṛṣṇām ca kalpitām kalpayitvā avidyā tṛṣṇābhyām abhiniviśya ubhābhyām antābhyām saktāḥ te ubhau antau na jānanti na paśyanti
translated: Having imagined ignorance and craving as conceptualized, having become attached to ignorance and craving, attached to both extremes, they do not know and do not see both extremes.

original: yathā dharmā na saṃvidyante /
analyzed: yathā dharmāḥ na saṃvidyante
translated: As phenomena do not exist.

original: te tān dharmān kalpayitvā nāmarūpe abhiniviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: te tān dharmān kalpayitvā nāma rūpe abhiniviṣṭāḥ
translated: Having imagined those phenomena, they are attached to name and form.

original: yāvad buddhadharmeṣv /
analyzed: yāvat buddha dharmeṣu
translated: Up to the Buddha-dharmas.

original: abhiniviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: abhiniviṣṭāḥ
translated: They are attached.

original: iti tatraiva tṛtīyo nāmarūpābhiniveśavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva tṛtīyaḥ nāma rūpa abhiniveśa vikalpaḥ
translated: This is the third conceptualization of attachment to name and form, right there in the same text.

original: te dharmeṣv abhiniviṣṭā asaṃvidyamānāv ubhāv antau kalpayanti kalpayitvā na jānanti na paśyanti /
analyzed: te dharmeṣu abhiniviṣṭāḥ a saṃvidyamānau ubhau antau kalpayanti kalpayitvā na jānanti na paśyanti
translated: They are attached to phenomena, and imagine the two extremes that do not exist. Having imagined, they do not know and do not see.

original: kiṃ na jānanti na paśyanti /
analyzed: kim na jānanti na paśyanti
translated: What do they not know and not see?

original: rūpaṃ na jānanti na paśyanti /
analyzed: rūpam na jānanti na paśyanti
translated: They do not know and do not see form.

original: vedanāṃ saṃjñāṃ saṃskārān vijñānaṃ na jānanti na paśyanti /
analyzed: vedanām saṃjñām saṃskārān vijñānam na jānanti na paśyanti
translated: They do not know and do not see feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness.

original: yāvat skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādaṃ na jānanti na paśyanti /
analyzed: yāvat skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādam na jānanti na paśyanti
translated: Up to they do not know and do not see the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and dependent origination.

original: yāvad aṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān na jānanti na paśyanti /
analyzed: yāvat aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān na jānanti na paśyanti
translated: Up to they do not know and do not see the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: tena te bālā iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: tena te bālāḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchanti
translated: Therefore they are counted as fools.

original: iti tatraiva caturtho 'ntadvayasaktivikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva caturthaḥ nta dvaya sakti vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in that very text, is the fourth conceptualization of attachment to the two extremes.

original: te avidyātṛṣṇāpratyayaṃ na jānanti na paśyanti / kiṃ na jānanti na paśyanti /
analyzed: te avidyā tṛṣṇā pratyayam na jānanti na paśyanti kim na jānanti na paśyanti
translated: They do not know and do not see the condition of ignorance and craving. What do they not know and not see?

original: rūpaṃ saṃkliṣṭam iti na jānanti na paśyanti /
analyzed: rūpam saṃkliṣṭam iti na jānanti na paśyanti
translated: They do not know and do not see that form is defiled.

original: evaṃ rūpaṃ vyavadānam iti na jānanti na paśyanti /
analyzed: evam rūpam vyavadānam iti na jānanti na paśyanti
translated: Thus they do not know and do not see that form is purified.

original: vedanāṃ saṃjñāṃ saṃskārān vijñānaṃ saṃkliṣṭam iti na jānanti na paśyanti /
analyzed: vedanām saṃjñām saṃskārān vijñānam saṃkliṣṭam iti na jānanti na paśyanti
translated: They do not know and do not see that feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are defiled.

original: evaṃ vijñānaṃ vyavadānam iti na jānanti na paśyanti /
analyzed: evam vijñānam vyavadānam iti na jānanti na paśyanti
translated: Thus they do not know and do not see that consciousness is purified.

original: te na niryāsyanti / kuto na niryāsyanti /
analyzed: te na niryāsyanti kutas na niryāsyanti
translated: They will not go forth. From what will they not go forth?

original: kāmadhātor na niryāsyanti /🔽rūpadhātor na niryāsyanti /
analyzed: kāmadhātoḥ na niryāsyanti  rūpadhātoḥ na niryāsyanti
translated: They will not go forth from the desire realm.🔽They will not go forth from the form realm.

original: ārūpyadhātor na niryāsyanti /
analyzed: ārūpya dhātoḥ na niryāsyanti
translated: They will not go forth from the formless realm.

original: śrāvakapratyekabuddhadharmebhyo na niryāsyanti /
analyzed: śrāvaka pratyekabuddha dharmebhyaḥ na niryāsyanti
translated: They will not go forth from the dharmas of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: iti tatraiva pañcamaḥ saṃkleśavyavadānājñānavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva pañcamaḥ saṃkleśa vyavadāna ajñāna vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in that very text, is the fifth alternative of conceptual differentiation regarding the ignorance of defilement and purification.

original: te na śraddadhati / kim iti na śraddadhati /
analyzed: te na śraddadhati kim iti na śraddadhati
translated: They do not have faith. In what do they not have faith?

original: rūpaṃ rūpeṇa śūnyam iti na śraddadhati /
analyzed: rūpam rūpeṇa śūnyam iti na śraddadhati
translated: They do not have faith that form is empty of form.

original: yāvad bodhir bodhyātmanā śūnyeti na śraddadhati /
analyzed: yāvat bodhiḥ bodhi ātmanā śūnyā iti na śraddadhati
translated: Up to they do not have faith that awakening is empty of the nature of awakening.

original: te na pratiṣṭhante / kim iti na pratiṣṭhante /
analyzed: te na pratiṣṭhante kim iti na pratiṣṭhante
translated: They do not stand. In what do they not stand?

original: dānapāramitāyāṃ na pratiṣṭhante /
analyzed: dāna pāramitāyām na pratiṣṭhante
translated: They do not stand in the perfection of giving.

original: śīlapāramitāyāṃ na pratiṣṭhante /🔽kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ na pratiṣṭhante /
analyzed: śīla pāramitāyām na pratiṣṭhante  kṣānti pāramitāyām na pratiṣṭhante
translated: They do not stand in the perfection of morality.🔽They do not stand in the perfection of patience.

original: vīryapāramitāyāṃ na pratiṣṭhante /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitāyām na pratiṣṭhante
translated: They do not stand in the perfection of effort.

original: dhyānapāramitāyāṃ na pratiṣṭhante /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitāyām na pratiṣṭhante
translated: They do not stand in the perfection of concentration.

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ na pratiṣṭhante /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām na pratiṣṭhante
translated: They do not stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: avinivartanīyabhūmau na pratiṣṭhante /
analyzed: a vinivartanīya bhūmau na pratiṣṭhante
translated: They do not stand in the irreversible stage.

original: yāvad buddhadharmeṣu na pratiṣṭhante /
analyzed: yāvat buddha dharmeṣu na pratiṣṭhante
translated: As long as they do not stand in the Buddha-dharmas.

original: anena kāraṇena bālā ity ucyante /
analyzed: anena kāraṇena bālāḥ iti ucyante
translated: For this reason they are called fools.

original: te abhiniviṣṭāḥ / kim iti abhiniviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: te abhiniviṣṭāḥ kim iti abhiniviṣṭāḥ
translated: They are attached. To what are they attached?

original: rūpavedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskāravijñāneṣv abhiniviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: rūpa vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra vijñāneṣu abhiniviṣṭāḥ
translated: They are attached to form, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: cakṣuṣi śrotre ghrāṇe jihvāyāṃ kāye manasy abhiniviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuṣi śrotre ghrāṇe jihvāyām kāye manasi abhiniviṣṭāḥ
translated: They are attached to the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: skandhadhātvāyataneṣv abhiniviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: skandha dhātu āyataneṣu abhiniviṣṭāḥ
translated: They are attached to the aggregates, elements, and sense fields.

original: rāgadveṣamoheṣv abhiniviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: rāga dveṣa moheṣu abhiniviṣṭāḥ
translated: They are attached to desire, anger, and delusion.

original: dṛṣṭikṛteṣv abhiniviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭi kṛteṣu abhiniviṣṭāḥ
translated: They are attached to the false views.

original: yāvad bodhāv abhiniviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: yāvat bodhau abhiniviṣṭāḥ
translated: Up to they are attached to enlightenment.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇo bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣate sarvākārajñatāyāṃ niryāsyati /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣate sarva ākārajña tāyām niryāsyati
translated: Bhagavān, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains like this trains in the perfection of wisdom and will go forth to complete knowing.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains like this

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ na śikṣate /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām na śikṣate
translated: does not train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sarvākārajñatāyāṃ na niryāsyati /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tāyām na niryāsyati
translated: He will not go forth to complete knowing.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kiṃ kāraṇaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ na śikṣate na niryāsyati sarvākārajñatāyām /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām na śikṣate na niryāsyati sarva ākārajña tāyām
translated: What is the reason, Blessed One, that a bodhisattva great being does not train in the perfection of wisdom and does not go forth to all-knowledge?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: iha śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitām anupāyakuśalaḥ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: iha śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitām an upāya kuśalaḥ kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: Here, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva great being, unskilled in means, imagines and becomes attached to the perfection of wisdom.

original: dhyānapāramitāṃ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /🔽vīryapāramitāṃ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitām kalpayati abhiniviśate  vīrya pāramitām kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: He imagines and becomes attached to the perfection of concentration.🔽He imagines and becomes attached to the perfection of perseverance.

original: kṣāntipāramitāṃ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitām kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: He imagines and becomes attached to the perfection of patience.

original: śīlapāramitāṃ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: śīla pāramitām kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: He imagines and becomes attached to the perfection of morality.

original: dānapāramitāṃ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: dāna pāramitām kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: He imagines and becomes attached to the perfection of giving.

original: evam apramāṇadhyanārūpyasamāpattīḥ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: evam apramāṇa dhī anārūpya samāpattīḥ kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: In the same way, he imagines and becomes attached to the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless attainments.

original: smṛtyupasthānaṃ samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgān kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: smṛti upasthānam samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgān kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: He imagines and becomes attached to the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the aspects of awakening, and the path.

original: daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidaṣṭādaśāveṇikānbuddhadharmān kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: He imagines and becomes attached to the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: yāvat sarvadharmān sarvākārajñatāṃ kalpayaty abhiniviśate / anena śāriputra paryāyeṇa bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ na śikṣate sarvākārajñatāyāṃ
analyzed: yāvat sarva dharmān sarva ākāra jña tām kalpayati abhiniviśate anena śāriputra paryāyeṇa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām na śikṣate sarva ākāra jña tāyām
translated: up to when one imagines and becomes attached to all dharmas and omniscience, in this way, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva does not train in the perfection of wisdom and

original: na niryāsyati /
analyzed: na niryāsyati
translated: does not go forth to omniscience.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇo bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ na śikṣate sarvākārajñatāyāṃ na niryāsyati /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām na śikṣate sarva ākārajña tāyām na niryāsyati
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in this way does not train in the perfection of wisdom and does not go forth to omniscience.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ na śikṣate na niryāsyati sarvākārajñatāyām /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām na śikṣate na niryāsyati sarva ākārajña tāyām
translated: Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains in this way does not train in the perfection of wisdom and does not go forth to omniscience.

original: iti tatraiva ṣaṣṭha āryamārgapratiṣṭhānavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva ṣaṣṭhaḥ ārya mārga pratiṣṭhāna vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in that very text, the sixth chapter on the non-discrimination of establishing the noble path.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kathaṃ punar bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣate yathā śikṣamāṇaḥ sarvākārajñatāyāṃ niryāsyati /
analyzed: katham punar bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣate yathā śikṣamāṇaḥ sarva ākārajña tāyām niryāsyati
translated: Blessed One, how does a bodhisattva mahāsattva train in the perfection of wisdom so that by training in this way, they will go forth to omniscience?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yadā śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran prajñāpāramitāṃ nopalabhate na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: yadā śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran prajñāpāramitām na upalabhate na samanupaśyati
translated: When, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom does not apprehend the perfection of wisdom, does not see it,

original: evaṃ khalu śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ sarvākārajñatāyāṃ niryāsyaty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: evam khalu śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇaḥ sarva ākārajña tāyām niryāsyati an upalambha yogena
translated: in this way, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom, training in the perfection of wisdom, will go forth to complete knowing by way of non-apprehension.

original: evaṃ dhyānapāramitāṃ vīryapāramitāṃ kṣāntipāramitāṃ śīlapāramitāṃ dānapāramitāṃ nopalabhate na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: evam dhyāna pāramitām vīrya pāramitām kṣānti pāramitām śīla pāramitām dāna pāramitām na upalabhate na samanupaśyati
translated: In the same way, he does not apprehend the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, the perfection of giving, does not see it.

original: yāvad bodhiṃ sarvākārajñatāṃ nopalabhate na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: yāvat bodhim sarva ākāra jña tām na upalabhate na samanupaśyati
translated: Up to: he does not apprehend enlightenment, complete knowing, does not see it.

original: evaṃ khalu śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇaḥ sarvākārajñatāyāṃ niryāsyaty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: evam khalu śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇaḥ sarva ākārajña tāyām niryāsyati an upalambha yogena
translated: In this way, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom, training in the perfection of wisdom, will go forth to complete knowing by way of non-apprehension.

original: iti tatraiva saptama upalambhavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva saptamaḥ upalambha vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in that very [chapter], the seventh conception of apprehension.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: kasya anupalambha yogena
translated: By the non-apprehension of what?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: ātmānaṃ śāriputra nopalabhate na samanupaśyati /🔽atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: ātmānam śāriputra na upalabhate na samanupaśyati  atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Śāriputra does not apprehend or see a self,🔽because of utter purity.

original: evaṃ yāvat sarvākārajñatāṃ nopalabhate na samanupaśyaty atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: evam yāvat sarva ākāra jña tām na upalabhate na samanupaśyati atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Śāriputra, he does not apprehend the self, does not perceive the self, up to he does not apprehend or perceive all aspects of omniscience, due to their absolute purity.

original: iti tatraivāṣṭama ātmādivikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva aṣṭamaḥ ātma ādi vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in that very [text], the eighth conception of self, etc.

original: anutpādaḥ śāriputrāprādurbhāvo 'nabhisaṃskāro viśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ śāriputra aprādurbhāvaḥ na abhisaṃskāraḥ viśuddhiḥ
translated: Śāriputra, non-arising, non-appearance, non-production, and purity.

original: iti tatraiva navamo viśuddhyutpādādivikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva navamaḥ viśuddhi utpāda ādi vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in that very [text], the ninth conception of purity, arising, etc.

original: iti prathamo grāhyavikalpaḥ🔽so 'nupāyakuśalo rūpaṃ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: iti prathamaḥ grāhya vikalpaḥ  saḥ nu pāya kuśalaḥ rūpam kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: Thus, the first conception of the apprehended object.

original: yāvad vijñānaṃ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: yāvat vijñānam kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: He, unskilled in means, conceives form and becomes attached to it, up to he conceives consciousness and becomes attached to it.

original: iti mūrdhagatavikalpasaṃprayoge prathamo rāśyarthavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti mūrdha gata vikalpa saṃprayoge prathamaḥ rāśi artha vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in the union with the conception that has reached the peak, the first conception of the meaning of a heap.

original: cakṣuḥ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: He conceives the eye and becomes attached to it, up to he conceives the mind.

original: evaṃ yāvan manaḥ /
analyzed: evam yāvat manaḥ
translated: Thus, up to the mind.

original: rūpaṃ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: rūpam kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: He conceives form and becomes attached to it, up to he conceives mental objects.

original: evaṃ yāvad dharmān /
analyzed: evam yāvat dharmān
translated: Thus, up to mental objects.

original: iti tatraiva dvitīya āyadvārārthavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva dvitīyaḥ āya dvāra artha vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in that very [text], the second conception of the meaning of the door of entry.

original: cakṣūrūpacakṣurvijñānadhātūn kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ rūpa cakṣuḥ vijñāna dhātūn kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: He conceives the eye, form, and eye-consciousness elements and becomes attached to them, up to he conceives the mind, mental objects, and mind-consciousness elements and becomes attached to them.🔽Here is the corrected and aligned text:

original: evaṃ yāvan manodharmamanovijñānadhātūn /
analyzed: evam yāvat manaḥ dharma manaḥ vijñāna dhātūn
translated: In the same way up to the mind, dharmas, and mind-consciousness elements.

original: iti tatraiva tṛtīyo gotrārthavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva tṛtīyaḥ gotra artha vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in the same text, the third alternative is the meaning of lineage.

original: avidyāṃ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: avidyām kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: One conceptualizes and becomes attached to ignorance.

original: evaṃ yāvaj jarāmaraṇam /
analyzed: evam yāvat jarā maraṇam
translated: In the same way up to old age and death.

original: iti tatraiva caturtha utpādārthavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva caturthaḥ utpāda artha vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in the same text, the fourth alternative is the meaning of arising.

original: so 'dhyātmaśūnyatāṃ bahirdhāśūnyatāṃ adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāṃ yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: saḥ dhyātma śūnyatām bahirdhā śūnyatām adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: One conceptualizes and becomes attached to the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: iti tatraiva pañcamaḥ śūnyatārthavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva pañcamaḥ śūnyatā artha vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in the same text, the fifth alternative is the meaning of emptiness.

original: ṣaṭpāramitāḥ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: One conceptualizes and becomes attached to the six perfections.

original: iti tatraiva ṣaṣṭaḥ pāramitārthavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva ṣaṣṭaḥ pāramitā artha vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in the same text, the sixth alternative is the meaning of the perfections.

original: saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyān dharmān kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyān dharmān kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: One conceptualizes and becomes attached to the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: iti tatraiva saptamo darśanamārgavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva saptamaḥ darśana mārga vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in the same text, the seventh alternative is the meaning of the path of seeing.

original: sa dhyānābhijñāpramāṇārūpyasamāpattīḥ kalpayaty abhiniviśate /
analyzed: sa dhyāna abhijñā pramāṇa ārūpya samāpattīḥ kalpayati abhiniviśate
translated: One conceptualizes and becomes attached to the concentrations, superknowledges, immeasurables, and formless attainments.

original: iti tatraivāṣṭamo bhāvanāmārgavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva aṣṭamaḥ bhāvanā mārga vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in the same text, the eighth alternative is the meaning of the path of cultivation.

original: sa daśatathāgatabalāni yāvat sarvākārajñatāṃ kalpayaty / 🔽abhiniviśate /
analyzed: sa daśa tathāgata balāni yāvat sarva ākārajña tām kalpayati 🔽abhiniviśate
translated: One conceptualizes and becomes attached to the ten powers of the Tathagata up to omniscience.

original: iti tatraiva navamaḥ śaikṣamārgavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva navamaḥ śaikṣa mārga vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus ends the ninth chapter on the alternatives of the path of training in the same text.

original: iti dvitīyo grāhyavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti dvitīyaḥ grāhya vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus ends the second chapter on the alternatives of the object of cognition.

original: ātmānaṃ śāriputra nopalabhate /
analyzed: ātmānam śāriputra na upalabhate
translated: Śāriputra, one does not apprehend a self.

original: evaṃ sattvaṃ jīvaṃ poṣaṃ puruṣaṃ pudgalaṃ manujaṃ mānavaṃ kārakaṃ vedakaṃ jānakaṃ paśyakaṃ nopalabhate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: evam sattvam jīvam poṣam puruṣam pudgalam manujam mānavam kārakam vedakam jānakam paśyakam na upalabhate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Thus, one does not apprehend a being, a living being, a nourishing being, a man, an individual, a human, a human being, one who acts, one who feels, one who knows, or one who sees. Why is that?

original: atyantatayā hy ātmā na vidyate nopalabhate /
analyzed: atyanta tayā hi ātmā na vidyate na upalabhate
translated: Because a self is absolutely non-existent and not apprehended.

original: iti kṣāntigatavikalpasaṃprayoge prathamaḥ svatantrātmakavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti kṣānti gata vikalpa saṃprayoge prathamaḥ svatantra ātmaka vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first independent alternative on the nature of the self in the combination of alternatives on the stage of patience.

original: rūpaṃ śāriputra nopalabhate /
analyzed: rūpam śāriputra na upalabhate
translated: Śāriputra, one does not apprehend form.

original: yāvad vijñānaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: yāvat vijñānam na upalabhate
translated: Up to one does not apprehend consciousness.

original: iti tatraiva dvitīya ekātmavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva dvitīyaḥ eka ātma vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus ends the second alternative on the single nature in the same text.

original: cakṣuḥ śāriputra nopalabhate /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ śāriputra na upalabhate
translated: Śāriputra, one does not apprehend the eye.

original: evaṃ yāvan manaḥ /
analyzed: evam yāvat manaḥ
translated: Thus, up to the mind.

original: rūpaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: rūpam na upalabhate
translated: One does not apprehend form.

original: evaṃ yāvad buddhadharmān nopalabhate /
analyzed: evam yāvat buddha dharmān na upalabhate
translated: Thus, up to the Buddha's dharmas.

original: iti tatraiva tṛtīyaḥ kāraṇātmavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva tṛtīyaḥ kāraṇa ātma vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus ends the third alternative on the causal nature of the self in the same text.

original: cakṣūrūpacakṣurvijñānāni śāriputra nopalabhate /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ rūpa cakṣuḥ vijñānāni śāriputra na upalabhate
translated: Śāriputra, one does not apprehend the eye, form, and eye consciousness.

original: yāvan manodharmamanovijñānāni nopalabhate /
analyzed: yāvat manaḥ dharma manaḥ vijñānāni na upalabhate
translated: Up to one does not apprehend the mind, dharmas, and mind consciousness.

original: iti tatraiva caturtho draṣṭādyātmavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva caturthaḥ draṣṭā ādi ātma vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth alternative on the nature of the seer, etc. in the same text.

original: pratītyasamutpādaṃ śāriputra nopalabhate /
analyzed: pratītyasamutpādam śāriputra na upalabhate
translated: Śāriputra does not apprehend dependent origination.

original: yāvad ārūpyadhātuṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: yāvat ārūpya dhātum na upalabhate
translated: Up to he does not apprehend the formless realm.

original: iti tatraiva pañcamaḥ saṃkleśādhārātmavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva pañcamaḥ saṃkleśa ādhāra ātma vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in that very [text], the fifth [alternative] is the conceptualization of the self as the basis of affliction.

original: prathamaṃ dhyānaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: prathamam dhyānam na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend the first concentration.

original: yāvad ārūpyasamāpattīr nopalabhate /
analyzed: yāvat ārūpya samāpattīḥ na upalabhate
translated: Up to he does not apprehend the formless attainments.

original: iti tatraiva ṣaṣṭo vairāgyādhārātmavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva ṣaṣṭaḥ vairāgya ādhāra ātma vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in that very [text], the sixth [alternative] is the conceptualization of the self as the basis of detachment.

original: āryasatyāni nopalabhate /
analyzed: ārya satyāni na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend the noble truths.

original: iti tatraiva saptamo darśanādhārātmavikalpaḥ
analyzed: iti tatra eva saptamaḥ darśana ādhāra ātma vikalpaḥ
translated: Thus, in that very [text], the seventh [alternative] is the conceptualization of the self as the basis of seeing.

original: aṣṭau vimokṣān navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīr nopalabhate /
analyzed: aṣṭau vimokṣān nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend the eight liberations, the nine successive attainments.

original: iti tatraivāṣṭamo bhāvanādhārātmavikalpaḥ
