analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya vīrya pāramitāyām carataḥ dāna pāramitā
translated: This is the perfection of giving of a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of perseverance.

original: evaṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ carataḥ śīlapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā vīryapāramitā dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: evam vīrya pāramitāyām carataḥ śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā
translated: Thus, while practicing the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditation,

original: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo vīryapāramitāyāṃ caran prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayan sarvadharmeṣu māyākṛtasaṃjñām upasthāpayati /
analyzed: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vīrya pāramitāyām caran prajñāpāramitām bhāvayan sarva dharmeṣu māyā kṛta saṃjñām upasthāpayati
translated: Furthermore, Venerable Śāriputra, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of perseverance, cultivates the perfection of wisdom, he establishes the perception of all phenomena as created by magic.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikārair na śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktair
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ na śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ
translated: With thoughts connected to the knowledge of all aspects, not with thoughts connected to the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: manasikārais tac ca kusalamūlaṃ sarvasattvasādhāraṇaṃ kṛtvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: manasikāraiḥ tat ca kusala mūlam sarva sattva sādhāraṇam kṛtvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
translated: and having made that wholesome root common to all beings, he dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya vīryapāramitāyāṃ carataḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya vīrya pāramitāyām carataḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of perseverance.

original: evaṃ hi śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo vīryapāramitāyāṃ caran ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: evam hi śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vīrya pāramitāyām caran ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ parigṛhṇāti
translated: In this way, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of perseverance, includes the six perfections.

original: tena mahāsannāhasannaddha iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: tena mahā sannāha sannaddhaḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: Therefore, he is counted as one who has donned the great armor.

original: iti vīryapāramitāsannāhaṣaṭkaṃ caturtham
analyzed: iti vīrya pāramitā sannāha ṣaṭkam caturtham
translated: Thus is the fourth set of six on the armor of perseverance, the perfection of perseverance.

original: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dhyānapāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhyāna pāramitāyām
translated: Furthermore, Venerable Śāriputra, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva is in the perfection of concentration,

original: caran dānaṃ dadāti sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikārair na śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktair
analyzed: caran dānam dadāti sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ na śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ
translated: Practicing, he gives gifts with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all modes, not with thoughts associated with the disciples and the pratyekabuddhas.

original: manasikārais tac ca kuśalamūlaṃ sarvasattvasādhāraṇaṃ kṛtvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: manasikāraiḥ tat ca kuśala mūlam sarva sattva sādhāraṇam kṛtvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
translated: And he makes that wholesome root common to all beings and turns it over to supreme enlightenment.

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dhyānapāramitāyāṃ carato dānapāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dhyāna pāramitāyām carataḥ dāna pāramitā
translated: This is the perfection of giving of the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of meditation.

original: evaṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ carataḥ śīlapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā vīryapāramitā dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: evam dhyāna pāramitāyām carataḥ śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā
translated: Thus, of the one who courses in the perfection of meditation, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of vigour, the perfection of meditation,

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dhyānapāramitāyāṃ caran prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayan sarvadharmeṣu māyākṛtasaṃjñām upasthāpayati /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhyāna pāramitāyām caran prajñāpāramitām bhāvayan sarva dharmeṣu māyā kṛta saṃjñām upasthāpayati
translated: and again, furthermore, Śāriputra, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of meditation, who develops the perfection of wisdom, establishes the perception of a magical creation in all dharmas.

original: sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikārair na śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktair
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ na śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ
translated: With thoughts associated with the knowledge of all modes, not with thoughts associated with the disciples and the pratyekabuddhas.

original: manasikārais tac ca kuśalamūlaṃ sarvasattvasādhāraṇaṃ kṛtvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: manasikāraiḥ tat ca kuśala mūlam sarva sattva sādhāraṇam kṛtvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
translated: And he makes that wholesome root common to all beings and turns it over to supreme enlightenment.

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dhyānapāramitāyāṃ carataḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dhyāna pāramitāyām carataḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of concentration.

original: evaṃ hi śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dhyānapāramitāyāṃ caran ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: evam hi śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhyāna pāramitāyām caran ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ parigṛhṇāti
translated: Thus, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of concentration takes up the six perfections.

original: tena mahāsannāhasannaddha iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: tena mahā sannāha sannaddhaḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: Therefore he is counted as one who has donned the great armor.

original: iti dhyānapāramitāsannāhaṣaṭkaṃ pañcamam
analyzed: iti dhyāna pāramitā sannāha ṣaṭkam pañcamam
translated: Thus ends the fifth set of six on the armor of concentration, the perfection of concentration.

original: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caraṃs trimaṇḍalapariśuddhaṃ
analyzed: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran tri maṇḍala pariśuddham
translated: Furthermore, Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom gives a gift purified in the three spheres,

original: dānaṃ dadāti sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikārair na śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktair
analyzed: dānam dadāti sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ na śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ
translated: with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects, not with thoughts associated with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: manasikārais tac ca kuśalamūlaṃ sarvasattvasādhāraṇaṃ kṛtvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: manasikāraiḥ tat ca kuśala mūlam sarva sattva sādhāraṇam kṛtvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
translated: and he dedicates that wholesome action to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, having made it common to all beings.

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato dānapāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ dāna pāramitā
translated: This is the perfection of generosity of the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carataḥ śīlapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā vīryapāramitā dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā
translated: Thus, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,🔽and the perfection of wisdom arise.

original: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayati /
analyzed: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran prajñāpāramitām bhāvayati
translated: Furthermore, Venerable Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom, cultivating the perfection of wisdom,

original: tasya sarvapāramitāsu sarvadharmeṣu ca māyāsvapnapratibhāsapratiśrutkāpratibimbanirmāṇasaṃjñā
analyzed: tasya sarva pāramitāsu sarva dharmeṣu ca māyā svapna pratibhāsa pratiśrutkā pratibimba nirmāṇa saṃjñā
translated: has the perception of all the perfections and all dharmas as like an illusion, a dream, a mirage, an echo, a reflection, a phantom, and a magical creation,

original: pratyupasthitā bhavati sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikārair na śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktair
analyzed: pratyupasthitā bhavati sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ na śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktaiḥ
translated: with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects, not with thoughts associated with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: manasikārais tac ca kuśalamūlaṃ sarvasattvasādhāraṇaṃ kṛtvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: manasikāraiḥ tat ca kuśala mūlam sarva sattva sādhāraṇam kṛtvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
translated: And having made that wholesome root common to all beings, he dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: evaṃ hi śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran prajñāpāramitāṃ paripūrayati /
analyzed: evam hi śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran prajñāpāramitām paripūrayati
translated: In this way, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom perfects the perfection of wisdom.

original: yad āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittenaitāḥ ṣaṭ /
analyzed: yat āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktena cittena etāḥ ṣaḍ
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva with a mind associated with the knowledge of all aspects makes these six perfections

original: pāramitā na nimittīkaroti nopalabhate /
analyzed: pāramitāḥ na nimittīkaroti na upalabhate
translated: He does not take the perfections as a sign, he does not apprehend them.

original: evaṃ hy āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran mahāsannāhasannaddho bhavati /
analyzed: evam hi āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran mahā sannāha sannaddhaḥ bhavati
translated: In this way, Venerable Śāriputra, a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom becomes armored in the great armor.

original: evaṃ ca punar āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattva ekaikasyāṃ pāramitāyāṃ sthitvā ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ paripūrayati /
analyzed: evam ca punar āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ekaikasyām pāramitāyām sthitvā ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ paripūrayati
translated: And in this way, Venerable Śāriputra, a bodhisattva great being, standing in each perfection, perfects the six perfections.

original: iti prajñāpāramitāsannāhaṣaṭkaṃ ṣaṣṭham
analyzed: iti prajñāpāramitā sannāha ṣaṭkam ṣaṣṭham
translated: This is the sixth set of six on the armor of the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dhyānāni ca samāpadyate na ca dhyānāny āsvādayati na ca taiḥ saṃhriyate na ca teṣāṃ vaśenopapadyate /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhyānāni ca samāpadyate na ca dhyānāni āsvādayati na ca taiḥ saṃhriyate na ca teṣām vaśena upapadyate
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva great being enters the meditative absorptions and does not enjoy the meditative absorptions, is not attracted to them, and is not reborn under their influence.

original: evam apramāṇāni cārūpyasamāpattīś ca samāpadyate na ca tā āsvādayati na ca tābhiḥ saṃhriyate na ca tāsāṃ vaśenopapadyate /
analyzed: evam apramāṇāni ca ārūpya samāpattīḥ ca samāpadyate na ca tāḥ āsvādayati na ca tābhiḥ saṃhriyate na ca tāsām vaśena upapadyate
translated: In the same way, he enters the formless attainments and does not enjoy them, is not attracted to them, and is not reborn under their influence.

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyopāyakauśalagatā prajñāpāramitā veditavyā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya upāya kauśala gatā prajñāpāramitā veditavyā
translated: This should be known as the bodhisattva great being's perfection of wisdom endowed with skillful means.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dhyānārūpyasamāpattiṣu vivekadarśanena ca viharati śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitadarśanena ca viharati
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiṣu viveka darśanena ca viharati śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita darśanena ca viharati
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells in the dhyānas and formless concentrations, seeing them as isolated, and dwells seeing them as empty, signless, and wishless,

original: na ca bhūtakoṭiṃ sākṣātkaroti /
analyzed: na ca bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkaroti
translated: but does not actualize the limit of reality.

original: ayaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carata upāyakauśalasannāhaḥ /
analyzed: ayam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ upāya kauśala sannāhaḥ
translated: This is the skillful means armor of the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: evam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mahāsannāhasannaddhas tenocyate bodhisattvo mahāsattva iti /
analyzed: evam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ mahā sannāha sannaddhaḥ tena ucyate bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ iti
translated: Thus, Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva is one who has donned the great armor, and therefore is called a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: evaṃ mahāsannāhasannaddhasyāyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya daśasu
analyzed: evam mahā sannāha sannaddhasya āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya daśasu
translated: Thus, Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who has donned the great armor, in the ten directions

original: dikṣu buddhā bhagavanta udānam udānayanti varṇam udīrayanti nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayamānās
analyzed: dikṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ udānam udānayanti varṇam udīrayanti nāmadheyam parikīrtayamānāḥ
translated: the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, utter cries of joy, proclaim his praise, and proclaim his name,

original: tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śabdam anuśrāvayanti ghoṣam udīrayanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śabdam anuśrāvayanti ghoṣam udīrayanti
translated: and make the sound and voice of that bodhisattva mahāsattva be heard.

original: amuṣmin lokadhātuprasare bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mahāsannāhasannaddha iti sattvāṃś ca paripācayati buddhakṣetraṃ ca pariśodhayati /
analyzed: amuṣmin lokadhātu prasare bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ mahā sannāha sannaddhaḥ iti sattvān ca paripācayati buddhakṣetram ca pariśodhayati
translated: In this spread of world systems, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having donned the great armor, matures beings and purifies the buddhafield.

original: iti sannāhaṣaṭkopasaṃhāraḥ
analyzed: iti sannāha ṣaṭka upasaṃhāraḥ
translated: Thus concludes the summary of the six types of armor.

original: ity uktā sannāhapratipattiḥ
analyzed: iti uktā sannāha pratipattiḥ
translated: Thus is explained the practice of donning the armor.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kiyat āyuṣman pūrṇa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mahāyānasaṃprasthito mahāyānasamārūḍho bhavati /
analyzed: kiyat āyuṣman pūrṇa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ mahāyāna saṃprasthitaḥ mahāyāna samārūḍhaḥ bhavati
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, when does a bodhisattva mahāsattva become established in the Great Vehicle, having mounted the Great Vehicle?

original: pūrṇa āha / ihāyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dānapāramitāyāṃ caran viviktaṃ
analyzed: pūrṇaḥ āha iha āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dāna pāramitāyām caran viviktam
translated: Pūrṇa said: Here, Venerable Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of generosity, dwells alone in a secluded place,

original: kāmair viviktaṃ pāpakair akuśalair dharmaiḥ savitarkasavicāraṃ vivekajaṃ prītisukhaṃ
analyzed: kāmaiḥ viviktam pāpakaiḥ akuśalaiḥ dharmaiḥ sa vitarka sa vicāram viveka jam prīti sukham
translated: detached from desires, detached from evil and unwholesome dharmas, endowed with thought and investigation, experiencing joy and happiness born of detachment,

original: prathamaṃ dhyānam /
analyzed: prathamam dhyānam
translated: in the first concentration.

original: upasaṃpadya viharati /
analyzed: upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: Having attained and dwelt in this,

original: evaṃ dvitīyaṃ tṛtīyaṃ caturthaṃ dhyānaṃ /
analyzed: evam dvitīyam tṛtīyam caturtham dhyānam
translated: so too in the second, third and fourth concentrations,

original: evam ākāśānantyāyatanaṃ vijñānānantyāyatanam ākiñcanyāyatanaṃ naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatanam upasaṃpadya viharati /
analyzed: evam ākāśa ānantya āyatanam vijñāna ānantya āyatanam ākiñcanya āyatanam na eva saṃjñāna asaṃjñā āyatanam upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: so too in the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: imāni bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dhyānārūpyāṇi yadā bodhisattvo mahāsattva etaiś
analyzed: imāni bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dhyāna ārūpyāṇi yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ etaiḥ
translated: These are the concentrations and formless attainments of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: ca dhyānair etaiś cārūpyair dānapāramitāyāṃ carann ākāśākāraliṅganimittaiḥ samāpadyamāno
analyzed: ca dhyānaiḥ etaiḥ ca ārūpyaiḥ dāna pāramitāyām caran ākāśa ākāra liṅga nimittaiḥ samāpadyamānaḥ
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of generosity with these concentrations and formless attainments, enters into the characteristics of the form of space,

original: vyuttiṣṭhamānaś ca tāni ca kuśalamūlāni sarvasattvasādhāraṇāni kṛtvā anuttarāyai
analyzed: vyuttiṣṭhamānaḥ ca tāni ca kuśala mūlāni sarva sattva sādhāraṇāni kṛtvā anuttarāyai
translated: and when he arises from them, he makes those wholesome roots common to all beings and dedicates them to unsurpassed,

original: samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
translated: perfect enlightenment.

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dānapāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dāna pāramitā
translated: This is the bodhisattva mahāsattva's perfection of generosity.

original: evaṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ vācyam /
analyzed: evam śīla pāramitāyām kṣānti pāramitāyām vīrya pāramitāyām dhyāna pāramitāyām vācyam
translated: The same should be said for the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, and the perfection of concentration.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caraṃś catvāri dhyānāni samāpadyate catasra ārūpyasamāpattīḥ samāpadyate /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran catvāri dhyānāni samāpadyate catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattīḥ samāpadyate
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom enters the four concentrations and the four formless attainments.

original: yadā bodhisattvo mahāsattva etaiś ca dhyānair etābhiś cārūpyasamāpattibhir viharati /
analyzed: yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ etaiḥ ca dhyānaiḥ etābhiḥ ca ārūpya samāpattibhiḥ viharati
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells in these concentrations and formless attainments,

original: sa etā dhyānārūpyasamāpattīḥ samāpadyamāno vyuttiṣṭhamānaś cākāśākāraliṅganimittāni manasikaroti /
analyzed: saḥ etāḥ dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīḥ samāpadyamānaḥ vyuttiṣṭhamānaḥ ca ākāśa ākāra liṅga nimittāni manasikaroti
translated: He, while entering and emerging from those meditative stabilizations and formless states, pays attention to the signs, premonitory signs, and indications of space.

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caraṃs tāni ca kuśalamūlāny anyāni ca sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikāraiḥ sarvasattvasādhāraṇāni kṛtvā anuttarāyai
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām caran tāni ca kuśala mūlāni anyāni ca sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ sarva sattva sādhāraṇāni kṛtvā anuttarāyai
translated: Practicing the perfection of wisdom, he makes those wholesome roots and all the others common to all sentient beings with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects, and he turns them over to unsurpassed,

original: samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
translated: perfect enlightenment.

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: evaṃ hy āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ ṣaṭ pāramitāsu caran mahāsannāhasannaddhaḥ sattvāṃś ca paripācayati buddhakṣetraṃ ca pariśodhayati /
analyzed: evam hi āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ṣaṭ pāramitāsu caran mahā sannāha sannaddhaḥ sattvān ca paripācayati buddhakṣetram ca pariśodhayati
translated: Thus, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the six perfections in this way, dons the great armor, ripens sentient beings, and purifies the buddhafield.

original: iti dhyānārūpyasamāpattivyutthānaprasthānam🔽punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yat sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaṃ manasikāram utpādya kleśānāṃ dhvaṃsanāya sarvasattvānāṃ dharmaṃ
analyzed: iti dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti vyutthāna prasthānam  punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yat sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktam manasikāram utpādya kleśānām dhvaṃsanāya sarva sattvānām dharmam
translated: Thus is the departure from the meditative stabilizations and formless states.

original: deśayiṣyāmīti cittam utpādayati /
analyzed: deśayiṣyāmi iti cittam utpādayati
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having generated the thought associated with the knowledge of all aspects, generates the thought: 'I will teach the Dharma to all sentient beings in order to destroy the afflictions.'

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dānapāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dāna pāramitā
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's perfection of giving.

original: yad bodhisattvo mahāsattvas tair eva sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikāraiḥ prathamaṃ dhyānam ākrāmati deśayati /
analyzed: yat bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ taiḥ eva sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ prathamam dhyānam ākrāmati deśayati
translated: When the bodhisattva-mahāsattva, with those very thoughts connected with the knowledge of all modes, enters into the first trance, and teaches it,

original: tatra ca prathame dhyāne pratiṣṭhate na cānyeṣāṃ cittotpādānām avakāśaṃ dadāti śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktānām iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
analyzed: tatra ca prathame dhyāne pratiṣṭhate na ca anyeṣām citta utpādānām avakāśam dadāti śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktānām iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: and abides in that first trance, and does not give an opportunity to other thoughts connected with the disciples and pratyekabuddhas, this is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's

original: aparāmṛṣṭā śīlapāramitā /
analyzed: aparāmṛṣṭā śīla pāramitā
translated: perfection of morality which is not clung to.

original: yad bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktair /
analyzed: yat bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ
translated: When the bodhisattva-mahāsattva, with thoughts connected with the knowledge of all modes,

original: manasikārair dhyānārūpyair viharata evaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: manasikāraiḥ dhyāna ārūpyaiḥ viharataḥ evam bhavati
translated: dwells in the trances and formless attainments, and thinks:

original: sarvasattvānāṃ kleśakṣayāya dharmaṃ deśayiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām kleśa kṣayāya dharmam deśayiṣyāmi iti
translated: I will teach the Dharma for the destruction of the defilements of all beings,

original: yāvat teṣāṃ manasikārāṇāṃ kṣamaṇā rocanā vyupaparīkṣaṇā avabodha upanidhyāpanam /
analyzed: yāvat teṣām manasikārāṇām kṣamaṇā rocanā vyupaparīkṣaṇā avabodhaḥ upanidhyāpanam
translated: and as far as the acceptance, approval, investigation, understanding, and contemplation of those thoughts,

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kṣāntipāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kṣānti pāramitā
translated: this is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's perfection of patience.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikāraiḥ
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, with thoughts associated with complete knowing,

original: sarvakuśalamūlāni sarvasattvasādhāraṇāni kṛtvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
analyzed: sarva kuśala mūlāni sarva sattva sādhāraṇāni kṛtvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
translated: having made all wholesome roots common to all beings, dedicates them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: vīryaṃ ca na sraṃsayati /
analyzed: vīryam ca na sraṃsayati
translated: and does not let go of vigor.

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya vīrya pāramitā
translated: This is the perfection of vigor of a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: yad bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikārair dhyānārūpyasamāpattīś ca samāpadyate na copalabhate /
analyzed: yat bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīḥ ca samāpadyate na ca upalabhate
translated: When a bodhisattva mahāsattva, with thoughts associated with complete knowing, enters into the meditative absorptions and formless concentrations and does not apprehend them,

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dhyāna pāramitā
translated: this is the perfection of meditation of a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: yad bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikāraiḥ prathamadhyānāṅgāni
analyzed: yat bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva ākārajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ prathama dhyāna aṅgāni
translated: When a bodhisattva mahāsattva, with thoughts associated with complete knowing, observes the factors of the first concentration,🔽the factors of the second, third, and fourth concentrations, with the aspects of impermanence,

original: dvitīyāni tṛtīyāni caturthāni dhyānāṅgāni anityākāreṇa duḥkhākāreṇa anātmākāreṇa
analyzed: dvitīyāni tṛtīyāni caturthāni dhyāna aṅgāni anitya ākāreṇa duḥkha ākāreṇa anātma ākāreṇa
translated: suffering, nonself,

original: śāntākāreṇa śūnyākāreṇa ānimittākāreṇa apraṇihitākāreṇa pratyavekṣate na copalabhate /
analyzed: śānta ākāreṇa śūnya ākāreṇa ā animitta ākāreṇa apraṇihita ākāreṇa pratyavekṣate na ca upalabhate
translated: peace, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and does not apprehend them,

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: idam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam /
analyzed: idam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: This, Venerable Śāriputra, is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: iti ṣaṭpāramitāprasthānam
analyzed: iti ṣaṣ pāramitā prasthānam
translated: Thus is the setting forth in the six perfections.

original: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānaṃ /
analyzed: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva is

original: yat sarvākāraṃ saptatriṃśad bodhipakṣān dharmān bhāvayati /
analyzed: yat sarvākāram saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣān dharmān bhāvayati
translated: when he cultivates the thirty-seven factors of awakening in all their aspects.

original: sarvākāraṃ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhasamādhiṃ bhāvayati /
analyzed: sarvākāram śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukha samādhim bhāvayati
translated: He cultivates the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness doors of liberation and the concentrations in all their aspects.

original: sarvākāraṃ balāni vaiśāradyāni aṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān bhāvayati /
analyzed: sarvākāram balāni vaiśāradyāni aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān bhāvayati
translated: He cultivates the powers, the fearlessnesses, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha in all their aspects.

original: idam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam /
analyzed: idam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: This, Venerable Śāriputra, is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: ity āryamārgaprasthānam
analyzed: iti ārya mārgaprasthānam
translated: Thus is the setting forth in the noble path.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo maitrīsahagatena cittena vipulena mahadgatenādvayenāpramāṇenāvaireṇāsapatnenānāvaraṇenāvyāvadhena
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ maitrī sahagatena cittena vipulena mahadgatena advayena apramāṇena avaireṇa asapatnena an āvaraṇena a vyāvadhena
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, with a mind accompanied by friendliness, vast, great, without enmity, without harm, without obstruction,

original: sarvatrānugatena subhāṣitena dharmadhātuparame loke ākāśadhātuparyavasāne sarvāvantaṃ
analyzed: sarvatra anugatena su bhāṣitena dharmadhātu parame loke ākāśa dhātu paryavasāne sarvāvantam
translated: Everywhere, with a well-spoken [mind], in the world that is the ultimate realm, up to the end of space, the entire

original: lokam ekāṃ diśaṃ sphuritvopasaṃpadya viharati /
analyzed: lokam ekām diśam sphuritvā upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: world, having pervaded one direction, he dwells having attained.

original: yāvad daśa diśaḥ sphuritvopasaṃpadya viharati /
analyzed: yāvat daśa diśaḥ sphuritvā upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: Up to the ten directions, having pervaded, he dwells having attained.

original: evaṃ karuṇāsahagatena muditāsahagatena upekṣāsagatena cittenavipulena mahadgatenādvayenāpramāṇenāvaireṇāsapatnenānāvaraṇenāvyāvādhena
analyzed: evam karuṇā sahagatena muditā sahagatena upekṣā sagatena cittena avipulena mahadgatena advayena apramāṇena avaireṇa asapatnena an āvaraṇena a vyāvādhena
translated: Thus, with a mind accompanied by compassion, accompanied by joy, accompanied by equanimity, vast, exalted, immeasurable, free from enmity, free from harm,

original: sarvatrānugatena subhāṣitena dharmadhātuparame loke ākāśadhātuparyavasāne sarvāvantaṃ lokaṃ /🔽ekāṃ diśaṃ sphuritvopasaṃpadya /
analyzed: sarvatra anugatena su bhāṣitena dharmadhātu parame loke ākāśa dhātu paryavasāne sarvāvantam lokam  ekām diśam sphuritvā upasaṃpadya
translated: everywhere, with a well-spoken [mind], in the world that is the ultimate realm, up to the end of space, the entire world,

original: viharati / yāvad daśa diśaḥ sphāritvopasaṃpadya viharati / imāny ucyante bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāpramāṇāni /
analyzed: viharati yāvat daśa diśaḥ sphāritvā upasaṃpadya viharati imāni ucyante bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apramāṇāni
translated: having pervaded one direction, he dwells having attained. Up to the ten directions, having pervaded, he dwells having attained. These are called the immeasurables of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahasattvo maitrīsamādhiṃ samāpadyate mayā sarvasattvās trātavyā iti nirṇāmayati /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahasattvaḥ maitrī samādhim samāpadyate mayā sarva sattvāḥ trātavyāḥ iti nirṇāmayati
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva enters the concentration on loving-kindness and proclaims: By me all beings must be rescued.

original: karuṇāṃ ca samādhiṃ samāpadyate klībakāruṇyatāṃ ca sattveṣu nirṇāmayati /🔽muditāṃ ca samādhiṃ samāpadyate aham eva modayiṣyāmīti sattveṣu nirṇāmayati /
analyzed: karuṇām ca samādhim samāpadyate klība kāruṇya tām ca sattveṣu nirṇāmayati  muditām ca samādhim samāpadyate aham eva modayiṣyāmi iti sattveṣu nirṇāmayati
translated: And he enters the concentration of compassion and dedicates to beings the compassion of a eunuch.🔽And he enters the concentration of joy and dedicates to beings the joy, thinking, “I will delight them.”

original: upekṣāṃ ca samādhiṃ samāpadyate āsravakṣayaṃ ca sattveṣu nirṇāmayati /
analyzed: upekṣām ca samādhim samāpadyate āsrava kṣayam ca sattveṣu nirṇāmayati
translated: And he enters the concentration of equanimity and dedicates to beings the destruction of the defilements.

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāpramāṇeṣu carato dānapāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apramāṇeṣu carataḥ dāna pāramitā
translated: This is the perfection of giving of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the immeasurables.

original: yadā bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dhyānāpramāṇākāraliṅganimittāni samāpadyate vyuttiṣṭhate ca na ca śrāvakapratyekabuddhabhūmau pariṇāmayaty anyatra
analyzed: yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhyāna apramāṇa ākāra liṅga nimittāni samāpadyate vyuttiṣṭhate ca na ca śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmau pariṇāmayati anyatra
translated: When a bodhisattva-mahāsattva enters and emerges from the aspects, signs, and indications of the concentrations and immeasurables, but does not dedicate [them] to the stage of the śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas,

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāpramāṇeṣu carato 'parāmṛṣṭā śīlapāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apramāṇeṣu parāmṛṣṭā śīla pāramitā
translated: except for the sake of maturing beings, this is the unattached morality of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the immeasurables.

original: yadā bodhisattvo mahāsattvas tābhir dhyānāpramāṇārūpyasamāpattibhir avyavakīrṇo viharati /
analyzed: yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tābhiḥ dhyāna apramāṇa ārūpya samāpattibhiḥ avyavakīrṇaḥ viharati
translated: When a bodhisattva-mahāsattva dwells unconfused by those concentrations, immeasurables, and formless [absorptions],

original: ābhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ śrāvakabhūmaye vā pratyekabuddhabhūmaye vā na spṛhayate sarvākārajñataivāsya kṣamate rocate ceyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāpramāṇeṣu 🔽carataḥ kṣāntipāramitā /
analyzed: ābhyām dvābhyām śrāvaka bhūmaye vā pratyekabuddha bhūmaye vā na spṛhayate sarva ākāra jña tā eva asya kṣamate rocate ca iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apramāṇeṣu  carataḥ kṣānti pāramitā
translated: Through these two, he does not aspire to the level of the śrāvakas or the level of the pratyekabuddhas. This is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s perfection of patience when practicing the immeasurables.

original: yadā bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādair anikṣiptadhuro viharati akuśaladharmaprahāṇāya kuśaladharmopasaṃpade /
analyzed: yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva ākārajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ a nikṣipta dhuraḥ viharati akuśala dharma prahāṇāya kuśala dharma upasaṃpade
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattva, with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects, dwells with persistence not relaxed, for the abandonment of unwholesome dharmas and the acquisition of wholesome dharmas,

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāpramāṇeṣu carato vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apramāṇeṣu carataḥ vīrya pāramitā
translated: this is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s perfection of effort when practicing the immeasurables.

original: yadā bodhisattvo mahāsattva etāni ca dhyānāny etāś cāpramāṇārūpyasamāpattīś ca samāpadyate /
analyzed: yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ etāni ca dhyānāni etāḥ ca apramāṇa ārūpya samāpattīḥ ca samāpadyate
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattva enters these dhyānas and these immeasurables and formless concentrations,

original: na ca dhyānāpramāṇārūpyasamāpattivaśenopapadyate /
analyzed: na ca dhyāna apramāṇa ārūpya samāpatti vaśena upapadyate
translated: but does not take rebirth under the influence of the dhyānas, immeasurables, and formless concentrations,

original: na ca tā āsvādayati na ca tābhiḥ saṃhriyate /
analyzed: na ca tāḥ āsvādayati na ca tābhiḥ saṃhriyate
translated: does not enjoy them, and is not attracted to them,

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāpramāṇeṣu carato dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apramāṇeṣu carataḥ dhyāna pāramitā
translated: this is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s perfection of dhyāna when practicing the immeasurables.

original: yadā bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvākārajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikārais tā dhyānāpramāṇārūpyasamāpattīḥ🔽samāpadyate ca vyuttiṣṭhate ca tāś cānityākāreṇa duḥkhākāreṇa anātmākāreṇa śāntākāreṇa
analyzed: yadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva ākāra jña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ tāḥ dhyāna apramāṇa ārūpya samāpattīḥ  samāpadyate ca vyuttiṣṭhate ca tāḥ ca anitya ākāreṇa duḥkha ākāreṇa anātma ākāreṇa śānta ākāreṇa
translated: When a bodhisattva mahāsattva, with thoughts associated with the knowledge of all aspects,🔽enters and emerges from those dhyānas, immeasurables, and formless concentrations, and🔽contemplates them with the aspects of impermanence, suffering, no-self, and peace,

original: śūnyākāreṇa animittākāreṇa apraṇihitākāreṇa pratyavekṣate /
analyzed: śūnya ākāreṇa animitta ākāreṇa apraṇihita ākāreṇa pratyavekṣate
translated: with the aspects of emptiness, no-feature, and no-attainment,

original: na ca śrāvakanyāmaṃ vā pratyekabuddhanyāmaṃ vābhikrāmati /
analyzed: na ca śrāvaka nyāmam vā pratyekabuddha nyāmam vā abhikrāmati
translated: but does not enter the stages of the śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas.

original: iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāpramāṇeṣu carataḥ prajñāpāramitā / idam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvsya māhāyānam /
analyzed: iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya apramāṇeṣu carataḥ prajñāpāramitā idam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvsya māhāyānam
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the immeasurables. This, Venerable Śāriputra, is the Great Vehicle of a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: ity apramāṇaprasthānam
analyzed: iti apramāṇaprasthānam
translated: Thus is the departure for the immeasurables.

original: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam /🔽yad adhyātmaśūnyatāyāṃ jñānaṃ na copalambhayogena /🔽yad bahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ jñānaṃ na copalambhayogena /
analyzed: punar aparam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam  yat adhyātma śūnyatāyām jñānam na ca upalambha yogena  yat bahirdhā śūnyatāyām jñānam na ca upalambha yogena
translated: Furthermore, Venerable Śāriputra, the Great Vehicle of a bodhisattva mahāsattva is🔽the knowledge of internal emptiness, but not through the yoga of grasping.🔽The knowledge of external emptiness, but not through the yoga of grasping.

original: yad adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ jñānaṃ na copalambhayogena /
analyzed: yat adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyām jñānam na ca upalambha yogena
translated: The knowledge of internal and external emptiness, but not through the yoga of grasping.

original: yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ jñānaṃ na copalambhayogena / idaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam /
analyzed: yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyām jñānam na ca upalambha yogena idam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: up to the knowledge of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, but not through the yoga of apprehension. This is the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānaṃ /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being,

original: yat sarvadharmeṣu na śikṣiṣyate cittaṃ samāhitaṃ taj jñānam / idam api bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyanam /
analyzed: yat sarva dharmeṣu na śikṣiṣyate cittam samāhitam tat jñānam idam api bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyanam
translated: is the knowledge that the mind is concentrated when there is no training in all dharmas. This is also the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānaṃ /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being,

original: yad asya na nityam iti jñānaṃ pravartate nānityam iti /
analyzed: yat asya na nityam iti jñānam pravartate na anityam iti
translated: is the knowledge that does not proceed as 'permanent' or 'impermanent'.

original: na duḥkham iti nāduḥkham iti /
analyzed: na duḥkham iti na aduḥkham iti
translated: It does not proceed as 'suffering' or 'not suffering'.

original: na sukham iti nāsukham iti /
analyzed: na sukham iti na asukham iti
translated: It does not proceed as 'happiness' or 'not happiness'.

original: nātmeti nānātmeti /
analyzed: na ātmā iti na anātmā iti
translated: It does not proceed as 'self' or 'not self'.

original: na śāntam iti nāśāntam iti /
analyzed: na śāntam iti na a śāntam iti
translated: It does not proceed as 'peaceful' or 'not peaceful'.

original: na śūnyam iti nāśūnyam iti /
analyzed: na śūnyam iti na a śūnyam iti
translated: It does not proceed as 'empty' or 'not empty'.

original: na nimittam iti nānimittam iti /
analyzed: na nimittam iti na animittam iti
translated: It does not proceed as 'signless' or 'not signless'.

original: na praṇihitam iti nāpraṇihitam iti jñānaṃ pravartate / idam api subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyanam /
analyzed: na praṇihitam iti na apraṇihitam iti jñānam pravartate idam api subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyanam
translated: It does not proceed as 'wishless' or 'not wishless'. This, Subhūti, is the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānaṃ /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva is

original: yad atīte 'dhvani jñānaṃ na pravartate /🔽anāgate 'dhvani jñānaṃ na pravartate /
analyzed: yat atīte dhvani jñānam na pravartate  anāgate dhvani jñānam na pravartate
translated: that his knowledge does not engage with the past,🔽his knowledge does not engage with the future,

original: pratyutpanne 'dhvani jñānaṃ na pravartate /
analyzed: pratyutpanne dhvani jñānam na pravartate
translated: his knowledge does not engage with the present,

original: na cāsya triṣv adhvasv ajñānaṃ pravartate /
analyzed: na ca asya triṣu adhvasu ajñānam pravartate
translated: but he does not have ignorance with regard to the three times.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena / idam api śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena idam api śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: And that is through the yoga of non-apprehension. This, Śāriputra, is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānaṃ /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva is

original: yan na kāmadhātau jñānaṃ pravartate na rūpadhātau jñānaṃ pravartatenārūpyadhātau jñānaṃ pravartate /
analyzed: yat na kāmadhātau jñānam pravartate na rūpadhātau jñānam pravartate na ārūpyadhātau jñānam pravartate
translated: that his knowledge does not engage with the desire realm, his knowledge does not engage with the form realm, his knowledge does not engage with the formless realm,

original: na cāsya kāmarūpārūpyadhātāv ajñānaṃ pravartate /🔽tac cānupalambhayogena / idam api śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam /
analyzed: na ca asya kāmarūpa ārūpya dhātau ajñānam pravartate  tat ca anupalambha yogena idam api śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: but he does not have ignorance with regard to the desire, form, and formless realms.🔽And that is through the yoga of non-apprehension. This, Śāriputra, is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānaṃ /
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva is

original: yan na laukikeṣu lokottareṣu dharmeṣu jñānaṃ pravartate /
analyzed: yat na laukikeṣu lokottareṣu dharmeṣu jñānam pravartate
translated: It is the knowledge that does not operate with regard to mundane or supramundane dharmas,

original: na sāsraveṣu dharmeṣu nānāsraveṣu dharmeṣu na saṃskṛteṣu nāsaṃskṛteṣu na cāsyalaukikalokottarasāsravānāsravasaṃskṛtāsaṃskṛteṣu dharmeṣv ajñānaṃ🔽tac cānupalambhayogena / idam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya /
analyzed: na sa āsraveṣu dharmeṣu na anāsraveṣu dharmeṣu na saṃskṛteṣu na asaṃskṛteṣu na ca āsya laukika lokottara sa āsrava anāsrava saṃskṛta asaṃskṛteṣu dharmeṣu ajñānam  tat ca anupalambha yogena idam āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvasya
translated: with regard to contaminated or uncontaminated dharmas, with regard to conditioned or unconditioned dharmas, and it is not the non-knowledge of mundane, supramundane, contaminated, uncontaminated, conditioned, or unconditioned dharmas,

original: mahāsattvasya mahāyānam /🔽ity anupalambhayogena prasthānam
analyzed: mahāsattvasya mahāyānam  iti anupalambha yogena prasthānam
translated: and that is through the yoga of non-apprehension. This, Venerable Śāriputra, is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva.🔽Thus it is, Venerable Śāriputra, that the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's Great Vehicle is established.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kiyatāyuṣman pūrṇa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mahāyānasamārūḍha ity ucyate /
analyzed: kiyatā āyuṣman pūrṇa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ mahāyāna samārūḍhaḥ iti ucyate
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, when the bodhisattva-mahāsattva is mounted on the Great Vehicle, to what extent is he said to be mounted on the Great Vehicle?

original: pūrṇa āha / ihāyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran dānapāramitām ārohati /
analyzed: pūrṇaḥ āha iha āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran dāna pāramitām ārohati
translated: Pūrṇa said: Here, Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom mounts the perfection of giving.

original: sa naiva dānapāramitām upalabhate na dāyakaṃ na pratigrāhakaṃ na dānam upalabhate anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sa nā eva dāna pāramitām upalabhate na dāyakam na pratigrāhakam na dānam upalabhate anupalambha yogena
translated: He does not apprehend the perfection of giving, nor the giver, nor the recipient, nor the gift, through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: evaṃ hy āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvodānapāramitāsamārūḍha ity ucyate /
analyzed: evam hi āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ udāna pāramitā samārūḍhaḥ iti ucyate
translated: Thus, Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva is said to be mounted on the perfection of giving.

original: evaṃ śīlapāramitāsamārūḍhaḥ kṣāntipāramitāsamārūḍho vīryapāramitāsamārūḍho dhyānapāramitāsamārūḍhaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran prajñāpāramitām
analyzed: evam śīla pāramitā samārūḍhaḥ kṣānti pāramitā samārūḍhaḥ vīrya pāramitā samārūḍhaḥ dhyāna pāramitā samārūḍhaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran prajñāpāramitām
translated: Thus, having mounted the perfection of morality, having mounted the perfection of patience, having mounted the perfection of perseverance, having mounted the perfection of concentration, practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: sa naivaprajñāpāramitām upalabhate na bodhisattvaṃ na manasikāram upalabhate anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sa na eva prajñāpāramitām upalabhate na bodhisattvam na manasikāram upalabhate an upalambha yogena
translated: he does not apprehend the perfection of wisdom, does not apprehend a bodhisattva, does not apprehend attention, due to the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: evaṃ hy āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahasattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāsamārūḍha ity ucyate /
analyzed: evam hi āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahasattvaḥ prajñāpāramitā samārūḍhaḥ iti ucyate
translated: Thus, Venerable Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva is said to have mounted the perfection of wisdom.

original: iti trimaṇḍalapariśuddhiprasthānam
analyzed: iti tri maṇḍala pariśuddhi prasthānam
translated: Thus is the departure of the purification of the three spheres.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'vyavakīrṇena sarvākārajñatācittotpādena
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vyavakīrṇena sarva ākāra jña tā citta utpādena
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, with the thought of enlightenment that is not mixed up,

original: saptatriṃśad bodhipakṣān dharmān bhāvayati bhāvanāvibhāvanārthena tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣān dharmān bhāvayati bhāvanā vibhāvanā arthena tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: cultivates the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment with the meaning of realizing through cultivation, and that also through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: evaṃ hy āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mahāyānasamārūḍha ity ucyate /
analyzed: evam hi āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ mahāyāna samārūḍhaḥ iti ucyate
translated: Thus, Venerable Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva is said to have mounted the Great Vehicle.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'vyavakīrṇena sarvākārajñatācittotpādena
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vyavakīrṇena sarva ākāra jña tā citta utpādena
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, with the thought of enlightenment that is not mixed up,

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitasamādhīn bhāvayati bhāvanāvibhāvanārthena tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita samādhīn bhāvayati bhāvanā vibhāvanā arthena tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: He cultivates the emptiness, signless, and wishless meditative stabilizations, and he does so by way of not apprehending anything.

original: evaṃ hy āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mahāyānasamārūḍha ity ucyate /
analyzed: evam hi āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ mahāyāna samārūḍhaḥ iti ucyate
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is for this reason that a bodhisattva great being is said to have mounted the Great Vehicle.”

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'vyavakīrṇena sarvākārajñatācittotpādena
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vyavakīrṇena sarva ākāra jña tā citta utpādena
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva great being, with a thought of awakening that is not mixed with anything else,

original: daśa tathāgatabalāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān
analyzed: daśa tathāgata balāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān
translated: cultivates the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: bhāvayati bhāvanāvibhāvanārthena tac cānupalambhayogena / evaṃ hy āyuṣman śāriputra
analyzed: bhāvayati bhāvanā vibhāvanā arthena tat ca anupalambha yogena evam hi āyuṣman śāriputra
translated: and he does so by way of not apprehending anything. Venerable Śāriputra,

original: bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mahāyānasamārūḍha ity ucyate /

translated: ‘This is just a designation, namely, “bodhisattva,” because of not apprehending a being.

translated: This too is just a designation, namely, “form,” because of not apprehending form.

original: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ

analyzed: nāma mātram idam yat uta vijñānam vijñāna anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: consciousness is merely a name, because of the non-apprehension of consciousness.

original: nāmamātram idaṃ yad uta cakṣuś cakṣuṣo / 🔽'nupalabdhitām upādāya /

translated: Eye is merely a name, because of the non-apprehension of the eye.

original: evaṃ śrotraṃ ghrāṇaṃ jihvā kāyo nāmamātram idaṃ yad uta mano manaso 'nupalabdhitām upādāya /

translated: Ear, nose, tongue, body, mind is merely a name, because of the non-apprehension of the mind.

original: evaṃ vyastasamastāḥ skandhā dhātava āyatanāni pratītyasamutpādaḥ saptatriṃśad bodhipakṣyā dharmā balāni vaiśāradyāni pratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikā
analyzed: evam vyasta samastāḥ skandhāḥ dhātavaḥ āyatanāni pratītyasamutpādaḥ saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ balāni vaiśāradyāni pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśā āveṇikā

original: nāmamātraṃ yad uta bodhir buddhaś ca buddhānupalabdhitām upādāya / evaṃ hy āyuṣman śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mahāyānasamārūḍha ity ucyate /
