original: evaṃ sakṛdāgāmiphalasya anāgāmiphalasya arhattvasya pratyekabodher mārgajñatāyāḥ
analyzed: evam sakṛdāgāmi phalasya anāgāmi phalasya arhat tvasya pratyeka bodheḥ mārga jña tāyāḥ
translated: In the same way, he who would seek the departure of the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, arhatship, individual enlightenment,

original: sarvākārajñatāyāḥ sa subhūte niryāṇam icched yo 'lakṣaṇānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ niryāṇam icchet / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ sa subhūte niryāṇam icchet yaḥ lakṣaṇānām dharmāṇām niryāṇam icchet tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: the knowledge of path-aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects would seek the departure of dharmas without distinguishing marks. Why is that?

original: tathā hi subhūte yaḥ srotaāpattiphalasya svabhāvo na sa traidhātukān niryāsyati na sarvākārajñatāyāṃ sthāsyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte yaḥ srotaāpatti phalasya svabhāvaḥ na sa traidhātukāt niryāsyati na sarva ākāra jña tāyām sthāsyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Subhūti, it is because the intrinsic nature of the fruit of stream-entry does not depart from the three realms and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects. Why is that?

original: tathā hi srotaāpattiphalasvabhāvaḥ srotaāpattiphalasvabhāvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi srotaāpatti phala svabhāvaḥ srotaāpatti phala svabhāvena śūnyaḥ
translated: Because the intrinsic nature of the fruit of stream-entry is empty of the intrinsic nature of the fruit of stream-entry.

original: evaṃ sakṛdāgāmiphalasya yaḥ svabhāvo 'nāgāmiphalasya yaḥ svabhāvo 'rhattvasya yaḥ
analyzed: evam sakṛdāgāmi phalasya yaḥ svabhāvaḥ nāgāmi phalasya yaḥ svabhāvaḥ rhat tvasya yaḥ
translated: In the same way, the intrinsic nature of the fruit of once-returning, the intrinsic nature of the fruit of non-returning, the intrinsic nature of arhatship,

original: svabhāvaḥ pratyekabuddhatvasya yaḥ svabhāvo mārgajñatāyāyaḥ svabhāvaḥ sarvākārajñatāyā
analyzed: svabhāvaḥ pratyekabuddha tvasya yaḥ svabhāvaḥ mārga jña tāyāḥ yaḥ svabhāvaḥ sarva ākāra jña tāyāḥ
translated: the intrinsic nature of individual enlightenment, the intrinsic nature of the knowledge of path-aspects, the intrinsic nature of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: yaḥ svabhāvo na sa traidhātukān niryāsyati na sarvākārajñatāyāṃ sthāsyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ svabhāvaḥ na sa traidhātukāt niryāsyati na sarva ākāra jña tāyām sthāsyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: That nature does not go forth from the three realms, nor does it stand in the knowledge of all modes. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi sarvākārajñatāyāḥ svabhāvaḥ sarvākārajñatāsvabhāvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ svabhāvaḥ sarva ākārajña tā svabhāvena śūnyaḥ
translated: Because the nature of the knowledge of all modes is empty of the knowledge of all modes.

original: iti darśanamārge prathamagrāhakavikalpapratipakṣaḥ
analyzed: iti darśana mārge prathama grāhaka vikalpa pratipakṣaḥ
translated: Thus in the path of vision, it is the antidote to the first discriminating concept of a subject.

original: nāmnaḥ sa subhūte niryāṇam icched yo 'lakṣaṇānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ niryāṇam icchet /
analyzed: nāmnaḥ sa subhūte niryāṇam icchet yaḥ lakṣaṇānām dharmāṇām niryāṇam icchet
translated: Subhuti, he who would seek the going forth of a name would seek the going forth of dharmas without a distinguishing mark.

original: evaṃ nimittasya saṃketasya vyavahārasya prajñapteḥ sa subhūte niryāṇam icched yo 'lakṣaṇānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ niryāṇam icchet / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: evam nimittasya saṃketasya vyavahārasya prajñapteḥ sa subhūte niryāṇam icchet yaḥ lakṣaṇānām dharmāṇām niryāṇam icchet tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Subhuti, he who would seek the going forth of a sign, of a designation, of a conventional expression, of a concept would seek the going forth of dharmas without a distinguishing mark. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi subhūte yo nāmnaḥ svabhāvo na sa traidhātukān niryāsyati na sarvākārajñatāyāṃ sthāsyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte yaḥ nāmnaḥ svabhāvaḥ na sa traidhātukāt niryāsyati na sarva ākāra jña tāyām sthāsyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because, Subhuti, the nature of a name does not go forth from the three realms, nor does it stand in the knowledge of all modes. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi subhūte nāmasvabhāvo nāmasvabhāvena śūnyaḥ / evaṃ saṃketasyayaḥ svabhāvo
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte nāma svabhāvaḥ nāma svabhāvena śūnyaḥ evam svabhāvaḥ
translated: Because, Subhuti, the nature of a name is empty of the nature of a name. Thus the nature of a sign,

original: vyavahārasya yaḥ svabhāvaḥ prajñapter yaḥ svabhāvo na sa traidhātukān niryāsyati
analyzed: vyavahārasya yaḥ svabhāvaḥ prajñapteḥ yaḥ svabhāvaḥ na sa traidhātukāt niryāsyati
translated: The nature of a designation, the nature of a designation is not liberated from the three realms,

original: na sarvākārajñatāyāṃ sthāsyati / tat kasya hetoḥ / /
analyzed: na sarva ākārajña tāyām sthāsyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: and will not stand in the knowledge of all aspects. Why is that?

original: tathā hi prajñaptisvabhāvaḥ prajñaptisvabhāvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi prajñapti svabhāvaḥ prajñapti svabhāvena śūnyaḥ
translated: Because a designated nature is empty of a designated nature.

original: anutpādasya sa subhūte niryāṇam icched yo 'lakṣaṇānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ niryāṇam icchet / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: anutpādasya sa subhūte niryāṇam icchet yaḥ lakṣaṇānām dharmāṇām niryāṇam icchet tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Subhūti, he who would seek the departure of non-production would seek the departure of dharmas without distinguishing marks. Why is that?

original: tathā hi subhūte yo 'nutpādasya svabhāvo na sa traidhātukān niryāsyati na sarvākārajñatāyāṃ sthāsyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte yaḥ nutpādasya svabhāvaḥ na sa traidhātukāt niryāsyati na sarva ākāra jña tāyām sthāsyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because, Subhūti, the nature of non-production is not liberated from the three realms and will not stand in the knowledge of all aspects. Why is that?

original: tathā hi anutpādasvabhāvo 'nutpādasvabhāvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi anutpāda svabhāvaḥ nutpāda svabhāvena śūnyaḥ
translated: Because the nature of non-production is empty of the nature of non-production.

original: evam anirodhasyāsaṃkleśasyāvyavadānasyānabhisaṃskārasya sa subhūte niryāṇam icched yo 'lakṣaṇānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ niryāṇam icchet / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: evam a nirodhasya a saṃkleśasya a vyavadānasya an abhisaṃskārasya sa subhūte niryāṇam icchet yaḥ lakṣaṇānām dharmāṇām niryāṇam icchet tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Subhūti, he who would seek the departure of non-production would seek the departure of dharmas without distinguishing marks. Why is that?

original: tathā hi subhūte yo 'nabhisaṃskārasvabhāvo na sa traidhātukān niryāsyati na sarvākārajñatāyāṃ sthāsyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte yaḥ na abhisaṃskāra svabhāvaḥ na sa traidhātukāt niryāsyati na sarva ākāra jña tāyām sthāsyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because, Subhūti, that which has the nature of non-production does not go forth from the three realms and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects. Why is that?

original: tathā hi anabhisaṃskārasvabhāvo 'nabhisaṃskārasvabhāvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi an abhisaṃskāra svabhāvaḥ na abhisaṃskāra svabhāvena śūnyaḥ
translated: Because the nature of non-production is empty of the nature of non-production.

original: evaṃ hi subhūte na mahāyānaṃ traidhātukān niryāsyati na sarvākārajñatāyāṃ sthāsyati /
analyzed: evam hi subhūte na mahāyānam traidhātukāt niryāsyati na sarva ākāra jña tāyām sthāsyati
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle does not go forth from the three realms and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: acalitaṃ tad yānam /
analyzed: acalitam tat yānam
translated: That vehicle does not move.

original: iti darśanamārge dvitīyagrāhakavikalpapratipakṣaḥ
analyzed: iti darśana mārge dvitīya grāhaka vikalpa pratipakṣaḥ
translated: This is the antidote to the second misconception of the grasper on the path of seeing.

original: yat punaḥ subhūtir evam āha /
analyzed: yat punar subhūtiḥ evam āha
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when you say

original: kva tad yānaṃ sthāsyatīti /
analyzed: kva tat yānam sthāsyati iti
translated: Where will that vehicle stand?

original: na tad yānaṃ kvacit sthāsyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na tat yānam kvacid sthāsyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: That vehicle will not stand anywhere. Why is that?

original: tathā hi subhūte asthitāḥ sarvadharmāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte asthitāḥ sarva dharmāḥ
translated: Because, Subhūti, all dharmas are non-abiding.

original: api tu subhūte asthānaṃ na sthānayogena tad yānaṃ sthāsyati /
analyzed: api tu subhūte asthānam na sthāna yogena tat yānam sthāsyati
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the non-abiding will not stand with the method of abiding.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte dharmadhātur na sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte dharmadhātuḥ na sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: For example, Subhūti, the dharma-realm does not stand or not stand.

original: evam eva subhūte tan mahāyānaṃ na sthitaṃ nāsthitaṃ /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte tat mahāyānam na sthitam na asthitam
translated: In just the same way, Subhūti, that Great Vehicle does not stand or not stand.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte 'nutpādo 'nirodho 'saṃkleśo 'vyavadānam anabhisaṃskāro na sthito nāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte saṃkleśaḥ vyavadānam an abhisaṃskāraḥ na sthitaḥ na asthitaḥ
translated: Just as, for example, non-production, non-stopping, non-defilement, non-purification, non-performance, are not existent and not non-existent,

original: evam eva subhūte tan mahāyanaṃ na sthitaṃ nāsthitaṃ /
analyzed: evam eva subhūte tat mahāyanam na sthitam na asthitam
translated: in the same way, Subhūti, that Great Vehicle is not existent and not non-existent.

original: tathā hi subhūte dharmadhātur dharmadhātunā śūnyaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte dharmadhātuḥ dharmadhātunā śūnyaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because, Subhūti, the dharma-element is empty of the dharma-element. Why is that?

original: na hi subhūte dharmadhātusvabhāvaḥ sthito vā asthito va / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na hi subhūte dharmadhātu svabhāvaḥ sthitaḥ vā asthitaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because, Subhūti, the intrinsic nature of the dharma-element is not existent or non-existent. Why is that?

original: tathā hi subhūte dharmadhātusvabhāvo dharmadhātusvabhāvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte dharmadhātu svabhāvaḥ dharmadhātu svabhāvena śūnyaḥ
translated: Because, Subhūti, the intrinsic nature of the dharma-element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the dharma-element.

original: evam anutpādo 'nirodho 'saṃkleśo 'vyavadānam abhisaṃskāro 'nabhisaṃskāreṇa śūnyaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: evam anutpādaḥ saṃkleśaḥ vyavadānam abhisaṃskāraḥ na abhisaṃskāreṇa śūnyaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: In the same way, non-production, non-stopping, non-defilement, non-purification, non-performance, are empty of non-performance. Why is that?

original: na hi subhūte 'nabhisaṃskārasvabhāvaḥ sthito vā asthito vā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na hi subhūte na abhisaṃskāra svabhāvaḥ sthitaḥ vā asthitaḥ vā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because, Subhūti, the intrinsic nature of non-performance is not existent or non-existent. Why is that?

original: tathā hi subhūte anabhisaṃskārasvabhāvo 'nabhisaṃskārasvabhāvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte an abhisaṃskāra svabhāvaḥ na abhisaṃskāra svabhāvena śūnyaḥ
translated: Because, Subhūti, the intrinsic nature of non-performance is empty of the intrinsic nature of non-performance.

original: evaṃ hi subhūte tad yānaṃ na kvacit sthāsyati /
analyzed: evam hi subhūte tat yānam na kvacid sthāsyati
translated: In this way, Subhūti, that vehicle will not stand anywhere.

original: asthitam asthānayogena acālyayogena /
analyzed: asthitam asthāna yogena a cālya yogena
translated: It does not stand, not standing by the method of non-standing, by the method of non-agitation.

original: iti bhāvanāmārge prathamagrāhyavikalpapratipakṣaḥ
analyzed: iti bhāvanā mārge prathama grāhya vikalpa pratipakṣaḥ
translated: Thus, this is the antidote to the first conceptualization of the apprehended object in the path of cultivation.

original: yat punaḥ subhūtir evam āha /
analyzed: yat punar subhūtiḥ evam āha
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when you say this:

original: kas tena yānena niryāsyatīti /
analyzed: kaḥ tena yānena niryāsyati iti
translated: Who will go forth by that vehicle?

original: na kaścit tena yānena niryāsyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na kaścid tena yānena niryāsyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: No one will go forth by that vehicle. Why is that?

original: tathā hi subhūte yac ca tad yānaṃ yena ca niryāsyati yaś ca niryāsyati yataś ca niryāsyati sarva ete /
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte yat ca tat yānam yena ca niryāsyati yaḥ ca niryāsyati yatas ca niryāsyati sarve ete
translated: Subhūti, it is because that vehicle by which one would go forth, the one who would go forth, and that from which one would go forth - all these

original: dharmā na saṃvidyante /
analyzed: dharmāḥ na saṃvidyante
translated: dharmas do not exist.

original: evam asaṃvidyamānānāṃ sarvadharmāṇāṃ katamo dharmaḥ katamena dharmeṇa niryāsyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: evam a saṃvidyamānānām sarva dharmāṇām katamaḥ dharmaḥ katamena dharmeṇa niryāsyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Thus, for all dharmas that do not exist, what dharma would go forth by what dharma? Why is that?

original: tathā hi subhūte nātmā upalabhyate na sattvo na jīvo na poṣo na puruṣo na pudgalo na manujo na mānavo na kārako na vedako na jānako na paśyaka
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte na ātmā upalabhyate na sattvaḥ na jīvaḥ na poṣaḥ na puruṣaḥ na pudgalaḥ na manujaḥ na mānavaḥ na kārakaḥ na vedakaḥ na jānakaḥ na paśyaka
translated: Subhūti, it is because the self is not apprehended, a being, a life-force, a person, a human, a human being, one who does, one who feels, one who knows, one who sees,

original: ātmano 'tyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: ātmanaḥ tyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: due to the utter purity of the self.

original: evaṃ yāvat paśyakasyātyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: evam yāvat paśyakasya atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Similarly, up to: one who sees is not apprehended, due to the utter purity of one who sees.

original: dharmadhātur nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: dharmadhātuḥ na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: The dharma-realm is not apprehended, due to utter purity.

original: evam anutpādo 'nirodho 'saṃkleśo 'vyavadānam anabhisaṃskāro nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: evam anutpādaḥ nirodhaḥ saṃkleśaḥ vyavadānam an abhisaṃskāraḥ na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: In the same way, non-arising, non-cessation, non-affliction, non-purification, and non-performance are not apprehended, due to absolute purity.

original: skandhadhātvāyatanāni nopalabhyante atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: skandha dhātu āyatanāni na upalabhyante atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases are not apprehended, due to absolute purity.

original: pratītyasamutpādo nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: pratītyasamutpādaḥ na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Dependent origination is not apprehended, due to absolute purity.

original: dānapāramitā nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā nā upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: The perfection of giving is not apprehended, due to absolute purity.

original: evaṃ śīlapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā vīryapāramitā dhyānapāramitā prajñāpāramitā nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya / adhyātmaśūnyatā nopalabhyate
analyzed: evam śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā prajñāpāramitā na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya adhyātma śūnyatā na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are not apprehended, due to absolute purity. Internal emptiness is not apprehended

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽bahirdhāśūnyatā nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  bahirdhā śūnyatā na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: due to absolute purity.🔽External emptiness is not apprehended, due to absolute purity.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Internal and external emptiness is not apprehended, due to absolute purity.

original: evaṃ yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya / smṛtyupasthānāni nopalabhyante atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: evam yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā nā upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya smṛti upasthānāni nā upalabhyante atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: In the same way, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence is not apprehended, on account of absolute purity. The applications of mindfulness are not apprehended, on account of absolute purity.

original: evaṃ samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgā nopalabhyante atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: evam samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgāḥ na upalabhyante atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: In the same way, the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path are not apprehended, on account of absolute purity.

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayo nopalabhyante atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ na upalabhyante atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: The immeasurables, concentrations, and formless absorptions are not apprehended, on account of absolute purity.

original: evaṃ daśa tathāgatabalāni nopalabhyante catvāri vaiśāradyāni nopalabhyante catasraḥ pratisaṃvido nopalabhyante aṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmā
analyzed: evam daśa tathāgata balāni na upalabhyante catvāri vaiśāradyāni na upalabhyante catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ na upalabhyante aṣṭādaśā āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: In the same way, the ten powers of the Tathāgata are not apprehended, the four fearlessnesses are not apprehended, the four detailed and thorough knowledges are not apprehended, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha

original: nopalabhyante atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽srotaāpanno nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: na upalabhyante atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  srotaāpannaḥ na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: are not apprehended, on account of absolute purity.🔽A stream enterer is not apprehended, on account of absolute purity.

original: sakṛdāgāmī nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽anāgāmī nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmī na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  anāgāmī na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: A once-returner is not apprehended, on account of absolute purity.🔽A non-returner is not apprehended, on account of absolute purity.

original: arhan nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: arhan na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: A worthy one is not apprehended, on account of absolute purity.

original: pratyekabuddho nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: pratyekabuddhaḥ nā upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: A pratyekabuddha is not apprehended because of absolute purity.

original: bodhisattvo nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ nā upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: A bodhisattva is not apprehended because of absolute purity.

original: tathāgato nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: A tathāgata is not apprehended because of absolute purity.

original: srotaāpattiphalan nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: srotaāpatti phalat na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: The fruit of entering the stream is not apprehended because of absolute purity.

original: evaṃ sakṛdāgāmiphalan nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitāmupādāya /
analyzed: evam sakṛdāgāmi phalat na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Thus, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth is not apprehended because of absolute purity.

original: anāgāmiphalan nopalabhyate /
analyzed: anāgāmi phalat na upalabhyate
translated: The fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth is not apprehended.

original: arhattvan nopalabhyate /
analyzed: arhat tvat na upalabhyate
translated: Arhatship is not apprehended.

original: pratyekabodhir nopalabhyate /
analyzed: pratyeka bodhiḥ na upalabhyate
translated: Individual enlightenment is not apprehended.

original: tathāgatatvan nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathāgata tvat na upalabhyate
translated: Tathāgatahood is not apprehended.

original: sarvākārajñatā nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Omniscience is not apprehended because of absolute purity.

original: pramuditābhūmir nopalabhyateatyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: pramuditā bhūmiḥ nā upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: The stage of great joy is not apprehended because of absolute purity.

original: evaṃ vimalā prabhākarī arciṣmatī /
analyzed: evam vimalā prabhākarī arciṣmatī
translated: Thus, the stainless stage, the radiant stage, the brilliant stage,

original: sudurjayā abhimukhī dūraṅgamā acalā sādhumatī dharmameghā bhūmir nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: su durjayā abhimukhī dūraṅgamā acalā sādhumatī dharma meghā bhūmiḥ na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: the difficult to conquer stage, the stage of presence, the far-reaching stage, the immovable stage, the stage of wisdom, and the stage of the cloud of Dharma are not apprehended because of absolute purity.

original: pūrvānto nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: pūrva antaḥ na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: The past limit is not apprehended because of absolute purity.

original: aparānto nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: apara antaḥ na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: The future is not apprehended because of absolute purity.

original: pratyutpanno nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: pratyutpannaḥ na upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: The present is not apprehended because of absolute purity.

original: evam agatir nopalabhyate gatir nopalabhyate sthitir nopalabhyate cyutir nopalabhyate upapattir nopalabhyate hānir nopalabhyate vṛddhir nopalabhyate
analyzed: evam agatiḥ na upalabhyate gatiḥ na upalabhyate sthitiḥ na upalabhyate cyutiḥ na upalabhyate upapattiḥ na upalabhyate hāniḥ na upalabhyate vṛddhiḥ na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, non-going is not apprehended, going is not apprehended, abiding is not apprehended, falling away is not apprehended, rebirth is not apprehended, decrease is not apprehended, and increase is not apprehended because of absolute purity.

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Because of absolute purity.

original: kasyānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: kasya anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate
translated: By the non-apprehension of what is non-apprehension not apprehended?

original: dharmadhātor anupalabdhyā nopalabhyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dharmadhātoḥ anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The non-apprehension of the dharma-element is not apprehended. Why is that?

original: na hi subhūte dharmadhātur upalabhyate anupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: na hi subhūte dharmadhātuḥ upalabhyate anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate
translated: Subhūti, the dharma-element is not apprehended. By the non-apprehension it is not apprehended.

original: anutpādasyānirodhasyāsaṃkleśasyāvyavadānasyānabhisaṃskārasyānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate abhisaṃskāraḥ /
analyzed: anutpādasya anirodhasya asaṃkleśasya avyavadānasya anabhisaṃskārasya anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: By the non-apprehension of non-arising, non-cessation, non-defilement, non-purification, and non-formation, formation is not apprehended.

original: skandhadhātvāyatanānupalabdhyā nopalabhyante skandhadhātvāyatanāni /
analyzed: skandha dhātu āyatana anupalabdhyā na upalabhyante skandha dhātu āyatanāni
translated: By the non-apprehension of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields, the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields are not apprehended.

original: pratītyasamutpādānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate pratītyasamutpādaḥ /
analyzed: pratītyasamutpāda anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate pratītyasamutpādaḥ
translated: By the non-apprehension of dependent origination, dependent origination is not apprehended.

original: dānapāramitānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate dānapāramitā /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate dāna pāramitā
translated: The perfection of generosity is not apprehended because of the non-apprehension of the perfection of generosity.

original: evaṃ śīlapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā vīryapāramitā dhyānapāramitā prajñāpāramitānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: evam śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā prajñāpāramitā anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate prajñāpāramitā
translated: Thus, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are not apprehended because of the non-apprehension of the perfection of wisdom.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate adhyātamasūnyatā /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatā anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate adhyātama sūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is not apprehended because of the non-apprehension of the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate bahirdhāśūnyatā adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatā anupalabdhyā nā upalabhyate bahirdhā śūnyatā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā anupalabdhyā nā upalabhyate
translated: The emptiness of external phenomena is not apprehended because of the non-apprehension of the emptiness of external phenomena. The emptiness of both external and internal phenomena is not apprehended because of the non-apprehension of the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of both external and internal phenomena.

original: evaṃ yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatānupalabdhyā abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā anupalabdhyāḥ abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā nā upalabhyate
translated: Thus, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence is not apprehended because of the non-apprehension of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: smṛtyupasthānānupalabdhyā smṛtyupasthānāni nopalabhyante /🔽samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgānupalabdhyāsamyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgā nopalabhyante /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna anupalabdhyā smṛti upasthānāni na upalabhyante 🔽samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārga anupalabdhyā asamyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgāḥ na upalabhyante
translated: The applications of mindfulness are not apprehended because of the non-apprehension of the applications of mindfulness.🔽The right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path are not apprehended because of the non-apprehension of the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path.

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattyanupalabdhyā apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayo nopalabhyante /
analyzed: apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti anupalabdhyāḥ apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ na upalabhyante
translated: The immeasurables, dhyānas, and formless attainments are not apprehended due to the non-apprehension of the immeasurables, dhyānas, and formless attainments.

original: evaṃ daśa tathāgatabalāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmānupalabdhyā aṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmā nopalabhyante /
analyzed: evam daśa tathāgata balāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharma an upalabdhyāḥ aṣṭādaśā āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ na upalabhyante
translated: Thus, the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are not apprehended due to the non-apprehension of the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: iti bhāvanāmārge dvitīyagrāhyavikalpapratipakṣaḥ
analyzed: iti bhāvanā mārge dvitīya grāhya vikalpa pratipakṣaḥ
translated: Thus, in the path of cultivation, this is the antidote to the second conceptualization of the object to be grasped.

original: srotaāpannaḥ srotaāpannānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: srotaāpannaḥ srotaāpanna anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: A stream-enterer is not apprehended due to the non-apprehension of a stream-enterer. Why is that?

original: na hi subhūte srotaāpanna upalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: na hi subhūte srotaāpannaḥ upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Subhūti, a stream-enterer is not apprehended, because of absolute purity.

original: evaṃ sakṛdāgāmy anāgāmy arhann arhadanupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam sakṛdāgāmī anāgāmī arhan arhat anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate
translated: Thus, a once-returner, a non-returner, and an arhat are not apprehended due to the non-apprehension of an arhat.

original: pratyekabuddhaḥ pratyekabuddhānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: pratyekabuddhaḥ pratyekabuddha anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate
translated: A pratyekabuddha is not apprehended due to the non-apprehension of a pratyekabuddha.

original: yāvat tathāgatas tathāgatānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: yāvat tathāgataḥ tathāgata anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Up to a tathāgata is not apprehended due to the non-apprehension of a tathāgata. Why is that?

original: na hi subhūte tathāgata upalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: na hi subhūte tathāgataḥ upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Subhūti, a tathāgata is not apprehended, because of absolute purity.

original: iti bhāvanāmārge prathamagrāhakavikalpapratipakṣaḥ
analyzed: iti bhāvanā mārge prathama grāhaka vikalpa pratipakṣaḥ
translated: Thus is the antidote to the first grasping at subject in the path of cultivation.

original: srotaāpattiphalaṃ srotaāpattiphalānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: srotaāpatti phalam srotaāpatti phala anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate
translated: The fruit of stream-entry is not apprehended by the non-apprehension of the fruit of stream-entry.

original: evaṃ sakṛdāgāmiphalam ānāgāmiphalam arhattvaṃ pratyekabuddhatvaṃ bodhisattvatvaṃ buddhatvaṃ buddhānupalabdhyā nopalabhyate / evaṃ pramuditā
analyzed: evam sakṛdāgāmi phalam ānāgāmi phalam arhat tvam pratyekabuddha tvam bodhisattva tvam buddha tvam buddha anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate evam pramuditā
translated: Thus the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, arhatship, pratyekabuddhahood, bodhisattvahood, and buddhahood are not apprehended by the non-apprehension of a buddha. Thus the Joyful

original: bhūmir bhūmyanupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /🔽vimalābhūmir bhūmyanupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /🔽prabhākalī bhūmir bhūmyanupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /🔽arciṣmatī bhūmir bhūmyanupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: bhūmiḥ bhūmi anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate  vimalā bhūmiḥ bhūmi anupalabdhyā nā upalabhyate  prabhākalī bhūmiḥ bhūmi anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate  arciṣmatī bhūmiḥ bhūmi anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate
translated: ground is not apprehended by the non-apprehension of a ground.🔽The Stainless ground is not apprehended by the non-apprehension of a ground.🔽The Radiant ground is not apprehended by the non-apprehension of a ground.🔽The Blazing ground is not apprehended by the non-apprehension of a ground.

original: sudurjayā bhūmir bhūmyanupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /🔽abhimukhī bhūmir bhūmyanupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /🔽dūraṅgamā bhūmir bhūmyanupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: su durjayā bhūmiḥ bhūmi anupalabdhyā nā upalabhyate  abhimukhī bhūmiḥ bhūmi anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate  dūraṅgamā bhūmiḥ bhūmi anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate
translated: The Difficult to Conquer ground is not apprehended by the non-apprehension of a ground.🔽The Manifested ground is not apprehended by the non-apprehension of a ground.🔽The Gone Afar ground is not apprehended by the non-apprehension of a ground.

original: acalā bhūmir bhūmyanupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: acalā bhūmiḥ bhūmi anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate
translated: The Immovable ground is not apprehended by the non-apprehension of a ground.

original: sādhumatī bhūmir bhūmyanupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: sādhumatī bhūmiḥ bhūmi anupalabdhyā na upalabhyate
translated: The Good Intelligence ground is not apprehended by the non-apprehension of a ground.

original: dharmameghā bhūmir bhūmyanupalabdhyā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: dharma meghā bhūmiḥ bhūmi anupalabdhyā nā upalabhyate
translated: The Dharma cloud ground is not apprehended due to the non-apprehension of the ground.

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Because of complete purity.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte daśa bhūmayo bhūmyanupalabdhyā nopalabhyante / katamā daśa /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte daśa bhūmayaḥ bhūmi anupalabdhyā na upalabhyante katamāḥ daśa
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the ten grounds are not apprehended due to the non-apprehension of the grounds. Which ten?

original: śuklavidarśanābhūmir gotrabhūmir aṣṭamakabhūmir darśanabhūmis tanūbhūmiḥ vītarāgabhūmiḥ kṛtāvībhūmiḥ pratyekabuddhabhūmir bodhisattvabhūmir
analyzed: śuklavidarśanā bhūmiḥ gotra bhūmiḥ aṣṭamaka bhūmiḥ darśana bhūmiḥ tanū bhūmiḥ vīta rāga bhūmiḥ kṛtāvī bhūmiḥ pratyekabuddha bhūmiḥ bodhisattva bhūmiḥ
translated: The ground of pure bright vision, the ground of lineage, the eighth ground, the ground of seeing, the ground of thinness, the ground of freedom from passion, the ground of expertise, the pratyekabuddha ground, the bodhisattva ground,

original: adhyātmaśūnyatayā prathamā bhūmir nopalabhyate /🔽bahirdhāśūnyatayā prathamā bhūmir nopalabhyate /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatayā prathamā bhūmir nopalabhyate /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatayā prathamā bhūmiḥ na upalabhyate  bahirdhā śūnya tayā prathamā bhūmiḥ nā upalabhyate  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatayā prathamā bhūmiḥ nā upalabhyate
translated: The first ground is not apprehended due to inner emptiness.🔽The first ground is not apprehended due to outer emptiness.🔽The first ground is not apprehended due to inner and outer emptiness.

original: yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatayā prathamā bhūmir nopalabhyate /🔽yāvad daśamī bhūmir adhyātmaśūnyatayā daśamī bhūmir nopalabhyate /🔽bahirdhāśūnyatayā daśamī bhūmir nopalabhyate /
analyzed: yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatayā prathamā bhūmiḥ nā upalabhyate  yāvat daśamī bhūmiḥ adhyātma śūnyatayā daśamī bhūmiḥ na upalabhyate  bahirdhā śūnya tayā daśamī bhūmiḥ na upalabhyate
translated: Up to the first ground is not apprehended due to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.🔽Up to the tenth ground is not apprehended due to inner emptiness.🔽The tenth ground is not apprehended due to outer emptiness.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatayā daśamī bhūmir nopalabhyate /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnya tayā daśamī bhūmiḥ nā upalabhyate
translated: The tenth ground is not apprehended due to inner and outer emptiness.

original: yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatayā daśamī bhūmir nopalabhyate /
analyzed: yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatayā daśamī bhūmiḥ nā upalabhyate
translated: up to the tenth stage, the stage of the knowledge of all aspects, is not apprehended because of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatayā sattvaparipāko nopalabhyate /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya  adhyātma śūnyatayā sattva paripākaḥ na upalabhyate
translated: Because of complete purity.🔽The development of beings is not apprehended because of internal emptiness.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatayā sattvaparipāko nopalabhyate /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatayā sattva paripākaḥ nā upalabhyate
translated: The development of beings is not apprehended because of external emptiness.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatayā sattvaparipāko nopalabhyate /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatayā sattva paripākaḥ nā upalabhyate
translated: The development of beings is not apprehended because of internal and external emptiness.

original: evaṃ yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatayā sattvaparipāko nopalabhyate atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: evam yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatayā sattva paripākaḥ nā upalabhyate atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: In the same way, up to the development of beings is not apprehended because of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, because of complete purity.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatayā buddhakṣetrapariśuddhir nopalabhyate /🔽bahirdhāśūnyatayā buddhakṣetrapariśuddhir nopalabhyate /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatayā buddhakṣetra pariśuddhiḥ nā upalabhyate  bahirdhā śūnyatayā buddhakṣetra pariśuddhiḥ nā upalabhyate
translated: The purification of a buddhafield is not apprehended because of internal emptiness.🔽The purification of a buddhafield is not apprehended because of external emptiness.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatayā buddhakṣetrapariśuddhir nopalabhyate /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatayā buddhakṣetra pariśuddhiḥ nā upalabhyate
translated: The purification of a buddhafield is not apprehended because of internal and external emptiness.

original: evaṃ yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatayā buddhakṣetrapariśuddhir nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatayā buddhakṣetra pariśuddhiḥ nā upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, up to the purification of a buddhafield is not apprehended because of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya
translated: Because of complete purity.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatayā pañca cakṣūṃṣi nopalabhyante /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatayā pañca cakṣūṃṣi na upalabhyante
translated: The five eyes are not apprehended because of internal emptiness.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatayā pañca cakṣūṃṣi nopalabhyante /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatayā pañca cakṣūṃṣi nopalabhyante /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatayā pañca cakṣūṃṣi na upalabhyante  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatayā pañca cakṣūṃṣi na upalabhyante
translated: The five eyes are not apprehended because of external emptiness.🔽The five eyes are not apprehended because of internal and external emptiness.

original: evaṃ yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatayā pañca cakṣūṃṣi nopalabhyante /
analyzed: evam yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatayā pañca cakṣūṃṣi na upalabhyante
translated: In the same way, up to the five eyes are not apprehended because of the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence.

original: atyantaviśuddhitām upādāya / evaṃ hi subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nupalambhayogena sarvadharmāṇāṃ mahāyānena sarvākārajñatāyāṃ niryāsyati /
analyzed: atyanta viśuddhi tām upādāya evam hi subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ n upalambha yogena sarva dharmāṇām mahāyānena sarva ākārajña tāyām niryāsyati
translated: Because of complete purity. In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, through the yoga of non-apprehension of all dharmas, will go forth by the Great Vehicle to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: iti bhāvanāmārge dvitīyagrāhakavikalpapratipakṣaḥ
analyzed: iti bhāvanā mārge dvitīya grāhaka vikalpa pratipakṣaḥ
translated: This is the antidote to the second conceptualization of the grasper on the path of cultivation.

original: ity uktā saṃbhārapratipattiḥ
analyzed: iti uktā saṃbhāra pratipattiḥ
translated: Thus the practice of the accumulations has been explained.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: mahāyānaṃ mahāyānam itīdaṃ bhagavann ucyate /
analyzed: mahāyānam mahā yānam iti idam bhagavan ucyate
translated: Blessed One, this is called the Great Vehicle.

original: sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ lokam abhibhūya niryāsyati tenocyate mahāyānam iti /
analyzed: sa deva mānuṣa asuram lokam abhibhūya niryāsyati tena ucyate mahāyānam iti
translated: It will go forth, having overcome the world with its gods, humans, and asuras. Therefore it is called the Great Vehicle.

original: ākāśasamaṃ tad yānaṃ /
analyzed: ākāśa samam tat yānam
translated: That vehicle is equal to space.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavann ākāśe 'prameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām aparimāṇānāṃ sattvānām avakāśaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan ākāśe prameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām aparimāṇānām sattvānām avakāśaḥ
translated: Blessed One, just as there is room in space for immeasurable, incalculable, and innumerable beings,

original: evam eva bhagavann asmin mahāyāne aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām aparimāṇānāṃ sattvānām avakāśaḥ / evaṃ hi bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan asmin mahāyāne aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām aparimāṇānām sattvānām avakāśaḥ evam hi bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, this Great Vehicle is the space for immeasurable, incalculable, and limitless beings. Thus, Blessed One, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva🔽is like space, Blessed One.🔽The Blessed One said, Subhūti, it is so.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan ākāśasya nāpy āgamo dṛśyate na nirgamo na sthānaṃ dṛśyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan ākāśasya na api āgamaḥ dṛśyate na nirgamaḥ na sthānam dṛśyate
translated: Just as the coming of space is not seen, its going is not seen, and its abiding is not seen,

original: evam evāsya bhagavan mahāyānasya naivāgama upalabhyate na nirgamo na sthānam upalabhyate /🔽tadyathāpi nāma bhagavann ākāśasya nāpi pūrvānta upalabhyate nāparānta upalabhyate
analyzed: evam eva asya bhagavat mahāyānasya na eva āgamaḥ upalabhyate na nirgamaḥ na sthānam upalabhyate  tat yathā api nāma bhagavan ākāśasya na api pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate na apara antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Blessed One, the coming of this Great Vehicle is not perceived, its going is not perceived, and its abiding is not perceived.🔽Just as, Blessed One, the end is not perceived in space, the middle is not perceived, and the middle is not perceived, taking the absence of determination as the basis,

original: na madhya upalabhyate adhyavasamatām upādāya / evam eva bhagavann asya mahāyānasya🔽na pūrvānto nāparānto na madhya upalabhyate /
analyzed: na madhye upalabhyate adhyavasama tām upādāya evam eva bhagavan asya mahāyānasya  na pūrva antaḥ na apara antaḥ na madhyaḥ upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Blessed One, the end of this Great Vehicle

original: adhvasamatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhva sama tām upādāya
translated: is not perceived, the middle is not perceived, taking the equality of the three times as the basis.

original: evam idaṃ bhagavan mahāyānaṃ mahāyānam ity ucyate /
analyzed: evam idam bhagavat mahāyānam mahā yānam iti ucyate
translated: Thus, Blessed One, this Great Vehicle is called the Great Vehicle.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: evam etat subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānaṃ /
analyzed: evam etat subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: Subhūti, it is so. The Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva

original: yad imāḥ ṣaṭ pāramitā /
analyzed: yat imāḥ ṣaḍ pāramitā
translated: is these six perfections.

original: dānapāramitā śīlapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā vīryapāramitā dhyānapāramitā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā prajñāpāramitā
translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: idaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam /
analyzed: idam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: This, Subhūti, is the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānaṃ yad uta sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni sarvasamādhimukhāni śūraṅgamaḥ samādhir vistareṇa kāryaḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam yat uta sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni sarva samādhi mukhāni śūraṅgamaḥ samādhiḥ vistareṇa kāryaḥ
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, is as follows: all the doors of dhāraṇīs, all the doors of samādhis, the heroic progress samādhi should be elaborated on in detail.

original: yāvad asaṅgākāśavimuktinirupalepaḥ samādhiḥ /
analyzed: yāvat asaṅga ākāśa vimukti nirupalepaḥ samādhiḥ
translated: Up to the unattached space liberation stainless samādhi.

original: idaṃ subhūte bodhisatvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam /
analyzed: idam subhūte bodhisatvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: This, Subhūti, is the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānaṃ yad uta adhyātmaśūnyatā bahirdhāśūnyatā adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam yat uta adhyātma śūnyatā bahirdhā śūnyatā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, is as follows: the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena,

original: yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: idaṃ subhūte bodhisatvasya mahāsattvasya / mahāyānam /
analyzed: idam subhūte bodhisatvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: This, Subhūti, is the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānaṃ yad uta catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam yat uta catvāri smṛti upasthānāni
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, is as follows: the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: catvāri samyakprahāṇāni catvāra ṛddhipādāḥ pañcendriyāṇi pañca balāni sapta bodhyaṅgāny
analyzed: catvāri samyakprahāṇāni catvāraḥ ṛddhipādāḥ pañca indriyāṇi pañca balāni sapta bodhyaṅgāni
translated: The four right efforts, the four legs of psychic power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening,

original: āryāṣṭaṅgo mārgaḥ catvāry apramāṇāni catvāri dhyānāni catasra ārūpyasamāpattayo daśa
analyzed: ārya aṣṭaṅgaḥ mārgaḥ catvāri apramāṇāni catvāri dhyānāni catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ daśa
translated: the noble eightfold path, the four immeasurables, the four meditations, the four formless attainments, the ten

original: tathāgatabalāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: tathāgata balāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: totalities, the ten perfections, the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four confidences, the four special knowledges, the eighteen dharmas exclusive to a Buddha.

original: idaṃ subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam /
analyzed: idam subhūte bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya mahāyānam
translated: This, Subhūti, is the great vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: yat punaḥ subhūtir evam āha /
analyzed: yat punar subhūtiḥ evam āha
translated: And again, Subhūti, you said:

original: sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ lokam abhibhūya tad yānaṃ niryāsyatīti /
analyzed: sa deva mānuṣa asuram lokam abhibhūya tat yānam niryāsyati iti
translated: That vehicle will go forth, having overcome the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: katamaś ca sadevamānuṣāsuro loko yad uta kāmadhātū rūpadhātur ārūpyadhātuḥ
analyzed: katamaḥ ca sa deva mānuṣa asuraḥ lokaḥ yat uta kāmadhātuḥ rūpadhātuḥ ārūpyadhātuḥ
translated: And what is the world with its gods, humans, and asuras? Namely, the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: sacet subhūte kāmadhātus tathatā avitathatā ananyatathatā aviparītaṃ bhūtaṃ tattvaṃ
analyzed: saced subhūte kāmadhātuḥ tathatā avitathatā ananya tathatā aviparītam bhūtam tattvam
translated: Subhūti, if the desire realm were suchness, not other than suchness, not inverted, real,

original: yathāvan nityo dhruvaḥ śāśvato 'vipariṇāmadharmī bhāvo 'bhaviṣyan nābhāvo naivedaṃ
analyzed: yathāvat nityaḥ dhruvaḥ śāśvataḥ vipariṇāma dharmī bhāvaḥ bhaviṣyat na abhāvaḥ na eva idam
translated: if it were existent, not nonexistent, and eternal, permanent, stable, and not subject to change,🔽then this vehicle would not go forth, having overcome the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: mahāyānaṃ sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ lokam abhibhūya nirayāsyat /
analyzed: mahāyānam sa deva mānuṣa asuram lokam abhibhūya nirayāsyat
translated: The Great Vehicle would not surpass and go beyond the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: yasmāt tarhi subhūte kāmadhātuḥ kalpito viṭhapitaḥ saṃdarśito 'yathāvat sarvam anityam adhruvam aśāśvataṃ vipariṇāmadharmi /
analyzed: yasmāt tarhi subhūte kāmadhātuḥ kalpitaḥ saṃdarśitaḥ yathāvat sarvam anityam adhruvam aśāśvatam vipariṇāma dharmi
translated: But, Subhūti, because the desire realm is imagined, fabricated, and displayed, all of it is impermanent, unstable, not eternal, and subject to change.

original: abhāvas tasmād idaṃ mahāyānaṃ sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ lokam abhibhūya niryāsyati /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ tasmāt idam mahāyānam sa deva mānuṣa asuram lokam abhibhūya niryāsyati
translated: Because it is a non-existence, this Great Vehicle surpasses and goes beyond the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: sacet subhūte rūpadhātus tathatābhaviṣyad avitathatā ananyatathatā aviparītaṃ bhūtaṃ
analyzed: saced subhūte rūpa dhātuḥ tathatā abhaviṣyat avitathatā ananya tathatā aviparītam bhūtam
translated: Subhūti, if the form realm were suchness, not other than suchness, not inverted,

original: tattvaṃ yathāvan nityo dhruvaḥ śāśvato 'vipariṇāmadharmī bhāvo 'bhaviṣyan nābhāvo
analyzed: tattvam yathāvat nityaḥ dhruvaḥ śāśvataḥ vipariṇāma dharmī bhāvaḥ bhaviṣyat
translated: real, true, just so, permanent, stable, eternal, and not subject to change, and if it were an existent, not a non-existent,

original: naivedaṃ mahāyānaṃ sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ lokam abhibhūya nirayāsyat /
analyzed: na eva idam mahāyānam sa deva mānuṣa asuram lokam abhibhūya nirayāsyat
translated: this Great Vehicle would not surpass and go beyond the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: yasmāt tarhi subhūte rūpadhātuḥ kalpito viṭhapitaḥ saṃdarśito 'yathāvat sarvam idam anityam adhruvam aśāśvataṃ vipariṇāmadharmi /🔽abhāvas tasmān mahāyānaṃ /
analyzed: yasmāt tarhi subhūte rūpa dhātuḥ kalpitaḥ saṃdarśitaḥ yathāvat sarvam idam anityam adhruvam aśāśvatam vipariṇāma dharmi  abhāvaḥ tasmāt mahāyānam
translated: But, Subhūti, because the form realm is imagined, fabricated, and displayed, all of this is impermanent, unstable, not eternal, and subject to change.

original: sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ lokam abhibhūya niryāsyati /
analyzed: sa deva mānuṣa asuram lokam abhibhūya niryāsyati
translated: Because it is a non-existence, this Great Vehicle surpasses and goes beyond the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: sacet subhūte ārūpyadhātus tathatābhaviṣyad avitathatā ananyatathatā aviparītaṃ bhūtaṃ
analyzed: saced subhūte ārūpya dhātuḥ tathatā abhaviṣyat avitathatā ananya tathatā aviparītam bhūtam
translated: Subhūti, if the formless realm were suchness, not other than suchness, not other than the unaltered nature, not inverted, real,

original: tattvaṃ yathāvan nityo dhruvaḥ śāśvato 'vipariṇāmadharmī bhāvo 'bhaviṣyan nābhāvo
analyzed: tattvam yathāvat nityaḥ dhruvaḥ śāśvataḥ vipariṇāma dharmī bhāvaḥ bhaviṣyat
translated: the truth, as it is, permanent, stable, eternal, and not subject to change, and if it were an existent, not a non-existent,

original: naivedaṃ mahāyānaṃ sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ lokam abhibhūya nirayāsyat /
analyzed: na eva idam mahāyānam sa deva mānuṣa asuram lokam abhibhūya nirayāsyat
translated: then this Great Vehicle would not surpass and go beyond the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: yasmāt tarhi subhūte ārūpyadhātuḥ kalpito viṭhapitaḥ saṃdarśito 'yathāvat sarvam idam anityam adhruvam aśāśvataṃ vipariṇāmadharmi /
analyzed: yasmāt tarhi subhūte ārūpya dhātuḥ kalpitaḥ saṃdarśitaḥ yathāvat sarvam idam anityam adhruvam aśāśvatam vipariṇāma dharmi
translated: But because, Subhūti, the formless realm is imagined, fabricated, and displayed, all this is impermanent, unstable, not eternal, and subject to change.

original: abhāvas tasmān mahāyānaṃ /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ tasmāt mahāyānam
translated: It is non-existent, therefore it is the Great Vehicle.

original: sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ lokam abhibhūya niryāsyati /
analyzed: sa deva mānuṣa asuram lokam abhibhūya niryāsyati
translated: It surpasses and goes beyond the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: sacet subhūte rūpaṃ tathatābhaviṣyad avitathatā ananyatathatā /
analyzed: saced subhūte rūpam tathatā abhaviṣyat avitathatā ananya tathatā
translated: Subhūti, if form were suchness, not other than suchness, not other than the unaltered nature,

original: aviparītaṃ bhūtaṃ tattvaṃ yathāvan nityaṃ dhruvaṃ śāśvatam avipariṇāmadharmi bhāvo 'bhaviṣyan nābhāvo naivedaṃ mahāyānaṃ sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ
analyzed: aviparītam bhūtam tattvam yathāvat nityam dhruvam śāśvatam a vipariṇāma dharmi bhāvaḥ bhaviṣyat na abhāvaḥ na eva idam mahāyānam sa deva mānuṣa asuram
translated: not inverted, real, the truth, as it is, permanent, stable, eternal, and not subject to change, and if it were an existent, not a non-existent, then this Great Vehicle would not surpass and go beyond the world with its gods, humans, and asuras,

original: lokam abhibhūya nirayāsyat /
analyzed: lokam abhibhūya nirayāsyat
translated: and would not liberate beings from the prison of cyclic existence.

original: yasmāt tarhi subhūte rūpaṃ kalpitaṃ viṭhapitaṃ saṃdarśitam anityam adhruvam aśāśvatam avipariṇāmadharmi /
analyzed: yasmāt tarhi subhūte rūpam kalpitam viṭhapitam saṃdarśitam anityam adhruvam aśāśvatam a vipariṇāma dharmi
translated: Subhūti, because form is imagined, fabricated, and displayed, it is impermanent, unstable, not eternal, and subject to change.

original: abhāvas tasmān mahāyānaṃ sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ lokam abhibhūya niryāsyati /
analyzed: abhāvaḥ tasmāt mahāyānam sa deva mānuṣa asuram lokam abhibhūya niryāsyati
translated: Therefore, the Great Vehicle, surpassing the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, will go forth.

original: evaṃ vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: So it is with feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: sacet subhūte vijñānaṃ tathatābhaviśyad avitathatā ananyatathatā aviparītaṃ bhūtaṃ tattvaṃ /
